title: Good Thing I Use a Glass Screen Protector...

thread.text:
So, yesterday I did a bad thing.
Accidentally pushed my phone off the bed with my foot and it smacked onto the hardwood floor; screen-side down. Oh, noes!
Luckily, there was no damage to the operation of the phone - it unlocked as normal and I saw no visible damage to the screen. However, when I locked my phone and examined the now-turned-off screen, I had two big cracks along the middle of the screen. Sad! But my tempered glass screen protector saved the day! That kind of a fall would have definitely damaged my screen had it not been protected.
I'm a little worried that there could be some damage to my actual screen; but I think my screen protector is thick enough that that probably isn't the case. Even though I'm hoping to get a new phone soon, I love my Honor 8 and want to keep it as a worthy alternative and backup device; so having it in good condition means a lot to me.
Good to know that my paranoia of my precious phones breaking on me sometimes comes in handy!
Glad that the tgsp did its job! I am not using one in my honor 8 but am thinking that maybe I should start using one

title: Designer66

thread.text:
Question regarding using RAW in the pro mode on Honor 8. When I take photos using the manual settings, I notice the RAW/DANG file is much
Brighter than the .jpg of the same shot. Is this normal when shooting
Raw with Huawei phones?
Thanks
The RAW isn't processed the same way the JPEG is. You have to edit the file yourself and export it as a JPEG.

replies.text:
Thanks for the response back. I'm talking about just after I take a shot in the Pro mode
and I get the dng file and the .jpg file of the same shot and the DNG/RAW file is much brighter
than the .jpg. This is before I even start to process the raw or .jpg file. On most of my
other cameras the RAW is fairly close to the EV of the .jpg. Sometimes on the honor 8
the RAW is very close to the .jpg, but other times it might be 2 stops brighter. I use
Lightroom CC, Snapseed, DXO OP 11 and Capture one to process most of my RAW files.
I do notice that sometimes when I do not alter the SS or ISO in pro mode the shots are
closer most of the time. Of course I like to keep the ISO as low as possible for noise
and shoot a long exposure on a tripod. Other than this small problem most of my shots
are really nice and a few clients asked me if I had purchased a new camera. I have lately
been using my Honor 8 with the Beastgrip.com device and the approx. 21mm wide angle 
lens. Overall I am excited with the Honor 8 and I often wonder how much better the 
camera would be on a Huawei P10 plus or the new Mate 10 Pro?
Thanks again,

I think it's just Huaweis software that unlike other phones/camera doesn't keep the preview for the RAW the same as the processed JPEG. I think that if I shoot RAW+JPEG on my DSLR I can switch the JPEG to black and white (might not be possible but I think I have done it) and the result will be a colour RAW (preview) and a black and white JPEG. The software could choose to show the preview for the RAW in black and white to stay true to the JPEG, but it would still of course retain all the colour data. 
The camera sensor and software is more or less the same on all those three phones, I think. But the lenses is somewhat different. The P10 and Mate 10 had the Leica brand that might just be PR but they do have a brighter lens. The Honor 8 is a f.2.2 and the on the P10 you have the same but the P10+ is a f.1.8 lens. The Mate 10 goes all the way to f.1.6. 
If I picked the right photos there is a RAW processed in Lightroom, RAW processed in Snapseed and the JPEG attached. Shot and edited on my P10+

title: Battery issues after more than a year of usage

thread.text: I was reading the Honor 8 subreddit and found out that a few users have battery issues where the phone would shut down at 30-40%. Has this happened to anyone here especially those who have crossed the 1 year mark with the phone a while back.

replies.text:
I have the same issue from time to time. It doesn't happen everyday and hasn't happened in about a month now. See my post here. https://forums.androidcentral.com/ho...ting-down.html
On a side note, when it was around 0 degrees here and I went out to take pictures in the snow, my phone would just turn off after being out for a minute or so. I'm guessing from extreme cold?

That's so awful! I'm so sorry that is happening to you; but that's good that it hasn't happened in a while! Yes, phones shutting down in extreme cold is normal. My co-worker's iPhone shut down when it was about -26 outside. I think it also depends on things like how long the phone is outside; if it's actually exposed to the cold or put away in a purse or backpack; etc.

I think it just depends on the type of battery. My friends and I went to the beach early morning one and it was around 6-7°C and their iPhones started turning off, whereas my Honor 8 and my friend's Galaxy S6 was doing just fine.
Absolutely. There are a lot of variables to consider, for sure!
Well it is specd from 32-95 F, so if you are at 0 F then it is well below the operating temperature. Heck even 0 C is literally at the limit and I wouldn't be surprised if it had problems

thread.text:

I've noticed that my battery life - though still very good - is obviously not as great as it was a year or even nine months ago; but I've never had the phone shut down like that. title: Early shutdown problems with Honor 8, especially with Snapchat

thread.text:
Hi.
So I've had this phone for little over a year now and since about last summer I've had problems with early shutdowns where my phone has died when it reached about 40% (first it was 20, then 30, then seemed stable for a while at 40).
But last week when my phone died for the first time in a while the problems have gotten a lot worse. If I use Snapchat with 80% battery or lower it restarts my phone right away. When restarted, it tells me I have the same % as before but if I then open Snapchat again it restarts my phone again and tells me I have anywhere between 1% to 30% left (any number between there is essentially the same, though) and I have to charge it. If I let it run without using Snapchat it dies at around 65%.
I've been googling for a few days trying to fix it without luck. Most search results circle around similar problems with the Nexus 6, but nothing on Honor 8. I've been looking into getting a new battery which would cost me about $50 which I think might be worth a try (I don't have warranty left), but I also don't want to spend that kind of money if it doesn't solve the problem. 
What do you all think? Would a new battery solve the problem or should I look at other solutions? Thanks in advance.

Welcome to Android Central!
I'm sorry you are going through this - that is a very frustrating problem to have. It sounds like your battery is failing you. I don't use Snapchat much, but is it updated to its most recent software? 
A new battery may help, for sure, but since your phone is over a year old, it is hard to say that the battery issue could purely be the battery itself (if that makes any sense). Have you noticed and freeze-ups, lagging, or anything else like that?
I would recommend contacting Honor Customer Support as well to see what their take on this would be. This could either be hardware- or software-related; so hopefully they may have a better idea of what it could be. But that may only be possible if and when someone takes a look at your phone.
My LG G3 had this same issue (battery being mean), so indefinitely understand your frustration. Please keep us posted.
If you are technically inclined then you can root and under clock the cpu which may help, or even shutting off the big cores. That would of course hinder performance though.

I sometimes do not mind if I don't get the latest updates; but in this situation, I do. It's too bad, as the Honor 8 is only about 18 months old; and therefore well within its 2-year lifespan to receive updates. That and the fact that it's not really a super old iteration makes it a tougher pill to swallow. 
It won't make me change my mind about the phone and Honor - I still love my Honor 8 - but I'm definitely disappointed. And a little confused.
That will definitely impact my decision to purchase another one of their products. The inability to get timely software updates in Android handsets is the biggest problem the platform faces.

I couldn't agree more... on Android, there's only one choice if you want timely updates, and that's Pixel... even then, Google doesn't promise updates for nearly as long as Apple.
These issues may not matter much to the general public, but they should... security is critical and Google needs to fix this problem.
Other OEMs seem to be avoiding the requirement to incorporate Project Treble into their new releases by releasing with Nougat then quickly updating to Oreo, so there's little hope that this situation will be remedied any time soon.

Agreed. I don't care much for having "tweaked or improved features (unless you're talking about battery life; but even then, I can usually take it or leave it);" but I draw the line at security. Security updates are crucial; especially with viruses, malware, and hacking becoming ever more prevalent. Sure, you can be careful, but you need more than just an awareness. You actually need the improved software to defend your product that you spent your hard-earned money on.

title: Honor 8 Still Worth it in 2018?

thread.text:
I've owned an H8 before and loved it! I sold it a few months back but found a GREAT deal on one recently so I'm thinking about snatching one up again. But in 2018 it is still worth it?

Hi there!
I still own my white Honor 8 and to be honest, even though I'm on the hunt for my next phone, it's *so hard* to put this one down. I still cannot believe how well it's held up (13 months) with barely any issues; especially given its price. Many flagships don't even last that long without encurring some issues!

title: Weird problem with Honor 8

thread.text:
Yesterday, when I plug into my Honor 8 for charging, I notice that the charging light did not come on. To make things worse, I notice the usb C plug at the phone end was getting hotter and hotter to the point where it started smelling like heated plastic. I unplugged it immediately and the plug actually burned my hand when I touched it.
I then tried plugging in a different cable and then a different adapter, but encountered the same issue, so the problem is with the phone. I even swabbed the usb c socket with some contact cleaner, but it heats up immediately when I plug in the phone. I call HONOR tech support and they said to return it for warranty repair. 
But what do you think is happening here, a short on the phone battery? I didn't drop it or spill liquid on it.
Paul

Wow, definitely sounds like a wiring issue. Good thing you were nearby and noticed easily could have started a fire. of your phone is less than a year it should be covered. I wonder if from just normal use of plugging and unplugging knocked a connection or loose.

Are you alright? How badly did you get burned? I'm glad you contacted Honor customer service. Be sure to tell them you got injured. Do not plug in your phone again, and be sure to keep us posted on what happens next. Glad you are safe!
Have you checked to make sure the port is clear? I found when I cleaned mine out it had a lot of lint in there. This sort of thing can cause shorts too.
Yeah I would try to blow compressed air into the port to see if there's anything stuck in there

title: Why I Quit the Honor 8, What I Replaced It With, and Why I Came Back

thread.text:
The Honor 8 served me very well, up until one fateful day when I dropped it in the snow. After that, I ran into the oddest of issues, including 1) Wi-Fi, bluetooth, and NFC radios not working 2) the phone factory resetting itself in the middle of the night 3) the mysterious disappearance of the Downoads and Smart Remote apps 4) Honor support claiming my IMEI and serial number didn't exist 5) random bootloops 6) the camera defaulting to monochrome, and a host of other less significant issues. I was utterly bewildered as to how a single drop could cause all these problems, especially the ones that seem to be purely software-based. The last straw for me was when the Honor 8 wiped itself (the day before my final exams, too), so, with resignation, I ordered a Moto X4 prime edition.
My time with the Moto X4 was grudgingly tolerative. I noticed every slow animation caused by the lesser processor, and frowned at the weaker battery life. But most of all, I missed that Huawei camera. I longed for the perfect photos I would get out of my Honor 8. Alas, since Honor took down the recovery files, I was no longer able to restore my phone's firmware. I logged off of these forums and went through my life.
But then, inspiration came to me in the early hours of the morning. I used HiSuite and updated my Honor 8 to the latest security patch, and suddenly, it was back to normal. Everything was and is currently working perfectly. Support still tells me my phone doesn't exist, but maybe it's better that way. Maybe Huawei doesn't need to know that I brought my phone back to life.
In any case, I am back!
Lumi Valo
Glad to hear that you are back!
Welcome back to the shiny world of Honor 8!

title: Why am I not getting signal? Honor 8

thread.text:
Hello, 
So recently I've noticed that my phone (dual sim Huawei Honor 8) has been stuck on no service. I'm using the giffgaff network and would usually get 3g/4g signal in my area and nobody that I know on the same network are experiencing any problems.
I've tried factory resetting the phone and making sure that the correct apn settings are put in but still no luck.
The only time I have managed to somewhat fix the issue is when I change the slot that the sim card is in and I can manage to have it working in the 2g slot. But as soon as I change the preferences for the slot to 3g/4g the signal disappears. 
So I'm currently just using my phone on 2g which isnt convenient at all! 
It's been like this for almost a month now and is beyond frustrating! It worked perfectly fine before this happened and I can't think of anything would have caused the issue.
*I've just tested out a SIM from a different network and the same thing is happening, it seems to me that my phone doesn't want to receive 3g/4g signal? As both Sims work okay on 2g but as soon as I select 3g or 4g the signal goes* 
I would be great full for any help!
Thank you!

I was going to suggest popping your SIM card into another device to see how it fares; but it looks like you've done similar with inputting a SIM from a different network into your device. Have you had the phone for a month? I would contact Honor via their customer service if this continues to happen. Please keep us updated on the situation!
May depend on which model of the phone you bought. Not all of them have the same bands. Do you happen to know which variant you have? (check in the settings under about phone)
Any updates on your situation, OP?
Hey, I've been having the same issue and wonder if anybody found a fix for this?
This issue almost always fixes itself for me when I restart the phone.

i think i know why no signal..
1.only 1 sim can use 4g or 3g data and another one only 2g signal available.. 
2.in your country maybe no morw signal 2g.only 3g and above only can use..that why u do not get any signal for 2g sim standby.

title: Who here would drop their Honor 8 for an iPhone 8 if you had a chance to?

thread.text:
So as I did I had a great opportunity to get the new iPhone 8 and thus I decided to drop my Honor 8 to get the iPhone 8. I ask because EMUI is a lot like IOS as I sit here and type this I remember back very clearly that EMUI is really very similar to IOS. I believe it’s why some of us like EMUI due to how smooth and fluid the software is much like IOS. Plus settings are a lot like IOS. I can tell you guys I’m so excited to have my iPhone back. Today I found a Black Friday sale on a iPad Pro 9.7 which I owned in 2016 which now the 10.5 inch pro took its place. I wanted that 10.5 inch pro and actually bought it but I took it back thinking I needed to be more practical and save money and got the current iPad 9.7 which does not support the Apple Pencil and way less features. Well today I found a iPad Pro 9.7 inch 256g cellular on amazon where they had it on sale for $699!! That’s not that much more than what I paid for my current iPad with way less features which I never even pulled the plastic off of. I’m taking it back tomorrow and returning it and picking up the Apple Pencil again with a red pencil case. I’ll take lots of notes with the pencil and the iPad Pro has True Tone display, more power and four sets of stereo speakers. Also it’s built with a better screen which is anti glare and there is no gap between the screen and underside of the internal part of the iPad. In other words it’s far superior built than the current iPad that I had bought but thankfully never even opened it up as I just knew I wanted that discontinued iPad Pro 9.7 2016 model which is basically just like the new 10.5 inch iPad Pro. Plus I’ve got two keyboard cases I ordered for it coming and a regular case without a keyboard. 
I have to care for my sick mother and take her to the doctor almost daily while she gets her radiation and chemo treatments so I’ll be able to take my iPad Pro with me while I wait in the waiting room on her and have internet access as I got the cellular model. At $699 for a iPad Pro 9.7 with 256g is an awesome deal! Still expensive but compared to what it would have cost me last year it’s a rock bottom price. I probably saved $250 to $300 bucks today on that iPad Pro. I’m looking forward to the two Keyboard cases I ordered for it too. I like making my ipads turn into mini laptops which is why I ended up ordering two of them. I’ve is more heavy and one more slim and thin. They arent cheap but Black Friday helped me out on them as they were on sale. 
So anyways how many of you given the great opportunity would let their honor 8 go to get the new iPhone 8. I’m not sure how many of you have used IOS before but IOS 11 is far better than IOS has ever been before.

title: Honor 8 warranty repair inquiry

thread.text:
I really liked the Honor 8 as it was working great for 6 months, but it couldn't go more wrong from there. The phone died big time after an hour run in hot weather. I suspect, overheating caused hardware failure. Service team returned it physically damaged (careless removal of back glass cover) and unrepaired. They claimed liquid damage, which voids the warranty. I continue fighting this, as I know the phone was never exposed to any liquid, and requested any substantiating evidences supporting their claim to be shared.
Did anyone have similar experience? Any advice dealing with Huawei customer service would be greatly appreciated.
Not Huawei specific, but In my experience, you will get further with a complaint to the bbb and state ag, assuming that regular channels isn't working.
I'm so sorry this happened to you, OP. Please keep us in the loop on what happens next. Hopefully they can compensate you in some way for what has happened.

Thank you for the replies. The way the story develops doesn't look good. I am being patient with Huawei as it is my first customer experience with the company, but it seems other options for resolving the situation may need to be explored. 
I was told that the case was escalated to the complaints department and someone should be in contact in few days via email. Not receiving an email, I called back and they wanted to get the phone back to the service center (in Fort Worth, TX) for "repair". Digging a bit deeper, it turns out the repair means fixing the damage they introduced to the body, but not the hardware. They still stand by the notion of liquid damage, although without any proof. We concluded the call on a promise that someone from the complaints to be in contact.

It looks like dpham00 was right—after a month, I am not getting any closer to resolving these issues with the customer service. They keep postponing the timeline saying that they still wait for a response from the service/repair team. Such customer service is simply unacceptable. They would not even get back to me as they promise, and I am tired of keep calling back to get the same message over and over again. It's time to get the BBB involved. I hope and trust they would be able to resolve these issues in a fair and timely manner. And more importantly, increase awareness among the current and future Huawei customers.
Sorry to hear that. Hopefully escalating it outside of Huawei will get things moving for you.
So sorry to hear that things aren't going well for you, OP! Please continue to keep us in the loop! Hopefully things get moving along for you soon!

Huawei chose not to answer the complaint. The BBB has made several contact attempts, but the company has not responded within the timeframe, leading to closure of the complaint as unanswered. I guess the only positive outcome from this is that the BBB will reflect the company's failure to promptly give attention to the matter in the Reliability Report, that is publicly available to consumers.
I called the customer service after receiving this notice from BBB and was told that the ticket is still pending and that the "ASC will try to start taking better pictures of the liquid damage." I will try to engage the AG State Office now.

replies.text: Wow, I am really disappointed that they seem to not be taking your claim and the BBB's messages seriously... Hopefully this ordeal will end soon for you.
Yeah it is poor business practice to do so. Hopefully they will change in the future.

It's so disappointing. If they really want to put themselves on the map, they *have* to deliver excellent customer service. If they push out great phones but sub-par customer service, they will not get the kind of business they're looking for.

Wow, that sucks. Keep us informed. Even if the complaints might not get resolved, at least it's on record. And if many people have a problem on record and they refuse to respond particularly to state ag, then state ag might decide to take action.

thread.text:
I bought my Honor 8 in September 2016 and started having issues with the proximity sensors about 4 weeks ago. Auto rotate stopped working, compass app stopped working and the phone did not turn on when done with a call and pulling it away from my face to end call. So, I called Honor and they had me send my phone back to Texas for repair under warranty as my phone had 1 month left on warranty. It was returned to me without repair and a note stating that it had liquid damage. I called customer service and 100% disputed that it had liquid damage, but beyond that it was returned with more issues than it had when I sent it in. The back of the phone is coming off, the camera is completely blurry and the fingerprint id feature under the settings menu is gone. I have a fingerprint reader, but no fingerprint id in the settings menu. So, now the phone is for the most part completely useless.
I have contacted Honor at least 6 times and they tell me that it is being "escalated" but nobody ever gets back to me. The customer service # is just a call center in Mexico and they cannot do anything. They keep saying that they are waiting for info back from the repair center....but they never have any info. They just keep telling me that the phone has water damage and they don't even address the fact that it was sent back to me in a much worse condition than when it was sent in. So, it sounds like my issue is the same as what you are experiencing. I'm assuming that Huawei (Honor) has a policy at the repair center to state that any phone returned has water damage so they don't have to repair them. At this point I don't know what to do.

Thank you for the reply. The experience you have described is indeed very much like mine. In my case, it started with a series of strange behavior, like "Charging other device via USB" notification, not responsive "Smart Key", random launch of applications set to be opened with the smart key, and ended with the power button not working, fingerprint sensor issue, and most recently some pictures taken being only partially recorded. The customer service is not helpful at all. One representative tried to convince me that the decision of the liquid damage has been made based on the pictures of the phone that I have sent them. The other mentioned about a humidity sensor being active as the phone was opened (but it seems like they do not keep a record of that). Yet another logic offered was that the service center would rather repair the device than reject for any reason, because it is the only way for them to get paid. I do not know if it is true, but it is also possible that they are not able to keep up with repair requests, so that they choose to reject some. The fact that they introduce additional damage during the service is just so wrong.
At this point, I requested a written resolution on my ticket (which is pending since 7/10/2017), basically an official statement regarding Huawei Device USA position. It is something that the complaints department promised to deliver after the phone was returned from the repair, which was more than a month ago. Yesterday I spoke about this with a customer service supervisor, who ensured that the letter will be sent out by the end of the day, putting the ticket to bed. Not surprisingly, that was not the case, and yet again they are asking to wait additional 48-72 hours. I really have no idea what else can be done at this point. Hopefully the resolution letter may bring some ideas. I also think it would be great if we continue discussing this and, with the help of the community, we may get the things moving.

I understand that many people will have damaged their phone from water and claim that they did not. In my case I can say with 100% conviction that my phone never touched water. However, it is my word against the "qualified technician" at Huawei's repair center in Texas. However, these are the same technicians that sent my phone back with further problems. I also find it strange the the customer service center is actually not a customer service center, it is merely a call center located in Mexico with the repair center a 3rd part vendor located in Texas. The customer service center has no authority to do anything, to find any resolution. So, I'm actually not sure why they even have it, other than to provide customers with an address to the repair center in Texas.
I wonder how many other people out there have been told their phone has "liquid damage" and cannot be repaired under warranty. Based on my experience so far, and based on the warranty logistics model that Huawei has in place in the U.S; I am starting to think that the "liquid damage" finding is standard practice for their warranty protocol so that they do not have to fix phones.
I have filed a complaint with the BBB and will start contacting Huawei at every phone number they list until I get someone on the phone. If Huawei wants to actually create a footprint in the United States by selling their products here, they have a lot to do with respect to customer service. They should take a look at when Best Buy first came to China and folded....because they didn't understand the Chinese market. Huawei needs to understand the market here.
I hope others reply to this with their experience.

replies.text: That would explain their sales numbers growth over the last couple of years. Yet unconfirmed, there are reports about Huawei overtaking Apple sales.
I thought it is worth opening a new thread just for this—The device has suffered liquid damage which voids the warranty - Really?

thread.text: That's fraud if they are claiming water damage where there is none. In addition to the bbb,i would file a complaint with your state AG and proceed per the dispute resolution clause of your warranty.

replies.text: I do not find the dispute resolution clause in Huawei Device USA Inc. Limited Warranty. Am I missing anything?

Huawei sure does explore fraudulent practices: first, by not providing customers with any proof of alleged liquid damage; second, by not addressing damages introduced by their repair team; and thirdly, (at least in my case) by not answering the BBB complaint.

thread.text: It may be worth getting an independent opinion from the third party, a qualified professional, who would be able to open the phone and verify "liquid damage."

@west coast: I remembered that prior to receiving the phone back from the repair with the liquid damage letter inside, there was an email sent to me saying that the unit was repaired. I realize that it may be just a system glitch, but wonder if you have received the same.

i did receive an email with a tracking number but cannot remember if it said that my "repaired" unit was being sent back. i have tried going back through my emails to find it, but for some reason it is gone. can you send me the email address yours came from so i can search further?
I came across an old but interesting article: Phone warranty voided by "water damage"? Here's what to do about it.

i have collected all of the phone numbers listed by Huawei for their company and am going to start calling every single one of them until I get someone on the phone who is not in Mexico and who has the authority to do something. The thing is that you have to be extremely persistent and keep calling in order to get it to go anywhere which take a lot of time. In the end, it will take the consumers to stop buying their products in order for it to make a difference. However, my hope is that people read these threads before they purchase so they at least know what they're getting in to.
@west coast: Would you mind sharing the phone numbers you have gathered?
FYI: New York, it's time to speak out for your right to repair—the Fair Repair Act

After not getting much luck by contacting the Hotline, I sent an email to support (honor.us@huawei.com) requesting to provide evidence of liquid damage and to address damage introduced by the repair technician. And surprisingly I have got a response. Regardless that it is poorly written and does not contain much information that was not known already, it is a written confirmation of long pending escalation with a new ticket number. At least now, it looks like it will be possible to follow up via email.
That's great news! At least there is some follow-up, granted you still have a long way to go.
Glad that you at least got a response! Keep us posted! Hopefully things continue on from here.
The more I am digging in, the stronger my wonder if anyone ever in modern history was able to fix anything under Huawei Device USA Inc. Limited Warranty.
The below link lists the numbers for Huawei. Look under Huawei Device USA HeadquartersHuawei United States - Contact Us

I am not sure how it's possible, but clearly the customer service of this poor company is just nonexistent. I followed up on my original request and wanted to get to know when I should expect an update on my case, that is pending for over 2 months now. And the reply just left me in stupor. Maybe you guys could help me understand what it all means.

That's... Weird. I don't understand how they don't seem to have any updates for you - it's almost as if they don't even know which case to which you're referring. This is a very poor excuse for customer service.

Another follow up with more or less the same outcome:
Clearly the company cannot providing any evidence that the fault was caused by liquid and not an existing fault.

By virtue of conducting abusive business practices (i.e. not being able to providing evidence of liquid damage, not fulfilling the obligations set by the Limited Warranty, and not addressing the additional damages introduced by the repair team), the Huawei Device USA Inc. is breaking the U.S. consumer protection law. This leaves no other option but taking the case to the court.
The water damage could be that the Headphone jack port is indicating purple color.If i remember correctly thats where some manufacturers place the indicator on closed phone now.

Finally, the customer service sent me a picture of an opened phone. There is no explanation provided as to what the picture shows, besides: "we attached the picture and also we added some red circles to help you identify the liquid damage." I do see there is something going on around the fingerprint scanner, but I am not an expert to say what it may mean. I suppose the scanner might be a weak point of the phone, allowing moisture to penetrate inside. @Kelvin N: I was also under impression that there should be humidity indicator(s) somewhere (even one of the representatives mentioned that upon inspection it was activated), but they seem to do not draw the conclusion from an indicator. Not sure even there is any inside the Honor 8. What does the picture tell you, folks?
Customer service still did not address the damages introduced by the technician nor provided a formal resolution on the ticket.
I was glad to know that the Office of the Attorney General have picked up the complaint. I hope they will be able to obtain a statement of Huawei's position.AG_Office.pdf
Thanks for keeping us posted. I really hope that Huawei picks up the ball here.
Hope people, who may be in the same situation now or those who may run into it in the future, would find this information somewhat helpful.
Ugh, such a headache. Thanks for keeping us posted.
i had the same experience. huawei company didnt repair my device which had wifi issue. They asked for 15000 rs for repair. if they are charging us for repair then warranty is useless.

Sure they can do that. Huawei Device USA Inc. Limited Warranty has plenty of holes, allowing it to be voided. For instance, as per Section 7A:These clauses are open for interpretation, which is not in favour of the customers.

thread.text: I’ve never owned a HTC before even as many phones as I went through for some Reason HTC never interested me but that being said I never really researched them either but I’d say overall I’ve heard good things about them. I’ve owned Sony. Their updates are about average or typical in terms of how often they update. I know some of you pointed out the Red HTC which was awesome looking. I wouldn’t have minded getting one of those while I was using android but I was more into Motorola phones. I liked the Moro Z line. The Moto mods were fun to mess around with as you could change the look of your phone every day. My favorite moto z was the budget Z phone which was the Z Play. Absolutely the best battery I’ve ever used. It lasted forever and barely drained. Another awesome semi budget phone I loved was the Nexus 6p. Had it not been for it’s 5.7 inch huge design I would have used that phone a lot longer. I just personally prefer a smaller compact phone as my daily driver. That being said I absolutely love being back to the iPhone which their design has been the same since the iPhone 6 all the way up to even now with the iPhone 8 which is 4.7 inch display. One thing I can tell you I do every day and all the time is I try to unlock my new iPhone from the back lol. I got so used to the Honor 8 fingerprint sensor being on the back I find that I’m always pressing my apple logo to try and unlock my phone all the time. Lol. It’s been hard getting used to the front bottom fingerprint sensor again. I’m not really sure which I like better front or back. The iPhone 8 fingerprint sensor is way more fast than the 6s which was the last iPhone I used before swapping over to android. I’d say the iPhone 8 and Honor 8 are neck and neck in terms of how fast they unlock the phone. I’ve always thought the Honor 8 had one of the most fastest fingerprint sensors on the market and also one that always worked on the first try every time too. I know I’m going to miss the days of the mid range budget phones that still offered flagship specs like the Honor 8. The iPhone 8 is a flagship and the price definitely reflects it too. That’s one thing I didn’t want to do again was pay top dollar for a phone again but never say never bc here I am as I’ve done it again now with the iPhone 8. The only way I justified it was that I promised myself that I’d use it for long term and not continue to change phones or buy and sell all the time anymore. Had it not been for the promotion xfibity had I wound have never gone back to apple lije I just did but if I was going to go back the promotion I got made it the best time to go ahead and make the switch back worth it and even possible. I still though hated to let my Honor 8 go as I always thought it was the best device on the market for the price. To me it’s very much a flagship device but at an unbelievable price. title: How to give Google Photos SD card permission? Make SD card default photo location?

thread.text:
Just got the Honor 8 as a B-day present for my daughter next week, and am setting it up for her so she can just open it up and start using it. I've installed Nova Launcher and most of the apps she uses. Here are my questions:
I made Google Photos the default photo gallery app as that is where all of her photos and videos are stored from her previous Moto G. However, when I try to delete a new photo I took with the phone, I get the following message:
I assume this means photos taken with the camera are being stored on the SD card I put into the phone? I guess that is good because it is what I wanted to happen but had no idea how to make happen in the settings. Second question is if there is any way to allow the Google Photo app to have permission to access the SD card so she doesn't have to go through this every time she wants to delete a photo? I have gone into the app settings for Google Photos and given it permission to every setting allowed, including "storage", but it still gives me this message. It is not a huge deal, because you just have to touch the "launch gallery" to launch the Honor 8 gallery app and you can quickly delete the photo, but it is an extra step that needs to be taken that will get old over time.

I think you can select default location SD under memory and storage in settings. Also make sure SD is selected as priority in the camera settings. Open the camera app and pull out the right side panel and makes sure it is selected.

replies.text:
Thanks, I did not even see the settings in the camera app (swiping right to left) and saw that option was checked, so yep the pics are being saved to the SD card. Now if anyone can determine if there is a way to let google photos have access to delete pics from the SD card my last annoyance will be gone.
I've got to say I'm pleasantly surprised at how fast this phone is. Boots up very quickly and I've noticed no lag (unlike my Note 7 I had for 2 weeks before returning it). This thing is actually quicker than my 6p on beta nougat 7.1. I'm half tempted to get one for myself!
I have no problem deleting photos in Google photos app. Just select what I want to delete and tap the trash can.
Ok, well I do have problems, so thanks anyway?

thread.text:
Maybe entering permissions for Google Photos thru settings to allow it access to the SD might work.
Good luck there and this should make for a great birthday for your daughter.

There is a way however:
1-Menu Bar (Three Lines)
2-Settings
3-SD card access
Follow the instructions that follow from there
I can't find 3

On my Samsung Note 8 running Nougat, I went into System settings -> Apps, then tapped the Photos app. Scrolling down to Advanced, I enabled "Apps that can change system settings". I then killed and restarted the photos application. Upon attempting to move a photo to trash i was prompted to allow this twice and after that it seems to be working.

replies.text: You never know, perhaps there could be a connection. Have you tried resetting your WiFi connection - any other devices not being able to connect? What about turning the phone off and on?

title: Honor 8 64gb $272

thread.text: Follow the instructions herehttps://slickdeals.net/f/10994815-64...v2_ni_14390365

I would never buy a phone from Best Buy again now that they have the $35. restocking fee on returns for Phones and tablets and other electronics that get activated and need to be reset, which they will not waive under any circumstances. Buying a deal which includes a phone card is also bad as phone cards are not refundable and I have heard that people buy scrape and use the funds then re cover the scraped numbers with silver paint then used to return for a credit or sell on line.
I just had a hell of a time with Best buy getting a refund on an Honour 6x that I bought for my wife. Ordered on line and they changed the delivery date because of Black Friday extending it by 4-5 days. I tried to cancel as it was easier to just go and buy at a store than wait the extra time. They said it was not possible to cancel as UPS had been given the pick up instructions. BB told me to just return it or take to a store. No restock if package is unopened. So I did that and the store took about an hour to process the refund as the orders didn't match up.Finally had to get a supervisor to do a manual refund. They also were not going to refund the $40. phone card but relented when I pointed out that the package was not opened until they opened it and was just as UPS gave me so the card couldn't have been tampered with. I returned it on November 28th and on Dec 3rd when my Credit card still hadn't shown the refund I called Best Buy asking why. They told me it sometimes could take a full billing cycle of your credit card before it came through. Contacted my Bank and they said that was nonsense and if it didn't appear by end of week (Dec 8th) I should dispute the original purchase and get it reversed. The credit appeared yesterday so at least that is now okay.

Sorry to hear about your troubles. Unfortunately they did institute a $35 fee for returned unlocked phones not too long ago.
But the rep you got gave you inaccurate information. Unfortunately it has happened to me at best buy as well as many other places. Many Reps will say anything to get you off the phone.
Wow! That's a great deal, especially since I paid about $500 (after tax, including shipping and handling) for my Honor 8 last December. I love this phone!

title: Rolling back to EMUI 4.1, my sour experience

thread.text:
Before I get into my experience, I have some disclaimers.
1) I have used Android phones for a year now.
2) I'm not one for beta testing, rooting or using custom ROMs. I'm all about the "boring" stability life.
3) I'm not saying that this WILL happen to you but know that it can happen and just take it as something to keep in mind.
As for the experience itself, I got the update for my Honor 8 and I was excited but then I found that I didn't like some things. Most of all, it broke my non-Google calendar, which already made me not as much of a fan about this update. Tried a number of free calendars with no luck. I need my calendar. 
Since it worked before on EMUI 4.1/Android 6.0, I decided to download the official rollback update from the HiHonor support website. I followed the directions about removing the file into the dload folder (or if there isn't one, create it) on internal storage. I did the button combo the first time and I saw "update successful". Tried it again to do the next step and it didn't work, as it kept saying that the software update couldn't be found so it failed. 
It kept failing so I went back to the directions. I tried to reload the file to see if that would do anything but it seemed not to work still. Then I did the worst thing ever without knowing it. I factory reset my phone with the file still in it and it broke my phone essentially. Somehow doing that broke the keyboards. The only available keyboard is a voice keyboard, which you can't even work with, because of passwords and such. 
I have wiped the cache partition a few times throughout all of this, along with more factory/hard resets. No matter what, I only have a voice keyboard so now my Honor 8 is now a $300 paperweight. 
Since I registered my phone, I'll see if Honor can do anything for me with their support but as for now, I'm tired. I have tried various things and I have lost a couple of nights trying to make this work. Just wanted to share my story as a possible warning. 
(Since I'm a chronic phone switcher, I have my other non-Android phones to use.)

That's very unfortunate. That's why I don't like to use autoloader to rollback or update for possibility of bricking the phone. I am not sure what calendar feature is broken for you but i use blackberry launcher with blackberry calendar and I have no problem.

replies.text:
Yeah, I don't blame you for not wanting to do that. I thought it would work like it did when I rolled back to iOS 9 several months ago (on my iPhone SE of course).
For me, all of my calendars are hosted in Outlook. I used to be able to see them on 6.0 in the phone calendar. I had no luck with it. I have heard a lot about BB's calendar and apps, so I believe that it works well for you.

title: Honor 8 not fast charging after Nougat update

thread.text:
Tried different cables, plugs etc. 2 different Orignal huawei chargers used. None of them worked. Sent device to huawei service centre, got back, worked fine. Received update to Nougat. Updated. Back to square one. 
Not fast charging, not recognizing as a media device. My car also refused to detect it. 
I am sure it is software issue but not sure how to fix.

title: How many of you think the Honor 8 is a flagship spec phone?

thread.text: So I think about this at times and I wonder if the honor 8 is truly flagship level. I've read and heard that the Kirin 950 chip has been compared to the Snapdragon 820 processor. Then the camera is definitely flagship level as I know once I got rid of my last honor 8 I realized how spoiled I had become by the honor 8s camera compared to all the other phones I had been trying out. Do you guys think the Honor 8 can be held to that of a flagship device. It's a mental thing with me I think bc of the price of the honor 8 these days. I wonder how is it possible to get really buy a flagship phone for under $300 but then if you truly look at the specs and performance of the honor 8 it indeed does and can be compared to some flagship phones out there. So what are your thoughts. Is it missing something that would truly define it as a flagship level phone or do you think the specs speak for themselves and consider this device to be every bit of a flagship? I'm just curious of everyone's thoughts on the topic as I debate myself over at times whether it is or it's not. It's definitely more than a basic mid range level device so what do you guys think. Respond in detail as to why you think it is or you think it's not. Try not to allow the price to mentally push you one way or the other. Just purely the device.

replies.text: Performance wise it's pretty close. Camera wise, I think it's generation behind when it was released,in low light. In normal lighting, it performed well.
I'm no camera pro but it shoots really well in low light in my experience. Night clubs, bars, outside, it's great.

I agree. The camera on the honor 8 basically spoiled me after I let my last one go and bought several other different phones. Their cameras were nowhere near as crisp and fast as the honor 8s camera. It might not be the best out there to be had but it competes with the best I think which that alone makes it a very good camera. I don't think I've ever taken a blurry shot with my honor 8 before. Not that I recall. It's a top notch camera for sure.
Haven't used my Honor 8 in low light in a while. I'll go test it out and see for myself. Beside low light. It takes fantastic pictures
Great for its price yes. But not at flagship level.

thread.text: In my mind it is. It has all the extras that puts it there - a fast processor, high speed CAT 6 LTE modem, dual band wifi, NFC, IR blaster, compass, and a great dual camera setup. Plus it has flagship looks and finish. Definitely not a mid-ranger in any respect except for price.

replies.text: Those are some impressive specs so my question is how on Earth can they sell this phone so cheaply but yet still be a true flagship. I know I bought an open box but my 64g honor 8 was still brand new and all I paid was $199. Did I get a steal or is that in line for an open box on this phone. Do you think it's worth more than it's initial retail of $399? I just don't understand how they can produce a flagship device at the insane low price they have it at. So then are we all grossly over paying for the typical flagships then? How can honor give us a flagship level device for under $300 dollars? I just don't see how that can be done. What is this phone missing that other flagship phones have that are $650 to $750 dollars?
Bokeh wasn't as good as my iPhone 7 Plus, imo. Not saying it was bad, just not as good

thread.text: I seriously doubt that Huawei makes any money on the Honor 8 at less than around $350. It costs way more than that to include all those features it has. No other phone out there has similar specs at anything less than $400 to $450, or more.
You guys make great points. Do you think that maybe why we won't see another honor flagship type phone here in the US until they officially enter the our market?

My guess is that this phone is part of Huawei's strategy to help it gain larger access to US markets. It originally isted for $450 in August 2016 if I recall correctly. Huawei was willing to accept a slim margin (or at a loss) on this phone in the name of marketing. It was released right after the One+3, which was priced at $399. Very, very similar device in many respects in performance and specs. But the Honor 8 is better - a dual camera and expandable storage to name a few things.

replies.text: I agree as the honor 8 has a lot features offered with EMUI where the one plus is very vanilla Android meaning way less features. I see the speaker being the only weakness of the honor 8 as if it has dual front facing stereo speakers this phone would be near perfection. I got spoiled fast with my Axon 7 in terms of unbelievable audio sound from a smart phone. The Nexus 6p was not far behind the Axon 7 either but the speaker on the honor is average at best but everything else is truly flagship level. I've seen many times before where the Kirin 950 has been compared to the Snapdragon 820 which even today is still a flagship processor that is very fast. The only other phone that comes close to competing pretty good with the honor 8 is indeed the Axon 7. But then you have to keep in mind screen size as not everyone wants a 5.5 inch phone to be their daily driver and vice versa. Some think the 5.2 inch honor 8 is too small and should have been 5.5. I'm torn on that one myself because although I like a smaller phone to be my daily driver I also enjoy a larger phone for media and the honor 8 is a great media device minus it's smaller display and weak speaker.

thread.text: Also I wanted to point out the fingerprint sensor. How many of you have ever encountered a faster fingerprint sensor? I know personally I've gone through so many phones over the past year and a half that I'm embarrassed but out of all those phones not one came close to the accuracy and speed of the honor 8s fingerprint sensor. It's simply unbelievable. It's a pleasure to use and to top it off it can programmed to function in three different manners. My one press activates my flashlight. My double press takes a screen shot. My long press opened up AC forums. Then you even have the option to pull down your notifications. Tell me how the fingerprint sensor alone is not one of the best if not the best out there over any flagship device. It utterly destroys the Samsung S8 fingerprint sensor. I'll even say this. Other than screen resolution of the S8 I could not see any performance difference between the S8 and Honor 8. The honor 8 was 5 times more smooth and fluid then the $750 dollar S8. The only thing the S8 was better than the Honor 8 in was the amazing screen resolution that Samsung flagships are known for but saying that the honor 8 even though it's not an amoled screen has a very good vibrant and punchy colors for just a 1080p HD screen. Meaning you can't even tell the honor 8 does not have an AMOLED display. It's just hard to prove this phone is not a full flagship bc every flagship has at least one or two weaknesses. Mentally though I have a hard time considering the honor 8 to be a full all out flagship when I think of it's price but you take the price out of the equation and look at it from a spec stand point and right now I'm comparing it to the S8 which we all know is a full blown flagship and I owned it for a little while but I saw really no difference between the two at all. We are either very spoiled by how budget the honor 8 is or we grossly over pay for all high end flagships.

replies.text: Fps is quite awesome. Works more consistently than my note 8.

thread.text: It seriously is. I was gonna sell mine but decided not too for this very reason. It's just an awesome phone. Probably the sleeper phone of 2016. Love this little thing.

replies.text: Yeah there is nothing on the market quite as unique about it and certainly not any other flagship level phones that can be gotten for under $300 dollars. Heck I got a 64g and I only paid $199 for mine but I know I got a steal. I had to do some heavy talking to get them down that low so my price is not typical at all. You can however pick up a 32g for under $300 which still no other flagship remotely compares to it out there in terms of price. That's what actually makes me struggle with calling it a flagship or not is the price and I know it shouldn't bc the specs speak for themselves. The only weakness it has if you can even call it that bc most flagships have it too is the bottom firing Momo speaker at the bottom which is avaerage. So it appears to be a flagship on paper at least but at an extremely budget price.

thread.text: Performance wise, I would say yes. Spec wise, no. But, except for those people who think specs mean everything, performance is the most important factor. And this phone performs. And it's a real bargain. Right now you can get the 64gb model for $299.

thread.text:
It's hard to categorize the Honor 8 as a midrange phone. In my opinion, it's midrange as far as price is concerned. In many other respects, it has flagship-level calibre. It has specs that are on par or close to being on par with its contemporary flagship devices. Sure, some flagships of last year have specs that rival the Honor 8; but you can't beat these specs for around $400 in a hardware body like the Honor 8's. 
I've said it once, I've said it a thousand times... I am having a *very* hard time putting down my Honor 8 and looking for/choosing a suitable upgrade.

thread.text: I actually owned 3 Honor 8s, the blue, black and white. While the hardware does look and feel flagship quality, the same cannot be said about the software. The camera is not on par with Samsung's flagships (S6, S7 or the S8) nor is the image processing. Honor doesn't update its US variants frequently (which is important). In fact it's doubtful that it'll receive the Oreo update, whereas the 6X is guaranteed to get it this year. It could've competed as a flagship in 2016 but definitely not in 2017.

replies.text: What was your favourite colour out of the three Honor 8's you've had?

The S6 camera had OIS and better image processing algorithms, especially in low light scenarios..so better pictures and video. While I never owned the S6 series but I did have a few friends who owned one and I briefly used them a couple of times. In comparison to the Honor 8, the S6 shot brighter pictures with more details (the S7 Edge Exynos was my daily driver). I don't use Samsung's software bokeh effects so never compared Honor's implementation.I purchased the first Blue variant from Swappa for a deal and used it for a month before flipping it because I switched to the S7 Edge. After a month or so I got a good deal for the Black variant on Amazon warehouse deal so bought it and used as a backup before flipping it again (S7 Edge was still my daily driver). Then the last White variant was sort of a deal I couldn't pass on...it was a great deal for the 64GB variant on Newegg. This time I used it for a month or so before I bought the S8+ so had to sell the Honor and the S7E. FYI, I don't keep my phones for more than 6 months (S7E, Lumia 1520 and the S8+ are exceptions) and I usually keep a second phone as a backup (currently its a Moto Z Play).The Blue one was my favorite, especially with Imak's matching blue Cowboy Sandstone case.

I got my white Honor 8 from Newegg, too! 
Also, while I do think the Honor 8 takes great photos, I do agree with you that the Samsung S6 series takes better photos. My mom has the Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge; and that camera outperforms mine. However, it's a Samsung device and I feel like their cameras are superior to many other smartphone manufacturers in the first place. Not making excuses for Honor - just stating that it's hard to beat Samsung in that department.
Oh that's interesting. Samsung has lost the camera department a lot to previous LG phones tho. Samsung do outshine them in low light.
My mom's phone takes great photos! I could be biased though. My G3 didn't take amazing photos but that was, of course, three iterations ago. The G6 takes amazing shots, IMO!
From many reviewers I've read and watched. LG cameras are androids too dog in pictures.
I think all flagships will take great shots
Flagships should take great shots. But that's not the case all the time.
That is true

Yup I'm aware of the S6. I cant find any Honor 8 vs S6 camera comparison but here is a link to the Honor 8 vs S7 camera. No low light pictures tho but here you can see they are very identical. Could hardly tell them apart. My Honor 8 is already competitive to my LG G6. https://forums.macrumors.com/threads...eline.2003379/
That's pretty good to hear!

I've owned both S7s hated the laggy touchwiz got rid of them then I had the S8 and didn't like the 18.9 ratio as I think it makes zero sense to only take away from the width and just add it to the length. It makes for horrible movie watching and viewing. The Nexus 6p I owned twice which was a great device but I found it too large for a daily phone. I used to use Apple only for many years. thread.text: Good deal! Thanks for wanting to keep me around. This by far is the best forum on the AC forums I've ever used and I've been on quite a few different ones over the past year and a half or so. This forum is a very tight nit group here with everyone being big time positive and overall nice and respectful. I've definitely enjoyed all the interaction here and I've learned a lot along the way. I also hoped that helped people as much as I've learned. I always try to respond to the new comers on here when they have a question or make a post. I of course nowhere near know everything but I do know quite a bit about the honor 8 and EMUI. It's by far been the biggest part of Android during my year and a half I've now that had been using Android exclusively. I'll most definitely now well I'll probably pretty much go back exclusively to apple now as I've been wanting to go back for about the last 6 months but really had not seen any good opportunities to be able to until this Xfinity mobile $500 dollar gift card hit me out of nowhere. I never in a million years ever even thought about using Xfinity as my mobile phone carrier. Just so happen I got that mailer in the mail and I mainly called just to only sign up for internet and cable as even Xfinity mobile told me that they are very new to the mobile part and are taking it slow as they enter in the mobile side of the industry. They said that's why they don't offer any tablets and only offer apple and Samsung only. Kind of weird how things work out and hit you when you least expect it. They even approached me about the mobile part as I never even thought to ask them about their mobile side when I originally called in. So initially I kind of wrote it off as I really didn't intend to have any interest then it hit me and someone advised me to call them back about that $500 gift card promotion bc at first I signed up for a plan that didn't qualify me to get it. So when I called back I started to ask questions and one of main concerns was about their service coverage and what towers they used. When they told me Verizon towers that's when I really sparked a heavy interest in to the possibility of using them as my mobile carrier bc I loved cricket. Verizon always has good reception and coverage being the largest carrier so that was really what made me decide to proceed with the entire idea and eventual switch that I made today. They only offer two plans which is pay $12 bucks per gig you use which is what I signed up for and $45 dollars for unlimited data until you hit 20 gigs then at that point your speed slows down until the next month. The only time I've ever gone over 20 gigs was this month when I moved in to care for my mom who as you all know was diagnosed with stage 4 terminal lung and bone cancer. She didn't have any internet or cable so I only used my unlimited data with cricket and I was amazed at how fast I reached 20 gigs of data well before the month was over. So that's how I ended up calling Xfinity in the first place as I had to get some WiFi here and internet. I don't really care about the cable as I only got that for my mom to have so she can be able to watch better TV and I wanted her to enjoy the possible short time that she may or may not have left with me sadly. Hopefully she will beat it but it's going to take a miracle medically speaking as stage 4 medically means there is no chance for survival and full remission from it. I can tell you it's so difficult to watch your mom go through so much pain as of we all know how special mom's are to all of us. There is nothing in this world like your mother. They are indeed without doubt the most special people in this world. I just tell her all the time she's going to be okay and beat it and stay positive around her but it breaks my heart although I don't let her know as I need her to mentally stay positive as they plays a huge role in prolonging their inevitable death sentence for the lack of better words. Anyways so now I'm officially a Xfinity mobile customer. I'm going to try this pay by the gig plan first as I'm here at the house 98 percent of the time caring for her so I'll be on wifi for all of that time so in theory if I don't use one entire gig all I'm paying for is the monthly cost of my phone which is cheaper than what I was paying with cricket which was $55 per month for unlimited data. I have a feeling though as time goes on that I'll switch over to their $45 dollar unlimited plan but I want to pay the phone off first to save money. I really wanted to use that gift card to pay my phone off but I've been needing to get another iPad so that is what I'll buy with the gift card money. Hopefully the 9.7 inch iPad pro which I'll put on a cheap $30 dollar plan per month then.

replies.text: Of course we want to keep you around! You are a great asset to this forum! A legend!
No need to leave, we're happy to have you here. I like reading your paragraph long posts lol

Boy does love to type.
I'm good for about 3 lines then everything after that is "blah...blah...blah...yada...yada...
Comes from 35 years of marriage.
Haha. I am a lot less but I agree.
I would read as long as I can then just reply lol. But I do read the whole thing when I can.
Same here. Try to read the whole thing but it's just so massive
Yes, some are just soooooo long lol
It would be nice if the long paragraph become a few paragraphs.
Turn it into a essay long post

I'm not very good with text walls.
Over on WC I'll edit long paragraph posts with breaks in an attempt to make the reply more appealing to the reader.
Good point. And if it was one post then I might do it. But dconn has so many...
Oh, you're a mod there ?

I'm a tangent poster and once I get started I don't have time to think about paragraphs. I just write it all out without thought. I never plan what time say as it just comes out in typing it. Kind of hard to explain. I talk the way I write and write the way I talk. Both without thought. I taught junior college courses at night for 7 years. Easiest job I've ever done bc I created a discussion oriented class setting where everyone was involved so they learned the material whether the had intended to or not . It was easy. I never once planned what to lecture I just new the rough topic. Then I just let out. Lol. Easy and fun.
That's cool then. Glad that going with the flow so to speak worked.

Yeah for me I could give a speech in front of 20 people or thousands of people as long as I knew the topic and that I had not written a planned speech. I have to totally wing it and let if flow from the heart. I'm a deeply passionate person so when I write or talk it comes from the heart therefore it allows me to do both without having to actually think about what I'm going to say rather it just pours out. That is also why you don't see me write in paragraphs. Now when I would write my reports professionally I wrote in paragraph form of course. If I were to write a mini type article post it may or may not have paragraphs. A lot of the time my long posts I write like the really long ones only take me as long as it would to actually type the words out on the screen bc there is zero thought involved and therefore I don't ever pause to think of what I'm going to say so this goes back to the thing I say where I write like I talk when I talk like I right and I jump from topic to topic by tangent all the time which is another reason for the lack of paragraphs. I simply don't think so when I start it just comes out flowing and I'll jump through several different topics before it's all over and I won't even realize I've done it. I did however when writing my professional reports which would be quite long at times bc I had to explain in such detail, I would make new paragraphs when transitioning into another type of topic. Here I don't consider this to be a professional type setting so I'm not as aware of starting new paragraphs as I would be otherwise. I know it can become quite confusing when you guys read my long posts or mini articles lol. Perhaps I'll start using paragraphs here to post moving forward since I'm aware of it now. So here's an example. New paragraph bc I'm about to jump ship. 
I ordered my iPhone 8 yesterday but I also ordered a couple other things as well. I'm totally going to customize my iPhone 8. I found a company called colorware that offers high end skins which I ordered the high gloss finish Red skin that covers the back and frame. Then I ordered a Zagg luxe model screen protector that comes in titanium silver so my entire front that is space grey will now be silver in color with the home button being the only black to be seen. 
So to summarize, I'll have a Red and Silver iPhone that will totally be custom and unlike any other iPhone out there. I'll be sure to post pictures of my finished product once I install everything hopefully by Monday or Tuesday. 
I've never used this skin company before but I saw a YouTube review on them and it was great. They offer matte finishes and high gloss finishes. I ordered the high gloss bc it will be brighter and pop more. I'll be sure to throw some pics up when I get it all finished being installed as it should look really awesome.
So now with the iPhone 8, are you going to get rid of the honor 8?

Yeah I returned it today actually. I'll get a refund on it in about week. I just got word that I'm going to inherit a iPhone 6s plus from my mom as when she found out I got the iPhone 8 she decided to upgrade too and got the 8 plus. So she's giving me her 6s plus and I'll use that as my larger screen media device now. Now I'll have two iPhones to rotate back and forth with.
Oh but the 6s Plus is outdated and doesn't have portrait mode. You should sell it and get an iPhone 8 Plus.

No way I would ever do it as I don't like the iPhone plus models at all. I've always thought they did not look good to me and I've never even thought about getting one but since this one will be free I'm not opposed to watching a movie on it or making it my media phone. My iPhone 8 I'll use 98 percent of the time even if I have her iPhone 6s plus as it'll strictly be used when I want to watch a movie or for bigger media things I might need the larger screen for. I've got order a full skin for it as I think it's a rose gold or pink gold color or something like that. It of course was my mom's phone which it's still like brand new. She rarely uses her phone and it's been in a speck case with a screen protector on it the entire time she's had it. It's never even been out of the case. So I'll just order a skin for it to make it the color I like and I'll be good to go for my back up media device.
Nothing wrong with the smaller size. If you're comfortable with it. Stick with it

Yeah it's more of how it looks. I've always thought the iPhone plus models looked too chunky for some reason. Not that I would use one if it was free like I've got now for movies and larger media than the regular iPhone can perform well at. I've just got to order a full one piece skin for the plus because her 6s plus is that pink gold color which is way more for a girl color so I've got to hide that before I use it or take it out in public with me lol.
Oh that's fine. I'm not sure if I can deal with a small screen though. It if it works for you, stick with it
It should be preferable for Dconn1975, he prefers smaller screens

Yeah my ideal size phone would be exactly 5 inches which the iPhone is 4.7 so it is very close to being perfect for me. I love using a compact one handed device that's easy to use and put in my back pocket. Easier to handle as and obscure to carry around with me on a daily basis. I don't think I would have lasted two weeks had I gotten the Note 8 lol. I'm so glad I chose the iPhone now. For a little while there I was highly considering the Note 8 bc I wanted the S pen feature but that phone is gigantic!!!! No way I could have or would have used that beast on a day in and day out basis long term.
I am glad that you didn't get the note 8! You certainly wouldn't have lasted long
I had a pink iPhone. Just put a case on it and it was fine

That's what I'm doing to the iPhone 6s plus that my mom is giving me. I ordered a full one piece skin for it from colorware the covers the entire back and entire frame up. Only thing you can still see the original color on are the buttons which is no big deal. I ordered a candy color orange skin for it. It's going to be extra bright lol. Cool looking. I'll only be using it for movies only until I get my iPad then I'll probably sell it or put it up for a back up phone once I buy my iPad. The iPhone I'm getting is a bit too small to watch movies on although it's still doable. I'll definitely still use it for YouTube videos and web browsing. The plus is strictly going to be used to watch a movie on every once in a while. I won't even activate a line for it as it will only be used on occasion or if I see that I need a larger screen.
Wow that's going to be real bright. Can't miss that phone
Absolutely, that's true. But the smaller size lacks an important feature for me
Oh what was that
It was lacking portrait mode
Oh only the bigger model has it ? Hm
Yup the portrait mode is only on the iPhone 7 Plus and iPhone 8 Plus and iPhone x. It isn't on the regular iPhone 7 or iPhone 8.
Oh okay. Interesting.
Yeah it definitely is interesting that Apple chose to go this route. Maybe they are trying to push people towards the plus for bigger profits
The Plus is the more popular model I believe
Yes it is and by a wide margin.

That's a really hard and true tough one you stated their. If I had to make an educated guess I would venture to guess that the original iPhone 4.7 inch still does better in sales for the moment. This would a fun fact to know for sure. It always seems like plus models do better but it not the same with apple typically. That's why they have stuck with that original 4.7 inch design for four years straight because sales of this size phone have been off the charts. If the plus is doing anything compared to the 4.7 inch iPhone it's simply finally starting to catch up to the original size iPhone. It's way way more popular than you realize. I am quite sure if we could find factual numbers you'd see what I'm talking about. I'm pretty sure the original iPhone still out sells the plus model as the plus is still considered a niche type device but I will say that it's finally starting to become more of an even playing field though. I just think it has not yet quite caught up to the the sells of the original iPhone which I'd the 4.7 that design is iconic and probably the most popular smart phone design in the entire US market. That being the original 4.7 iPhone which was originally released on the iPhone 6. I remember it all to well as I was very used to the 5 and 5s size and I remember thinking that the 4.7 was a bit too large for me at the time due to being used to the small 5 and 5s but I soon fell in love with the 4.7 design and it's been my favorite iPhone ever since. thread.text: That’s really interesting to me. I totally thought the regular iconic design of the original iPhone still out sold the plus. When I was setting my moms new iPhone 8 up and putting her screen protector on I just kept thinking to myself wow this phone is so huge lol. I’m glad they didn’t abandon the 4.7 inch iPhone then. There is definitely still a strong market out there for like myself but I was totally wrong for sure. Now I will say I like the plus if I’m going to watch a movie or something but every day I much prefer the 4.7 inch iPhone in every way. So much easier to use. Easier to carry around. Out in your pocket. Just easier in general but I suppose larger screens are what sells the best. I personally like having one of each but still for a daily driver I would restart a 5 inch phone for sure. Everyone’s tastes are different but according to the graphs more people prefer the bigger phones. I have tried to but I always go back to the smaller phones for every day use. I just find them to be much easier in every aspect. I guess more and more people are useijt their phones for lots of media purposes which I do prefer a larger phone in that regard. Day to day tasks though it’s so much easier to carry around a 5 inch or around that size phone to me personally than to carry around a huge 5.5 or 5.7 inch screen phone. I think it’s all in what you became used to because I’ve certainly tried going to a larger screen several times with android as my daily phone but in the end I just found them too large to easily use and put in my pocket and to be obscure as well. The less the bulk the better to me. Now that I have this awesome skin on my new iPhone 8 I am beginning to think it was pointless for me to have ordered cases for it. I honestly don’t think I’ll even use a case now as one it adds bulk and two I like the way my phone now looks and I don’t want to cover it up now lol. I know that’s dangerous but carrying a smaller phone is easier to keep a good grip on to ensure I won’t drop it but I know anything could still happen. You never know when the laws of average finally catch up to you as I’ve never dropped my phones hardly at all other than them falling off a table or something but just flat out dropping one I don’t believe I’ve ever done it. I know I’ve certainly never broken one by dropping it.

After all these years I've yet to drop and break a phone but with the honor 8 I know I'm just asking for trouble if I opt for no case. Right now or when I'm at my house I don't use one. When I installed that back protection film on mine that came with my screen protector it immediately gave it better grip so I've been using it without a case. When I leave the house I typically throw a case on it though. The phone just feels so much better and less bulky without a case no matter how thin it is. They just add bulk which I do not like very much. Plus right now I'm enjoying the entire new to me look of this Pearl White color phone which I've really never owned a white phone before but since this is a Pearl color I really don't consider it fully white. It's a cream color that looks amazing in person. Plus I just love the all silver frame as it gives it that extra pop of contrast. There is no doubt that the honor 8 is my all time favorite Android phone that I've ever used but then again I personally don't consider EMUI to be Android anyway. It's nothing remotely like Android at all to me. I personally don't you the newly added default app drawer. I keep mine like it originally came on 4.1 without the option of an app drawer and I've never even thought about using my Nova launcher on any of my honor 8s. I like EMUI just that much. It's butter smooth and fluid with zero lag what so ever. I'm always amazed that you can buy this flagship type phone for the cheaper price you can get it for and you sacrifice nothing. It's definitely a flagship made device all the way around. The only thing I'd change on it would be to have given it two front facing speakers for better media experience. The speaker is rather weak but that's the only flaw I can definitely live with that. I got spoiled by my Nexus 6p dual front facing stereo speakers and my Axon 7 fromt facing dual Dolby surround sound speakers which neither of those two phones did I have to use my Bluetooth jbl speaker when watching movies or being on YouTube for extended periods of time. Plus it's so easy to cover this bottom facing speaker up so in general I like dual front facing speakers and if the honor 8 had them it to me would have been the perfect smart phone.
