In fact the iPhone 6s was my all time favorite iPhone so the iPhone 8 is basically the same design but of course much more powerful with added features that the 6s didn't have. The fingerprint sensor is immediate. 3D touch. IOS 11 is much different than 9.3 that I was on. It's evolved since then to have many more options and features. The only thing I really dislike about the iPhone is that I can't change the color of my keyboard unless I use Gboard but it can be kind of buggy at times on the iPhone as it doesn't always show the Gboard as my keyboard when I'm in certain different applications as it automatically reverts back to the IOS keyboard even when Gboard is enabled. It does allow me to change my keyboard to greyish black but I just stay with the IOS keyboard to keep the bugs out. Maybe one day they will allow for a little more customization. Not likely but I'd like to see it happen as time goes on. But to go back to the OPs post as a IOS guy I did go through quite a few Android phones and it's been fun but I'm ready now to go back to IOS which is what I know best. I just hope once I hook up and activated my internet Wednesday that my two lines will become available to me so that I can finally place my order. Im on the fence right now between the iPhone 7 in the Red linited edition and the space grey iPhone 8. I'm torn between the two but leaning towards the iPhone 8. If I get I will no doubt miss EMUI as I've found it to be fun to use every day. I'm just Apple by heart and I always knew switching to Android would not be forever but now I least know I like it and am partial to a few different brands like Huawei honor, Moto Z phones, Nexus 6p and or I suppose pixel now although the Nexus 6p was identical to the original pixel but it was only tweaked then Google with their greed killed off the awesome Nexus line which was an affordable flagship of pure smooth android only to make the pixel which was another Nexus 6p put their name on it and then proceed to charge double what the 6p cost. I'm sure the pixel 2 is a little better now than the 6p in all aspects but I will say that pure Android meaning Android as Google intended Android to be used without a skin was butter smooth but with that you get less features similar to IOS in that regard. The Nexus 6p did not have many extra features bc there was no skin adding them. It was just the basics but one of the smoothest phone's I have ever used. It was slightly smoother than EMUI actually. I chose EMUI as my phone of choice on the Android side bc it ran without any lag and was smooth but still offered you lots of custom features and extras. I just am bummed that they have slowly changed it to reflect to be more and more like Android. I would venture to say that EMUI in China is still very 4.1 like compared to the US version. Over there I've read that the iPhone is very very popular so a lot of Chinese companies produce their software to be much like IOS but with you being able to customize it. Like the original 4.1 having no app drawer. I liked it that way and I also liked that there was not an option for an app drawer at all. It was their own version of software which was got terrible reviews here upon it's release. I just never saw anything wrong with it. I even liked the separation of the notification pull down at the top with the colored icons in the notification bar. I still to this day use stock EMUI without a launcher which I used Nova on all my other Android phones and I still use EMUI stock without an app drawer too. I know I'm in the big minority here but that is what made EMUI different than typical Android which to me was welcomed. So many people just plained hated on EMUI and what I didn't get was how or why they were so dang closed minded instead of just embracing the change and thinking outside the box but no they complained so much that honor caved in and has changed EMUI with every major update to become closer and closer to stock Android. Too bad there is nothing now that will stop that. Of course they are going to want to please the majority of their customers who I think are very closed minded and have trouble thinking outside the box. Android or stock Android does not have to always be the same. What's wrong with variety as that was another reason I made the change over to Android to see the variety and why I went through so many different phones testing out different gear and I enjoyed it. Every skin was a little different and it was cool to learn new skins and how they worked and what they had to offer. So now I'll either stay with honor or go back to Apple. I've now tried more than enough phones. I will say that one of my favorite brands was Moto. I absolutely loved the Moto mods. I actually still want to get another Moto Z phone as I even still have a couple of Moto mods left. My favorite mod was the JBL speakers mod. It was awesome for movies, music and talking by speaker phone. It made the phone thick but I kept that mod on my Moto Z play 75 percent of the time and oh that battery on the Z play is still the best on the market. I could go three days on one charge and 5 days if I had the Moto mod battery pack on it. Had I had enough to spend this time around I was actually going to get the Z play again over the honor 8 but the Z play at the time was $399 then I saw for about a week it hit a huge sale at Best buy down to only $279. I was like just my luck after I had bought the honor 8 and already invested into it. It was too late and I didn't have the time to to send it back for a refund and catch that huge sale best buy had on the Z play. I'm not sure if any of you ever owned any of the Moto Z phones but I've owned all of them and what I liked the most was the style back shells so you could change the look and color of your phone up every day with a variety of different back shell mods. So I still very much like Moto and their skin was very light almost giving you pure vanilla Android. If any of you ever change from the honor I highly recommend the Moto Z phones. The Moto mods are a blast to use. The projector mod allows you to just put it on and it automatically recognizes it and you can watch up to a 50 inch TV screen against a blank wall and watch a movie. The mods aren't cheap. By far though that JBL mod was the best. It was an amazing speaker and you didn't have to use an external Bluetooth speaker anymore when you had it on your phone. What's cool is how easy it was to change them out. You just slap it on and you're good to go with it. Honor and Moto I've found to be my two favorite Android experiences.

I'd say the drawback I've seen is the play time is 3 hours which for me that perfectly fine but I've seen others with 8 to 10 hours of play time between charges. I no where near listen to music that long but at the same time 3 hours is very close to that of a long movie and if you didn't have a full charge then essentially they would die out on you during the middle of the movie. Same for using them to take calls which having to charge every 3 hours is a bad thing during the day. I do like that only one of the earbuds works for calls. Plus these are water proof. You can even take a shower and listen to music in the mornings to help you wake up. That's a plus with these. I also like the look of the product and how you store them. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you to all that help here.

Fake spot rates it as a F.
Caveat emptor.

Does this mean I would not order those Bluetooth earbuds. I see the F rating but I also see 100 percent. Can you tell me what this means in regard to the product and whether I should order them or not. I'm not familiar with that grading system. I really appreciate it. I have not ordered them yet as I was hoping to get the correct feedback here before I did anything. I really appreciate your time and help.

Fake spot analyzes the reviews on Amazon to see how many it guesstimate are fake reviews,based on its proprietary algorithm.
In this case it means that based on its analysis, all of the reviews posted, that fake spot believes that none of the reviews are reliable. You can read its analysis here. https://www.fakespot.com/product/wat...martphones-red
To be clear, the item itself could be great, but just that the reviews are not reliable based on fakespot analysis
If all the reviews are probably fake, then the item could also be very bad.
Yes it could be hard to really know.
Here's an article regarding Bluetooth with bass https://www.google.com/amp/s/thedroi...rs-1067301/amp
Oh thanks!
You are very welcome! I hope that it is of some use

thread.text: Guys the wait is killing me big time. I've been on the phone with FedEx twice trying to persuade them to deliver my package as soon as possible as I seemed it time sensitive lol. I wasn't lying as it's very time sensitive to me lol. I had hoped FedEx would have shown by noon but it's already 130. I'm afraid they aren't going to show until late this evening which is torture lol. I am so ready to hear the sound of the loud FedEx truck drive up to my house. I simply cannot wait until it's delivered as I have my new silver Zagg screen protector already here but my skins have not yet been delivered. I'll post a before and after of my iPhone without the Zagg luxe screen protector and then a pic with it installed. It's really cool as it totally changes the entire look of the iPhone up. Everything on the front that is space grey will turn into a titanium silver color then it's really going to look unique once I install my full one piece Red skin that covers the entire frame to transforming the entire phone to a totally different color than that of a typical iPhone. Mine will truly be one of a kind as you won't see anything like it. Not many people know about the luxe screen protector from Zagg nor do they ever think to purchase the titanium silver color one as they all typically purchase the same color as their phone is. Mine will in fact change my entire color of the front then my skin will encumber the entire back and entire frame so the only space grey that you will see on my new iPhone is the home button which if I wanted to I could order a Red home button from Amazon that would really totally give it a drastic change overall. I am just not familiar with how the red home button would work with touch ID. It states that it works as it would normally but I'm afraid it may not stick well since that button will be used so much so I may not change the color of my home button but overall my phone will go from totally being all one color of space grey to having totally Red body and totally silver front. I never did use a skin on my 6s I had but I always used the silver Zagg luxe screen protector and people would ask me all the time what type of phone do I have. It makes just that huge of q difference once it's installed which I'll show you guys before and after pics of it today. I decided to order a special material skin made in high gloss for my body and frame so this skin will be extra different looking having a high gloss sheen to it. I'm super stocked about what my new iPhone is going to end up looking like. That's why I simply can't use a case to cover it up. No one out there will have an iPhone that looks like mine therefore making it highly unique and totally different. The only way one will know it's an iPhone is simply by the design of the iconic iPhone and notorious home button which will still be in space grey unless I decide to order that Red home button which isn't expensive. What was the most expensive was that special luxe edition screen protector from Zagg. That set me back $48 bucks but it does totally transform the iPhone to an entirely different color on the front. I'll throw a case on it until my special skin arrives. This skin is made to look by the high gloss sheen to look like the back has been painted as you won't be able to tell it's a skin. I watched a detailed review of this particular high gloss skin and it looks amazing. It'll be my first time using this company for a skin as I just discovered them last week. They are by profession a high grade graphic design and paint company so their skins they offer are limited to basically only iPhone and Samsung. The go back as far as the 6s so I did order a candy orsnge for the iPhone 6s plus that I'll be getting. I just replaced the screen protector on it as it needed a new one but I won't get the plus model until tomorrow which is when my mom's iPhone 8 plus will be delivered. I have to help her set her iPhones up as she does not really know how to work her iPhones well. I'll make one last back up on her 6s plus then wipe it and factory reset it for myself to put my info into to it then I'll transfer her last back up on to her new iPhone and then then will have the same exact set up as she did on her 6s plus on her iPhone 8. When you transfer apple data it transfers everything exactly in the order it was on the last phone. She will be able to then open her iPhone 8 up and it essentially will look identical to her 6s even down to how all her apps were placed before. It's pretty cool. On mine I'll choose my last back up I had when I briefly owned the iPhone SE which makes it much easier as I won't have to download any apps at all. Everything will look identical to how my SE looked when I last had it 6 months ago. Funny that I still remember all my apple iCloud info like email and password as icloud saves everything totally in every aspect down to even how you had all your settings on you phone set to and what type of order your apps were set up like. I love apple in that regard. Anyways FedEx is killing me. I'm glued to the window waiting. Plus I have my axon 7 sold too so as soon as FedEx arrives the guy is coming to purchase my axon 7 which is a bonus as I'll end up using that money to order my Bluetooth earbuds and a charging pad with. So shortly I'll have some before and after pictures I'll post to show you guys the luxe model Zagg screen protector. I've had more compliments on my iphones using that silver color front screen protector for some reason. When before I started using it I never had anyone comment on my phone before. It really makes that big of a change and difference. Now I'm about to read up on the Red touch ID home button. I think that it will look pretty cool against the silver front then it would match my back body skin. They are only about $6 bucks but I don't see how it would still recognize your fingerprint though so I'll have to research that first.

No more than an hour and a half and most times my classes would last one hour. I was able to cover every bit of the material needed in that time frame so all the students who took my class with the intention of just filling an elective to graduate well they ended up learning whether they had planned not to or whether they had any interest as I always made probing remarks which sparked full discussion which brought everyone in to contribute. title: Awesome Battery

title: public wifi

thread.text:
I am unable to get internet access when connected to public wifi spots such as Walmart and even our condo clubhouse.
A notice came up saying possible unsafe connection or something like that.
Is there a setting I need to turn on?
I get that occasionally -- I'm not sure if there's anything you can do. If there's an option that says "Proceed via browser anyway," you could try that, but that doesn't always work either.

replies.text:
Thanks, went to the clubhouse, Walmart and a McDonalds after posting and tried again.
This time I got internet at all 3, McD's is tricky because you have to wait for a sign in on your browser, but I knew that so just did what was necessary. Walmart this time just worked fine. 
Hopefully this is not something that will let me down. When in Florida for the winter I have a lot of data from T-Mobile but at home I only buy a small package and rely on public sources a lot.
Is this a problem on other phones as well? My zenfone never had this problem. Wonder if it is related to later android versions and more security built in.

thread.text: For me, it usually happens at Safeway. It's happened on my previous phones (Pixel XL, Nexus 6P, Zenfone 2). Haven't had my 2 XL long enough to check, but it will probably happen at some point. I don't know the details, but I would suspect it has more to do with poor quality/security for that public wi-fi, rather than the phone.
This issue happened to my phones too and not just the Honor 8. You should be able to continue by agreeing to proceed anyway.

I sometimes get that notification warning; and a time or two, my Honor 8 wouldn't connect to my home Wi-Fi! Sometimes it's just a glitch with the connection or phone; and others, the public Wi-Fi can be a little spotty. I'd always have trouble connecting to Wi-Fi on Greyhounds; regardless of the phone I'd be using at the time.
Does restarting the phone helps ?

title: Why is my phone becoming unresponsive while charging?

thread.text:
Recently and randomly my Honor 8 has been locking up during charging. The phone indicator light showing the green for full charge works. I can remove and insert the plug and it comes on and off but nothing else works, just a black screen. I hold and reset the phone for it to work again. 
The phone is fairly warm when I find it after these situations but nothing to hot to touch.

title: Phone Shutting Down

thread.text: Twice I've had my Honor 8 out of the blue flash a low power warning then start shutting down. The 1st time I plugged it in on time and it started charging and was at 45%. Today I didn't get it on the charger quick enough and it shut down. I plugged it in and when it came back on again it was at 45%. Anyone else have any issues like, heard of it with the Honor 8 or any other clues?
I had a Moto phone do that. Customer service recommended that I do a fdr. Worth a shot. Make sure to backup data first.

Sounds like a defective battery. It can't handle 100% load and "dies". That's why it has a charge left when you boot it up. It usually happens with old, crappy (3rd party) or a defective battery. So check for a warrant replacement

replies.text: This is good. If factory reset doesn't work, then definitely get a warranty replacement
Yeah, I was going to suggest a warranty replacement if that didn't fix the issue too

thread.text: I hate to hear that because it's a huge hassle to deal with Huawei honor sending it back in. They want the original receipt and a slew of pictures sent in before they will issue you a return label. As far as how long it takes I'm not sure. I just know I attempted to get my first honor 8 repaired through warranty on a charging defect but after I saw how difficult it was going to be plus I didn't want to go without my honor that long I decided to sell it as it still charged but you had to manually go into settings and change a setting to allow it to charge. So I disclosed it and sold it which was why I left honor for the very first time after using that phone for about 5 months straight. Good luck. I hope you can resolve it rather than having to send it in with all that hassle they put you through.

replies.text: Oh wow that's really complicated. Man, hope mine never has problems.
Wow. That's a lot of steps just to get the return labels. Such a hassle

thread.text: Thanks everyone for all the help. it doesn't happen weekly or monthly yet. Probably twice in the last 4 months and I've had it for almost a year. I'll look into all options and reply back.

replies.text: Remember that warranty is only a year though. So if you plan to send it in... Do it soon.
If you're hitting that one year mark. Send it right away...

title: Question please about 7.0

thread.text: I'm used to running the latest software like Oreo with my Nexus 6p I sold to buy the honor 8. I know we all are only on 7.0 which I hope that changes soon but does 7.0 have the Doze feature? I don't recall if it started with 7.1.1 or if 7.0 had it. Reason I ask is because my battery is really taking a hit overnight when I sleep. Is anyone else having this issue and if so what have you done to balance it out? I need some advice big time on this one if you guys don't mind. I've totally optimized the phone so I dont have any apps running in the background. How can I stop loosing so much battery when my phone is asleep too? I thought that was what Doze was for?? Anyone can help me I would greatly appreciate it.

I think I may have figured out why some of major battery consuming apps were still running in the background. I went to apps and although it was a pain I clicked on every app then hit data usage then I restricted the app from running in the background while not in use. This should definitely help my battery but let me ask, wasn't that was what Doze was for? Every night I go to sleep I wake the next morning to find my battery has drained a lot. It shouldn't be doing this. If anyone has anything else I can do that you advise please let me know.

replies.text: Set it up to close apps on screen lock.

thread.text: Doze started with 6.0. As for why your phone is behaving that way, can't say.
With a battery monitor, like Gsam, you can see if Doze is being triggered.
I think Android 7.0 still has a few battery Gremlins in it. 7.1 apparently fixed a lot of issues concerning battery life. I think the honor 8 will see Oreo before it see 7.1.

replies.text: I think I read that Huawei likes to push major letter updates. That's why we are still on 7.0.0

thread.text: what is a doze feature

replies.text: Doze is a feature we all should have I think or it maybe only available on 7.1.1 but when your phone goes to sleep after a few minutes of non use and sitting still it will recognize this thus doze I I'll kick in shutting off all your running apps in the background and you get zero battery drainage during the doze time. Whether its 30 minutes or 4 hours. Your battery essentially won't drain whole doze is kicked in. Upi might loose one to two percent overnight with doze but I'm unsure if it's a feature that's on 7.0 other if it's only on 7.1.1 and up.
Oh! Where in the settings do I find this? Sounds nice
You don't. It's enabled by default. There's no settings for this. It's just part of the system.
Ahhh no wonder I can't find it

Oh it should be an automatic setting that automatically kicks in when after just a few minutes of your phone sitting still and asleep. The only thing is though I'm unsure if 7.0 offers it or if its 7.1.1 or higher. I feel like it's 7.1.1 or higher bc when I first got the honor 8 my phone was draining overnight like crazy until I went in settings and essentially did the same thing to my phone that doze does which turns off all the apps running in the background while not in use so now when my phone goes to sleep my battery does not drain anymore. Just go in settings and type in optimize and go to that setting and it allows you to shut down all your apps running in the background all at one time which is basically does the same thing doze does. Except you manually have to do it on 7.0 or lower I believe. Double check me on that by a Google search about what upgrade did doze come with. There is no setting for doze as it just automatically kicks in after your phone goes to sleep and is sitting still after a few minutes so in theory it will work during the day too when times you aren't using your phone which will save your battery life. If you've not optimized your honor yet I highly recommend that you do. My battery life is ten times better now but leave open the apps that you still want to allow to refresh like your email or Facebook which I didn't but I did for Instagram on mine. I left three open to continue to run. The rest are completely shut down after I get out of the app itself.
I charge my phone overnight to ensure 100% battery life when I wake up

I don't have to charge my phone overnight anymore if it's close to full before I go to bed since I optimized it shutting down all the running apps in the background that drain the battery while it sleeps or in stand by mode. It's helped a lot. I of course charge mine to at night if it needs it if down below 75 percent but I can be right at the same the next morning if I don't charge it overnight now. You should optimize yours too. It helps your battery life tremendously. Just go to settings and search optimize and it will bring up that setting to allow you to shut down all your apps from running while in stand by mode. It made a huge difference when I did it to mine. I don't have to charge my phone near as much as I used to.

Oh that's great. Optimizing your phone to keep the battery life last longer is good. But I'm a pretty heavy user for most of the time so my phones battery doesnt last as long as I want it. Also, I love waking up to 100% in the afternoon...
Optimizing doze doesn't help very much when the screen is on
I'm sure. Only when it's off I'm assuming
Yup. Only whenever screen is off
I think that I need to do this
It is enabled by default in the system already

thread.text: Doze was in marshmallow, it's an improved version in nougat so all versions of nougat have it.

replies.text: Thanks!
Yup it is discussed herehttps://m.androidcentral.com/inside-...hat-does-it-do
I'll look into this !
It's a pretty good article written bye Jerry. I strongly recommend it to those who want to learn about done
Yes thanks for sharing.
Sure thing. If you have any technical android questions then you can always count on Jerry giving some solid information about it

thread.text: Why such the seem to heated debate between you two. I think we should all agree to disagree. In time both Huawei and honor will release more phones whether it be sooner or later. The honor 8 is their US flagship. Their plans are to enter the US. If they were not to update the honor 8 at least here due to it being their flagship then that would be one of the worst business decisions they could possibly make here and believe me they didn't become number three or two in the world based off bad business decisions. They know they have to be careful here in the US bc they know they are about to enter it for the long term. I don't see them making a bad decision upsetting a base of US customers they've already established and not update their US flagship phone any further. Will the update be on a timely manner? No I don't think so but they will indeed make sure they update this phone as promised. Why would they even entertain entering the US market with a poor reputation before they officially enter in to our market. None of that makes any sense for a sound business decision. I just think we will be late getting the update but they will follow through with their business promise to the established customer base they have here. It's not going to be one extreme or another meaning they will jump on it right away nor not ever do it. I believe they will just not be in any hurry to do so. That's my take on it from owning my own business and always thinking about my customers first. So we all will eventually get what they initially promised but the only question is "when".

I will say that Huawei made the task of building brand recognition in the USA a bit more difficult for themselves last year by splitting their product line into Huawei and Honor. Both new names to the USA market. So they made their task of building recognition twice as much work! 
We know they are going to release the Mate 10 Pro in the USA and keep building the Huawei brand here. I guess we'll just have to wait and see what else they have planned. But I sure hope USA sees more from Huawei and Honor than just the Mate 10 pro.

replies.text: I personally think we will remain to continue to see both in way or another. Whether or not if they release another honor flagship would be my question to them. I know it's been stated that the honor 8 sales were poor but I think personally they expected this as the phone is only an unlocked device with no carrier ties then add that Huawei Honor was already unknown here. To me this makes total sense that they would have never expected the honor or Huawei phones in the US to break any records in sales or in other words they knew it was only a starting point. I feel for what they were up against that the honor 8 did just as they expected it would if not better due to the circumstances that we're in place upon it's initial release. This is why I believe we will still see both brands continued to be released in the US as from here they will only grow stronger in the US market just now only having just established themselves here which has only been for a year now. With all that said I think they have not done all that bad. Look at the mate 9 which was released after the honor 8. It did pretty well here and it was twice as expensive as the honor 8 which was the phone that actually put them on the map in the US bringing their brand recognition into existence. I believe they know exactly what they are doing business wise and they already know what phones will be next to be released but simply not disclosing it for business anticipation purposes. Keeping people interested in what's coming next is a marketing scheme in business. Again they did not become number two world wide for poor business decisions. That's why I believe we will in fact get more updates to the honor 8 as it's their current honor flagship here in the US and also the phone that sparked their initial presence in the US. I don't see them just totally not giving the honor 8 what they promised as a good business practice from a strong more than well established mobile phone company that's number two world wide. My question to them would be will they continue with both brands here in a flagship manner or will they focus their efforts on one more than the other moving forward. I do think they will follow through with their previous stated commitments to all the phones they've released here thus far. I think personally they will continue to release a mixture of both honor and Huawei to Target two different customer bases. Just like their branding already is which Huawei being their high end flagship and honor bring their upper end mid range. That's been successful in every part of the rest of the world so I think the same will apply here in the US but right now they are still very new to this market so we are only seeing them grow slowly as I would expect that anyway with an unknown company of any kind in a new market. You have to establish yourself first by delivering on promises which builds a strong customer base do I see them actually releasing more phones than less phones but still on a slow progression over the next two years which by that time they will be just about ready to officially enter the US full blown and by then most of the US will then already be familiar with them as a superior mobile phone company strictly based off their track record they've slowly established.
That is true. One brand is easier to push for recognition. I understand what they where doing... Tackling both the high end and lower end simultaneously... But that's a difficult task
Once the US get used to it then it will be fine and just the norm for them here to do it that way. But until then it can be confusing yes.

thread.text:

I mean I only paid $199 for a 64g honor 8 although it was an open box it was still new. Still new packaging and everything. Only the box seal had been opened. How could I beat that price with any other phone but I do hope we get our updates still. I definitely don't won't to have just bought a dated device you know. You think I made the right decision?

My only concern would be warranty, not sure how that works out in this case. Otherwise, yeah, I think from what you said previously that it's the best option for you

I think I still actually get the full warranty on it as when I got it I logged in to honors site and went through the entire phone registration providing my IMEI along wirh having to upload my receipt from where I bought it. How they would know it's an open box I don't think they would. The registration went through totally fine and I got a message stating that my phone had been successfully registered through HiHonor. I'm assuming that's means my warranty started as it had me provide a date of purchase which matched the uploaded receipt. Hopefully I'm covered there. I think I am but I could totally be wrong. What do you think now knowing that I registered it?
Well the issue would be if someone else activated the phone before you. If not then I think you should get the entire 1 year warranty, assuming that you are the first owner.

Activated by that you mean just simply turning it on or going through the registration process like I did. How would they know the phone has ever been turned on before me as if it was an open box that very well be the case. So am I okay as long as they didn't register the phone? I registered it no problem.
I am not sure how their system is but Apple warranty starts the day the phone is first activated. Apple keeps a record of that. Not sure whether Huawei does though
I am going to call them and make sure my phone is under warranty real quick. Stand by for an update.

I am definitely concerned about the Oreo update which I've used Oreo before when I had the Nexus 6p and Oreo was set up nicely. I'm wanting it more so as I'm hoping that update is better optimized for better battery life for the honor 8. Also it's a mental thing wanting the latest updates from which we all were told we'd get for buying the phone. Hopefully I'll be able to get the Mate 9 to be my media phone for movies are other things. The honor 8 is just easier to use on a daily basis. The Mate 9 is just too large to use daily but perfect to rotate out with the honor.

I absolutely love the honor 8 and it kills me to think that honor might not be releasing another honor flagship here in the US for a long while. I so hope I'm totally wrong about that as Huawei Honor is by far my favorite company. They offer you a ton of phone for the money. To me the honor 8 is very much a flagship type phone with maybe just two corners cut on it which is the weak speaker and the lack of 4k video but I personally don't record videos anyway so that doesn't matter to me. Everything else about the phone is on a flagship type level. I personally like a all metal build better over all glass but still though the honor 8s build quality is still that of a flagship. All I need now is either a honor or Huawei larger screen device for my media phone and I'll be set for a long time.
Yah my G6 seems a bit laggy lately. Especially on the camera department. Kinda ruining it for me rn

Yes you did! To illustrate, I usually upgrade my devices every 12-18 months - and not just because I would want a new phone, but because my current phone would have issues at around the year mark. My Nexus 5's battery was dying. My LG G3's battery was corrupt, the phone lagged, and it took 16 hours to charge.
My Honor 8, at almost eleven months old, has had minimal issues. Sure, the battery is maybe a little bit less than it was almost a year ago; but it still gives me excellent mileage. Barely any lag; and there's only the odd hiccup or two. I've never been this satisfied with a device. Also, I've never been so torn as to whether or not to upgrade. I've decided to wait because I love my phone too much.
Don't worry! This is a great phone for an excellent price. It will hold up for you! Especially since you treat your phones well!
Mine is holding up well too. No issues here with mine.
Awesome! They seem to hold up really well. I am shocked. It kind of snuck up on me - the fact that it's been a year (almost) and I've had minimal issues with the device thus far. Yay!

I appreciate that. I'm just gun shy of swappa as the only transaction I've done on there turned out to be the guy tried to scam me and sold me a defective device. The bottom portion of the screen was totally discolored and he sold it to me knowing that. I of course got my money back but it ended up being a huge hassle on me. I was not happy about it. I've yet to send back all the accessories that I had bought for that defective phone back to Amazon so I still need to get to the UPS store and get my money back. He cost me money and hardship.

Yeah unfortunately, things happen. I have had issues but they all got resolved ok. A little headache of course but such is life buying and selling used stuff. Heck I have problems with new purchases too... This year alone amazon has lost like half a dozen of my orders. I have also received a few defective items even ones bought brand new.

Oh goodness man. I'm sorry to hear that. Yeah I know my deal was not typical but what got to me is that the guy knew very well that the screen was defective and still sold it to me. The reason I know he knew it was bc he tried to say it happened during shipment lol. That box was pristine and you could tell that discoloration had been there a while. He just thought I wouldn't notice bc unless you were on a white screen it was hard to see. But on a white screen you could easily tell and I picked up on it during the set up and I immediately called him and he was stuttering then he claimed it happened during shipping but I was mad at him at that point so he ended up sending me $25 dollars to ship it back plus he gave me the $10 dollar swappa fee and then he refunded me as soon as it was trackable in UPS site. You don't do all those things for someone if you truly didn't know it was already defective. It just left a bad taste in my mouth like wow who can you actually trust these days. I left him negative feedback as there is no doubt that he knew plus he cost me about $75 dollars in accessories that I've still not had the chance to send back yet plus it's going to be a huge hassle bc I've got separate ups labels for everything. Anyways I won't let that get in the way from me buying again from swappa as I know I'll have to take the leap of faith again. I hope to locate a deal on a Mate 9 on there when I get ready to buy one. That 5.9 inch screen will be awesome for movies and media type stuff and I'll rotate the two phones out quite a bit too. The honor 8 will no doubt be my main go to phone but there will be days or weeks where I'll use the Mate 9 full time too. It's just a big phone and hard to put in your pocket. I wonder how the 1080p looks on the mate 9 as that is a very large screen to only be using 1080p. Does anyone know if it's amoled or not? I've not heard either way or not. I would hope so. 1080p is fine on the honor 8 bc it's only 5.2 inches but you're talking right at a 6 inch screen just to only have 1080p. Anyone know if this has been an issue on viewing experience? I know it's great for battery life. By the way I've done a lot of stuff in settings to help preserve my battery life on my honor 8 which has gotten better from when I first got it. I optimized it to shut down most all the apps from running in the background after I stop using them. That helped a lot. I left my email open to refresh and Instagram open to refresh. I definitely shut down YouTube as it was a battery hog and killer in the background until I optimized it. Now my stand by battery is much better.
Mate 9 is an LCD display. My phone is 6.3". I don't see a significant difference between 1080p and higher. But it depends on your eyes
I see the difference but definitely not a huge difference. Huawei makes great LCD display phones.
Well the mate 9 for example has a good panel, but in terms of accuracy, it isn't as good as the competition.
Looks like iPhone X display took the crown from the Note 8 for the best ever display in a phone.
True but the note 8 display is still significantly more accurate than the mate 9.
Yup and it should. The screen on that bad boy is amazing.

What phone do you have that's 6.3 inches? I bet that's an awesome media phone. That is huge! So yours you have that is 6.3 is a 1080p? Well if you don't see any difference on it then the Mate 9 at 5.9 inches should be fine too then. That's the next phone I'd really like to get my hands on to be my media device. The Mate 9 does look nice! I too have found myself looking at Huawei phones for my next upgrade. They seem to be the only ones that meet all of my criterion. I've heard great things about the Mate 9's camera too, I believe? It seems like an all-around great smartphone.

thread.text: Unfortunately we won't ever see it though. That phone has been out a while now so we know it's not coming here. I hate that we are missing out on quite a few great phones here from Huawei Honor. Heck we only have three phones of theirs to choose from now. That's all and all three are well over a year old now. The more and more I think about it the more I begin to think that we may not see anything else at all until they enter the US. I hope I am totally wrong but they certainly have not gave us any indication of any new releases here. I know why which is what I read in an article which they stated that the US is not their priority right now. Unfortunate.

replies.text: It's too bad. Is Europe their priority? They make such good, quality phones.

I believe you are right. They of course focus their efforts everywhere else but the US. I believe they have recently entered other parts of the world and are of course growing there too. Pretty much the US market is the only part of the world and they hold no market share in and just think how powerful the US is in terms of sales and recognition for any company for that matter but yet Huawei Honor somehow has managed to still become number two in the world without any US market share. So think about it. Once they enter the US and establish themselves here which won't take but a year or two, think just how powerful and big they will in fact become. There is no possible way that they won't take the number one position in the world within the mobile industry once getting a strong hold here in the US. The US is one of the most powerful or if the most elite places in the world and that goes for everything to include global sales recognition. Once Huawei honor establishes themselves here they will very quickly within two years of entering the US then having ties with the four major carriers here become number one world wide. I don't think they will ever surpass Apple for being number one in the US alone but world wide they no doubt will be on top. They are full of innovation which leads to creativity that leads to superior and unique products that grow sales. We in the US only have access to only three of their many many devices which are the honor 8, mate 9 and honor 6x. A lot have stated here that the honor 8 did poorly in terms of sales here but I think honor already knew that would in fact be the case and the honor 8 actually did better here than what honor had initially projected for the honor 8. It's why I think the honor 8 will indeed get updated with Oreo but very late though bc the US as they have stated in articles I've read isn't their priority right now. Huawei honors plan is to enter the US when 5g rolls out and all the major carriers are offering it which 5g not only will be much faster but from what I read it will open up avenues for the mobile tech industry that we've never seen before. That's when Huawei plans to officially enter the US which I believe that to be about two years away now. So one day we will get the opportunity to choose from all of their already superior to Samsung products and I look forward to that. Personally I'll always be more of a fan of the honor line bc they offer flagship level and spec devices at an affordable price just like the honor 8 is. I've heard and read on multiple occasions that the Kirin 950 is comparable to the 820 flagship processor. What flagship phone that uses the 820 can you get for 300 dollars here in the US that you can think of for the same price? I can't think of any. So if they stay true to their superior mid range devices at such an affordable price there is no way they will not dominate the US in the near future. It's a big reason why I'm such a fan of the honor 8. It's an amazing flagship level device that can be had for around $300 or at times even cheaper. That's unheard of here.
You aren't wrong but they are taking quantity over quality. Think about it though... One Chinese carrier has a lot more customers than all the usa carriers combined.

It's too bad that Honor has not gained too much recognition in the States. It's very similar here in Canada, too. I have yet to see another person with an Honor 8; or an Honor device in general. Huawei itself, however, seems to be doing better with its Mate line. Not sure how the P-series phones are doing, but I sure like them! Haha.
It'd be great to see more of an Honor presence in North America. It's sad because I think a lot of users will merely go for "what's in" as opposed to trying something different. Sure, trying anything new is always a gamble; but with some research users would see that these products still deliver an exemplary experience - at a fraction of the cost of flagships like Apple and Samsung.
But as others have pointed out, we phone geeks are often the exception when it comes to doing lots of our own research and trying new or "unique" devices.

I do like honor but I can't recommend anything other than apple, and perhaps a carrier phonesimply because Huawei repair is not on par with Apple where you can bring it in and get it fixed same day. Mentally I wanted the 64g just because it just has more space but when I think about it I'd never even come close to filling it up plus it saved me about $75 dollars getting the 32g model as I only paid $199 for mine that's arriving tomorrow.

If you are planning to keep it long term, I would go with the 64gb just to be safe. Especially now that you are still within your return period. You don't want to come back in a few months and go... Crap.. I should have done 64gb.
Normally I would say for you 32gb is enough but I am recommending the 64gb since you said that you plan on keeping the honor 8 long term.

title: How's everyone's battery life doing?

thread.text: So I did a few things to my honor to help my battery life like I optimized all my apps not to run in the background while I'm not using them and my stand by battery life has become great. I can turn my phone off for a while and my battery won't hardly even drain. If you have not optimized your phone by turning off all apps running in the background when not in use I would highly recommend it to her the best battery life you can get. It's amazingly better.

My battery life is still pretty decent after about eleven months of use; but I have noticed a minimal drop in performance. I've disabled some apps from running in the background; so perhaps I'll disable a few more. Thank you!

replies.text: I personally shut everyone of my apps off in the background except my email bc I wanted it to refresh itself. My battery has improved drastically. I think you should. It will certainly help you.
Great! What about Facebook? But when I think about it, it's not all too significant for me to get Facebook notifications right when they arrive.
Facebook app is notoriously bad. Lots of complaints. I intentionally don't use the app.
I've heard that! I usually just try and ignore the drain. But I've thought about using a browser Facebook alternative app.
Try it out and let us know how it goes!
Yeah this can certainly help. No need to keep apps that you don't need updating active in the background. Although it may take a little bit longer to open

thread.text: Mine is still going strong. No complaints here

It's very unique. That's why I've grown to like it so much so if I get the iPhone 8 it'll be hard to let the honor go for sure. I'll definitely miss this forum for sure. thread.text: I only left two or three apps open to run in the background and it definitely improved my battery life. Especially the stand by or sleep time. When I first got it the drain overnight was bad. After I optimized it it barely drains any now overnight. Quite a difference. When I'm using it heavy though it'll drain pretty quick but I guess that happens to all batteries. Sometimes I'll use my phone more heavy than other times and I'll notice the drain it takes on my battery.

replies.text: More heavy usage in the phone the battery will indeed drain faster. I can make my phone last longer if I do simple tasks and not so much videos watching
Same here
That's good to hear that you were able to optimize to get better battery life

thread.text: I'm on my phone heavy in spurts. Not all the time but when I do it's heavy for a little while.

replies.text: Oh that can really kill the battery

Yeah I've noticed that. I'll be at 100 percent and before I know it I'm down to 50 percent but only under continued use but I typically do this in spurts say like being on this forum. When I get on I'll stay on for a little while then put it down to come back later and do it over again. But like overnight I get hardly any drainage now. At first it was draining overnight rapidly. It's odd they don't ship you the phone to be as optimized as it can be out of the box. You'd think that would be standard but no you have to go into settings and dig for the function or on some phones it only allows you to do it one app at a time. The honor allows you to shut them all down at once where my 6p I had to go to one app at a time to shut it off from running in the background which is a major pain but the reward is huge as battery life is twice a good after optimizing your apps to not run in the background. To be honest I don't see the need to have to continue to keep running in the background anyway. I would think phones would be made to have the highest standard for optimization as possible. Speaking of that I think that is why IOS rune so well and is so efficient. Apps shut down after a certain time upon closing them where Android keeps theirs running unless you find the setting to shut them off. The iPhone 8 only has a 1900 amp battery but the battery life is great lasting over a full day on one charge. Then it is faster than Android but only runs off of 2 gigs of RAM vs Android having double and triple that in ram so I don't understand why people say that Android is just as efficient as IOS is. It's not true at all. Think if our honor 8 ran off of only 2gigs of ram. Our performance would be horrible compared to how good it is now. I'm not exactly sure how Apple does it but they definitely have a more efficient optimized software. I'm not sure if that's why it runs so butter smooth or not either. I have never experienced lag with IOS or EMUI but I definitely have with Samsung's flagships. Even Moto phones I've experienced lag. I honestly don't know how huawei honor is able to place such a heavy skin on top of Android which is so heavy that it totally transforms the software to not be like Android at all but yet they've some how done it and the honor runs as smooth as IOS with absolutely zero lag. I've never experienced any lag with any of my honor phones. No choppy or sticky experience. Apps open up immediately and the phone never stutters. Not even if you have multiple apps open in your task menu too. Does anyone know what honor does differently than say like Samsung's touchwiz which is notorious for lagging and stutter. Even the S8 lagged and stuttered and it ran off the 835 Snapdragon and had four gigs of RAM and their skin is nowhere near as heavy as EMUI. Here is what bodyguardz says
"3—Determining the Perfect Thickness
To determine the ideal thickness for the BodyGuardz Pure®, we ran extensive tests on varied measurements. We ultimately chose a .4mm thickness, which is about the thickness of four sheets of paper. This is only slightly thicker than most glass screen protectors on the market, but it makes a big difference when it comes to impact protection. 
As thickness increases, the strength of the glass goes up exponentially, which means it doesn't take much to add a significant amount of durability. 
Here’s some quick math to help you understand: BodyGuardz Pure® is .4mm thick, and most competitors’ glass is .32mm thick. To better illustrate this, we’ll give the Pure® a thickness of 10, and the competitors’ glass a thickness of 8. 
To determine strength, we take thickness to the third power. For the Pure®, 10x10x10=1,000. For the competitors’ glass, 8x8x8=512. That’s almost double the strength for just a paper thickness difference."http://forums.androidcentral.com/e?l...token=-jazZ1jz

I just took my screen protector off and I have a tip for all of you who want to reuse a screen protector that has gotten stuff under on the glass itseld. Take it to the sink and douse it with dishwashing soap and spread it evenly on the screen then grab a wrag and wet it and then proceed to pretty much scrub the back side of the protector while the soap is on there. Then after you've cleaned it well wash it off under the running water until all the soap is gone. Then dry the front side of it off with something but be sure you don't touch the wet back sticky side. Bang it a couple times on it's bottom edge to get as much water off as you can then take a credit card and swegee the rest of the standing water on the back sticky side off until dry. Then you now have a perfectly new screen protector ready to install. I know this works as I've done it several times in the past and I've done it twice with this one I just got from either something getting under the screen protector stuck on the sticky side or I've gotten fingerprints on the sticky side so I used the process on it I just explained and it's as good as new to reinstall. I'll post some new pics of it installed accurately now and you will notice when I post pics that you won't see any smudges on it as I washed them completely off with the soap and wet wrag. It really works great and will save you money from ordering a new one thinking that you've ruined yours by taking it off and getting dust and fingerprints on sticky part. You can just wash everything off and you have a new protector again.

thread.text: Have you checked out the GKK cases for Honor 8 ? They don't have a clear case but they offered some amazing protection. Even covers up the bezels top and bottom

Yeah I have about 6 or 7 cases for my honor 8. Maybe even 8. Half of them are Red and the rest a mixture of different colors. All of them are thin low profile cases. Nothing with bulk. Ive gotten to where I prefer not to use a case bc I like the feel of slim the phone feels without one. So if I use a case it's got to be very slim and form fitting. I also only use the TPU rubber type cases. The only two cases that aren't are my two honor made clear cases that are the thinnest with the least protection which is what I use the most. It protects all four corners but has no impact protection like my slim rubber cases do. I just like searching for new cases that look good to me and that I know are thin and I'll typically order them but they have to meet my criteria before I would even consider buying one. I'm quite picky when it comes to my phones. The color of the phone is big time important to me as I've sold phones that I liked before bc it wasn't the color I really wanted. Also as I've learned Android I've become picky about which brand phones that I will consider using in terms of interface and smoothness. That's why I have always come back to the honor 8 this being my third time owning the phone. I know now that EMUI is my favorite Android interface to use which honestly I don't even really consider EMUI to even be Android bc when you compare it to all other Android phones it's nothing even remotely like Android at all. Especially EMUI 4.1 which im thinking about rolling back to as I liked it the best bc it was the most different than Android honor has offered yet. Each new update of theirs brings more and more of stock Android into play which I'm not in any way a fan of Android. I prefer Apple IOS ten fold over Android and thus another reason why I like EMUI as in a way it has some similarities to IOS but near as much as lots of people claim that it does. It's a hybrid type software unique to it's own formation meaning there is nothing quite like it. So you really cannot compare EMUI to Android nor IOS because it's really neither of the two. It has it's own unique and different signature. That's why I believe that 4.1 could have been branded and marketed as it's own and third major software choice to Android and IOS had Huawei honor wanted to go that route but I know it would be way too expensive and time consuming to build an entire new eco system around EMUI so their only choice was to lump it in with Android and make it compatible to the Google play store. If I had to choose between Android, IOS or EMUI I would definitely choose EMUI and I do believe once Huawei honor comes to the US that EMUI will have a huge cult like following of people who prefer it over stock Android. Almost every review I see about the honor 8 the reviewer has something negative to say about EMUI but what they fail to say all of them is why. I think just bc it's big time different they automatically think it's bad bc it's not stock Android but I say to them what is so imnensley great about stock Android which is sticky and choppy when these companies bogging it down with their own skins where Huawei honor manage to place their more than very heavy skin on Android but yet it still runs as smooth as IOS with no lag and not choppy and sticky at all like most others are. They've optimized the software extremely well or they've totally done something different than the other Android skins have on all the other phones. The only phones that run as smooth as EMUI is the pure Android experience like the Nexus 6p or the what took the place of the 6p which is the pixel in which it runs as Google states like Android was intended to run in its natural form without any type of skin on it and I can tell you from owning the Nexus 6p that it ran like butter no lag no choppy or sticky but fluid just like EMUI does so Huawei Honor has definitely done something different since their skin runs butter smooth compared to all other skins out there. Look at Samsung touchwiz. That's the most laggy choppy sticky Android experience you can get but everyone seems to love them. Makes no sense to me. When you can use pure Android and get that IOS like interface or use EMUI and get it too so all these people who say EMUI needs a Nova launcher does not make any sense unless you are just a die hard stock Android fan which I'm not and I welcome change and to be different and unique standing out of the crowd instead of blending in. That's why Huawei honor will end up becoming number one once they establish themselves here in the US which is one of the most powerful markets in the world. Once they gain popularity here watch how fast they shoot up to number one in the world over taking Samsung at the top. I'm frustrated with Huawei honor right now bc they are totally neglecting the US from some awesome phones that we all would love the opportunity to buy and use. In not even sure now that they will even release another honor flagship here to replace the honor 8 nor am I convinced that they will follow through with their two year promise of updates that would and should give us Oreo now so if they don't start realizing they do have a strong customer base here and continue to leave us out then I'll for sure go back to Apple and they will loose me as a faithful supporter and customer. I hope Huawei reads my posts. If they would I'd like to think they would make a difference but I doubt they do so my post is in vain anyway lol.

replies.text: Yeah I agree. I don't think we will see it any time soon but that we will sure get it now after I posted the question on XDA. My thread consist of everyone stating that it's a definite that we will in fact receive the major update. I can tell you guys from having recently owned the 6p that Oreo is very nice. It's better than nougat and appeared to be optimized much better. Settings were a different color and it grouped them up to show less settings but to open one up lead to more detailed setting features. It just cleaned up the settings. There were a couple of other things I noticed but I don't recall right this second. If I think of them I'll post it here. I had gotten a flat out steal on a brand new 6p but it's so big I just couldn't use it as my daily driver so I sold it and doubled my money on it. The 6p and the honor 8 are my two most favorite Android phones. I can tell you that pure stock Android is truly like butter. As Google states it's Android ad Google intended Android to run. Which is without any skin that bogs the UI down which in turn gives you that choppy and sticky lag you get with most Android phones. The only other phone that I've used in Android without any choppy lag is the honor 8. EMUI is just so different and totally unique and it's remotely nothing like pure stock Android like you get on the 6p and pixel devices. Pure android also gives you way less added features as it's truly vanilla in terms of interface. That's why I like EMUI so much. Huawei somehow optimized their skin not to big down the UI and to still run just as smooth if not smoother than pure stock Android plus with EMUI you get a ton of ways to customize your phone where you don't with pure stock Android. Some have even called pure android dull but it was ever so smooth. If I were not to use a honor 8 I'd probably go with the 5 inch pixel 2 as I do not like what these companies are doing now these days with the screen ratios. They are making them 18.9 which makes the phone way too narrow therefore the proportion is just off and weird. I know bc I had bought the Samsung S8 and I could not stand it. Plus it still lagged even with a 835 chip in it. I like the honor 8 ten times better than the S8 but these 18.9 screen ratios make zero sense to me. All they are doing is taking away screen real estate from both sides and making the phone taller and it's odd watching a movie in that ratio. The 16.9 typical ratio is the best and I just think it's a fad right now that will soon go away. It's just looks to be totally off and the screen is way too narrow.

title: Check out these oval icons I found today for the Honor 8

thread.text: So I went through the play store and downloaded all the EMUI apps. One of them had a ton of different icon packs. I saw these oval shaped icons and thought they looked pretty killer. I downloaded them and applied them and am currently using them. Then I found an app with tons of different themes you can download the apply. I've downloaded quite a few of them. I'm definitely keeping the icons but my theme might change although I'm typically a fan of a solid color background on my phones. Here they are. Tell me what you guys think about the icons. I like them bc they are very different. The honor 8 is very customizable actually. They have a lot that allows you to totally change on this phone which I really like. I've been thinking about returning this one and upgrading to a 64g but I can't decide. I've got 30 days to decide but in reality 32g with a 64g SD card should be sufficient long term don't you guys think? Tell me your thoughts on that and what you think I should do. Other than apps and these themes that's all I download. I stream music and movies so in theory long term I should be okay with the 32g plus I only paid $199. That's a pretty good deal to throw away. I just cannot decide bc I really wanted the sapphire blue color in a 64g. That being said I really don't think I'm going to need the 64g and I can easily live with the black color I got. Tell me or advise me as to what to do. If I did return this one I'd have to wait until black Friday to ensure I get a good deal on a 64g bc I'm on a tight budget so is it even worth the trouble of doing that or having to wait until black Friday to get my other honor 8? I need some advice big time on what I should do. Please give me your thoughts if you don't mind and here's those oval shaped icons too.
Nice, I like it. Kinda like the Samsung squircle icons. Are you using the stock launcher? What's the name of the app that had the icons?

replies.text: It's called EMUI themes. In fact there are two of them called that. Download both of them. One will have over 30 themes and the other will a few themes with several icon packs. There are some cool looking icon packs on that app so you might see something you like better than the oval I found as there are several to choose from.
I'll give it a try! Are there folder options too?

I believe so. I've not gone through the entire app as one of them has several sections to it. Both combined has a ton to offer though. The theme app has well over 30 themes I would say. I downloaded several from there. The other one with the icon packs has an entire page of different icons to choose from. I just thought the oval looked different and unique so I chose that one. I didn't even keep looking after I saw the oval and the oval wasn't even half way through the page of them. You will definitely find a few themes you'll like and a couple icon packs at least. I had no idea these apps were even on the play store until last night bc I couldn't sleep so I decided just to search for EMUI apps and I just downloaded all of them and checked them all out and found those best two. They are pretty good with lots to choose from. Check them out. I think you'll find some stuff you will like. It's a big variety of everything.

Yeah I invite change. You be happy you did it.

Show us your screenshots so we can see your handiwork!

Oh my, there's so many!? A bit overwhelming so for now im gonna go with a pixel 2 theme till I find something that I really like.

Search pixel launcher Oreo XDA and there you will find a apk file no root required official pixel launcher that is identical to the pixel gestures and set in every way. It stores in your default launcher in settings and you can choose it and you'll get exactly what the pixel gets even down to the newer Google Assistant too.

replies.text: You can downgrade to emui 4.1 if desired.https://club.hihonor.com/in/eyestowo...hould-do.11907
Does that require I root the phone or hook it up to my computer? If so that would be too much trouble. If not I'll definitely have a look into it. Can I upgrade back up at any time too?
I don't believe that it requires a pc. You can upgrade if so desired
Only thing emui 4 is missing is app drawer. If it had one, it'll be just as good as emui 5

Oh man that's my favorite part, no app drawer. If you would have remembered me from way back on the honor 8 you would know I'm like a new of stock EMUIs biggest fans. Even today now that they give you an option for a app drawer I still don't use one. I'm a die hard EMUI fan. I always have been from the very first day I ever used it. Not once in my three times owning this phone have I ever even thought about putting Nova on my honor 8 phones. It's always been straight up stock for me but however I do use Nova on my Android devices. EMUI isn't Android to me. In fact it's nothing remotely like Android other than they had nowhere else to place it at bc Apple would never had let them in their eco system so they had no choice but default to Android. You'd be in shock if you knew how many article type posts I've made about how EMUI could have easily had been branded has the mobile industrys third major software choice offered to consumers. That's just how totally different they are compared to stock Android. EMUI is actually more like IOS compared to Android but Apple would have never ever allowed EMUI in on their software system. Android was EMUIs only choice as to where to be placed. Android is all about customization so even though EMUI is nothing like Android we see it today in Androids eco system. I've heard so many say it's too much like IOS and I disagree. It's a hybrid type software with a little bit of both flavors and then they add their own twist in it too. That's why you won't ever find anything remotely like it. I know if I had my choice between Android, IOS and EMUI that I'd pick EMUI all day long and that's a true testimate to just how extremely different it over the two others. I absolutely love it. I'm a die hard EMUI fan. It's a blast to use every day and I never get tired of it. So if you use Nova I would highly recommend giving the stock no app drawer a try out for a couple weeks and see if you'll ever go back. It's an awesome software experience
I am actually using my honor 8 without the app drawer for a emui experience. It's certainly different
Are you? What do you think? I just don't even think anything of it as I'm so used to it now which is the only way I've ever used EMUI. Soon you won't even notice anymore and prefer it I think.

replies.text: Well there's always a risk whenever putting new software... Although there is an official process so the risk is pretty small.

I may actually try it. I've contacted a friend of mine on the forums here and ask him if he minded helping me step through the process. Although I know a lot about specs of phones and know how to do a few other things I've never tried flashing a new firmware to a phone before mainly due to how many steps it takes and it seems like it's a pain. With 4.1 though which was how I initially learned to use EMUI on it may be worth it in this case as I liked 4.1 much better than the current software the honor 8 is running now. 4.1 was even further away from stock Android and I personally am not a fan of Android at all. EMUI I love because it's nothing like Android and it's still butter smooth the very IOS like fluid. In fact I have an IOS theme installed on my honor 8 right now so all of my icons look like the iPhone. My wallpaper is IOS. My phone dialer has the circles like IOS. I'm a Apple die hard by heart but what I like so much about EMUI is that it's a hybrid software taking elements from both Android and IOS and mixing them together along with Huawei honors own twist to it making it like nothing else any of us has ever seen before on a smart phone. It's in it own league and could easily be branded as it's own major software. There is no way EMUI when stock like I use it is nothing like Android. The look. The feel. The settings. All of it is just highly unique and different as a whole. That's why I prefer it over everything else. It's very innovative and I don't understand why so many people don't like it. It's a very easy and smooth interface to use but they cover it up with like a Nova launcher. I've owned the honor 8 three times now and not once have I ever even thought about putting a different launcher on my honor phones. I use Nova for all of my other Android phones but not stock EMUI. I personally love everything about it and I don't personally see the hype behind it being like IOS except for the lack of the app drawer. I'm been now with the new software having the option to use a app drawer I still do not. I keep mine as near as like 4.1 as possible. I just don't understand why so many dislike EMUI unless they don't enjoy change. I welcome it so anything unique and different to me brings innovation to the table and innovation leads to better experiences which I like. That's a huge reason I'm a fan of Huawei honor because their company is widely built off innovation. The honor 8 is the only Android phone that I personally know of that allows you to mix and match themes, icons and fonts without a third party launcher. That to me is impressive. I've got my honor 8 set up just like an iphone at the moment which I enjoy changing it all up every once in a while. I've located several apps for EMUI that offer 100s of themes, several different icon packs and 100s of different font. Then all the themes have their own set of icons within the theme itself. Here's one of my favorite set ups so far. Check out the icons. They are like some type of wild 3D art work or something and I only accidentally stumbled across this theme because all I could see was the color of the wallpaper I happen to like. I didn't even know about the cool and wild icons it offered.
Sounds like you could try to down grade to emui 4.1

thread.text: I personally liked 4.1. It's initially how I learned to use EMUI on so I would not at all be opposed to going back to 4.1. I also liked the colored icon notifications it gave you and I didn't mind the split screen either in regard to the pull down. If it we're an easy process I would probably go back to 4.1 just because that's what made me originally like EMUI so much. Plus I'm not a huge fan of stock Android which is why I have become to enjoy EMUI so much. It's still nothing like Android whether I go back to 4.1 or stay where I'm at. I still don't use an app drawer nor do I use a third party launcher. I like EMUI stock just the way it is. There is not anything out there remotely like it as it's highly unique and different which was what drew me to it in the first place. Plus the software is highly customizable too which is fun to change it up all the time. Like themes, icons, fonts and wallpaper. I have never used a different launcher on this software though and I never will. It being so different is the best part about it. Plus even though the skin is very heavy it does not make the phone lag any at all say like touchwiz does on Samsung. It's a very smooth and fluid interface.

thread.text: Hey guys I just got back from the Xfinity mobile store. I went with the iPhone 8 in space grey after seeing it in person. I ordered the zagg luxe titanium screen protector where it changes the black front to a silver titanium color. I'm also ordering a full one piece skin that covers the back and frame all in one solid piece so you can't tell a skin is on it. I'm ordering Red so I'll have a red and silver front iPhone to be very unique. You won't see one like it. It will be very cool looking. I had to order it bc they were out of stock so it should arrive Monday or Tuesday. I'll post pics of the total custom mod once I get it completed next week. I got a return label sent for my honor 8 so it'll be gone now. I need that $200 extra dollars to use for my custom mods to the iPhone plus the taxes I had to pay for it. I was forced to get the 256g as the only other option was the 64g. I hate to let the honor go but I'll only be using one phone. Now I need to purchase a wireless charging pad. It was a tough decision but in the end I wanted to go back to apple which is all I know.
