title: How many of you have turned off your Animations in settings?

thread.text: I've recently learned that turning off all animations that you then get a faster performing device which now with every phone I get I turn on developer options in settings and go into it and turn off my animations. It definitely makes a huge difference when opening up apps and speed. How many of you do this too and if you don't I highly recommend doing so. It gives you a faster phone as animations are typically set at 1 for some reason. When I learned this tip it made an immediate performance change as my phone definitely was faster. I've never known why they keep animations on out of the box. Anyone know why by chance? Anyways I was curious who turns their animations off too like I do?

replies.text: I turned off mine right away

thread.text:
I've been trying different animation values for a long time, on different devices, and never liked the result of disabling them completely. Now I keep the three values at 0.5x and I think they are going to stay that way for a while.
Just a note, animation values don't improve the phone performance, just change how fast, or slow, the screen transitions are. It's kind of a placebo, what really changes is your perception of how fast your phone runs.

replies.text: So would you suggest I change mine to .5 as well. Have you found that to be the best number for animations? I've always turned my off but only because I was advised to as I was told the phone would be faster in a way. Is .5 better than turning them off completely? I think that I will go into settings and change mine to the likes of what you have and see if I notice a difference. Thanks for the insight on that. I appreciate it.

It's just a question of personal taste. I've tried different things, leaving the default values, switching them to 0x or 0.5x, changing animation speed and app animation in Nova settings ... For a while I only changed animations from Nova and now I'm trying with 0.5x in the developer options. I always found disabling animations (0x on the three values) too 'jumpy' and a bit annoying.
My only advice is try different things and see what you like more. As I said, performance doesn't improve, you are only changing the visual transitions when you interact with your phone.

thread.text:
Where in settings do you a just animations value? 
Weird I am using AC app and am getting adds for near my home in Canada but my IP is from Florida, and I just loaded the app today

replies.text: Animation values are hidden in the Developer Options. You need to enable them first in Settings - about phone - tap on the build number for 7 times.

thread.text: I guess if they make it difficult then I should not mess with it.

replies.text: They don't make it difficult as they should enhance your experience as they make like opening apps faster and immediate with no lag. I typically keep mine turned off but the poster above advised to set them at .5 so I did that to see what it's like. It's hard to tell but apps do open up instantly the lower you go.
Well, not quite.  My only advice with this kind of ... cosmetic ... changes is always the same. Try and test as much as you want and keep whatever you like.
Of course. Use whatever is best. It really doesn't matter.

You don't really need to. For most users the bulk of those options are useless and a bit dangerous in some cases. They are mostly oriented to developers and sound too cryptic for normal users. 
If you want to try and play around with them feel free to ask anything you need. It's safe, and even fun, if you don't get in there and just tap for the sake of tapping.
Another thing. Unhiding them it's quite easy, but if you want to hide them back you'll need to pay a little price (clearing data for you settings apps and lose your personal changes or, in some cases, doing a factory reset).
All good points. Most users really shouldn't mess with the secret menus like developer options

thread.text: This is what I do in nova launcher at well. things are more smoother.

replies.text: Exactly. Changing animation values in the developer options, and specially disabling them, makes transitions faster, but not more fluid or smooth. Playing with the Nova settings, under Look & Feel, can make things faster and still smooth, depending on what you like.

Well the honor 8 is already fluid and smooth to begin with. It has zero lag of any kind. If there is a setting that will speed up certain aspects then I would want to either change them to best or turn them off if that's the best. I heard both. Turning animations off to be good and keeping them at .5 is good so I'm not really sure which is best to be honest. Probably not enough difference to tell really. Not that I've seen or can tell by trying both settings. Both appear to be quick which is what I would want but for now I have mine turned to .5 but before that I had them set to off. I'm not seeing really any difference between the two.
I didn't see much of a difference between the two either
But mines completely off to ensure the best performance, I think. It's working fine and feels quick
Sure if it works good for you then great m
Good point.
It's quite noticeable to see improvement in the phones performance. Can't go back to not disabling them
Up to you but be careful as it can disable certain features on the phone if animations are disabled. Of course if it works fine then great
Oh definitely. Haven't noticed anything yet
Ok then you should be good to go
Good to know. I haven't used nova in a while but I might go back
Nova is nice. And staying up to date with Google latest features
Unfortunately that is difficult with older Android software
Difficult to use nova on older android software?
I was referring to the part about staying up to date with the latest Google features
Ahhh I got it now. Thanks for clarifying
No that's partly my fault, I probably could have been clearer

thread.text: It's okay! No worries

replies.text: Thanks for taking it in good stride!

title: New Honor 8 setup

thread.text:
I know some on here have bought new H8's lately.
When you setup the phone initially is it already loaded with latest updates or do you have to do downloads. I have only setup 2 previous phones and they came up to date. I just had to wait while google uploaded my saved programs.
Any tips on doing a worry free setup?
I know I am going to be in a hurry as I have to visit a tmobile store and get a new nano sim as my Zenfone is a Micro sim. Don't want to try cutting it down.

It really depends on when it was produced in relation to when you bought it whether or not how many updates you'll have. You should have the EMUI 5.1 update along with nougat. It'll take a little while for those to download. Then you'll have lots of apps that will need updating out of the box then of course all the apps you typically download on your phones. WiFi helps speed this up but without it like I am right now some updates are only available with WiFi but the others will be much slower without it. If you have WiFi still though you'll have quite a lot to update before it's ready to go which will at least 30 minutes plus or so. Hope this helps.
Yes give it a little time. Our Honor 8 came with marshmallow and EMUI 4.0 and upgraded to Nougat and 5.0 when we set it up.
That's how it was with my Huawei M3 tablet. Marshmallow was installed but updated to Nougat.
It was probably just the original image. Just do the OTAs and it should take you to the latest software
Did it updated to Android 7.1?

replies.text: It's on 7.0. I don't see Huawei pushing 7.1,I think it will go straight to 8

What does VZW have against Huawei or are they unable to produce American cdma bands for some other reason?

replies.text: Huawei chose not to include Verizon lte band 13. This is a public standard. Verizon cannot stop someone from adding it to a phone
I wonder why? Eschewing huge American market.

Well Verizon is somewhat of a unique situation where in sure the phone would work with an active sim but Verizon won't activate a non verizon approved phone through its activation system online or calling or in stores. So they can't really advertise Verizon support without going through the Verizon approval process

Verizon is just too large and why they are set with CDMA I don't know. GSM seems to be the global standard. Most phones are set to run GSM over CDMA anyway. Is that Verizon being big headed or do they have a legitimate reason behind using CDMA?
I would guess that it is more to control devices on their network than a function of actual need for their phones at this point
No, but Verizon has an expensive approval process and they can (and do) keep phones off of their network. I don't blame OEM's that decide not to include it.
Have they kicked phones off their network before? I mean they can but under extraordinary circumstances like if it causes damage to their network.

thread.text: Sucks for Verizon customers, they should become a GSM network already. Wonder how much work and money thatll cost them

replies.text: Probably not much at this time as the general public in the usa still will buy carrier phones. This is true of gsm carriers in the usa
That's true, but a lot of phones offers GSM phones than CDMA. Verizon users are missing out on a lot of phones out there
That is true, because cdma costs more due to royalties. However Huawei was able to make a modem with cdma compatible technology but without using proprietary technology in the mate 9

How does the dbrand skin feels in the hand ? Thinking of getting some

If you're going to get a skin I'd suggest getting dbrand. I've tried all of them and dbrand uses 3m and I think 1080 ply which is the same material I've used in the past to wrap my interior dash components of my truck and the material is the best you can get. So it's very durable. Leaves zero residue and give you instant grip. I'd say the carbon fiber may give you a slight better grip but not by much. They wlso just came out with a new design called dragon something and the only thing is it's in a greyish black color but it has the best grip out of all of dbrand skins. It's textured. I've never used it bc it's not offered in Red or Blue which are the only two colors I've mainly used. I almost however decided to order the White carbon fiber for my new Pearl White honor but defaulted to red in the end. So there are three companies to choose from. Dbrand, Slick Wraps and Mighty Skins. Only dbrand and slick wraps makes skins for the honor 8. Out of those two I'd go for dbrand bc they use the 3m material. Best material on the planet. You'll like it and their cuts are are perfect where they don't hang over the edge nor are they too small to give full coverage. I think I paid with shipping for my skin from dbrand $14.95. Definitely go with them. They not only have the best reputation but they also make the superior product as you can never beat true 3m material. What color are you going to get? What color honor do you have. You can go on their site and choose the color of your phone then pick the skin so you can preview it before you order it which they are the only company that offers you that.
Oh I didn't know it was that durable. Thought it's just a typical sticker you applied to. I haven't really checked out their products yet. But I got the blue sapphire Honor 8
Yeah there are different textures that you can choose. It's definitely a lot more than just a normal sticker you stick on

Lots of colors would contrast nicely with sapphire blue I think. It depends though how you are with your expression of color. I personally like colors that pop and give a wow factor like brights reds, bright oranges and some blues. To me personally and I've had this combo before which was the red for the sapphire blue. You could also get like a white carbon fiber for the sapphire blue which would look killer to me but again when I look at colors I'm drawn to colors that are quite noticable and jump out at you. So your color will depend on your personality if that makes sense. I think when you use a skin and pick the color out that it's important to find the right contrast to compliment the sapphire blue in your case. So to me I'd look at orange, yellow, red, white or black hose same colors in a carbon fiber texture. All of those colors would make your sapphire blue stand out even more. I personally would go for the red but I also like reds and blues together as they to me contrast each other the best. 
In terms of durability the drbrsnd is a thick 3m material so it's not paper thin. You'd have a hard time tearing it apart unless there was a cut already started on it. In other words by simply using it daily you're not going to wear it out and it will and should remain new looking through out the entire time you have it on your phone. Like I said 3m is the regarded as the best material on the planet and best of all I've done this several times before as I enjoy change so I'll order two or three different colors and swap them out every once in a while as you can take them off and stick it back on the sheet it came to you on and install another color on it. I'll probably end up ordering either a orange or a blue as my other color. In your case the blue probably would not look that good on that particular sapphire blue your honor is. I also don't think black would look good either. You want something that will bring out the true color of the awesome sapphire blue the phone is. I'm a visionary so I keep having this vision of the yellow contrasting against the color of your sapphire blue honor actually very nicely. I know for a fact it will look awesome but the question is does your personality fit the loud color of yellow? Orange would look absolutely killer too with sapphire blue. My Pearl White has more options of course due to it being that cream Pearl color so I'll definitely be ordering another color or two for mine to change the look up every once in a while. I love skins. They give your phone an entirely new look and it appears as if you got a new phone at only the cost of the cheap skin but definitely go with dbrand as you simply cannot beat 3m material. The hardest part will be choosing your color to best contrast with that awesome sapphire blue. If I had your color it would either be red or yellow but I'm a very expressive person so I like extreme colors that give a wow factor though. Everyone is different but I will say it totally protects your phone from scratches on the back and allows you to use it without a case bc you'll have instantly a better grip on it. Go on Dbrands site and choose the color of your phone and then pick the skin color and it allows you to preview what your phone will look like with the color you picked out. That's what I did with my Pearl color. I chose the red to be placed on it and it looked awesome in terms of contrast on the Pearl color. The only thing I regret now is that I wish I would have gone with red carbon fiber instead of the regular smooth red.
Oh that's awesome that you can't even tell that a case is on.

No not at all with this case. You cannot tell you even have a case on it it's so minimal. It protects the back and four corners and honor themselves produced this case for their own product so it's a perfect fit. Also it's feather light and of course adds zero bulk. It does not protect your sides but it's doubtful that you'll drop your phone where your sides hit instead of your back and four corners so in a way your totally protected. It's not shock absorbent but it does give you full protection which is better than nothing then it also allows you to fully see your colored skin you install on your phone if you but the clear one like I have. I don't like using cases but with this one I don't mind at all bc you can't tell it's even on there. I love it. Plus it's only $2.99!! You just can't beat that at all.

The phone came out a little over a year ago and is still zippy as ever. your battery will probably start to show signs of wear and tear after 2 years of use but the phone should be more than serviceable for a long time to come.

title: I can't turn off "OK Google".

thread.text:
Update: Vanessa suggested I deny microphone access for Google in permssions settings, and that fixed the problem below. Deleting the OK Google voice model also fixes it.
Whenever I use video or microphone in an application (such as Soundhound and Snapchat), I get an error message:
"com.google.android.googlequicksearchbox:interactor will not be able to record right now"
It's annoying b/c it pops up over the application I'm using. This happened before and I had to turn off Google voice detection (i.e. OK Google). 
But now, it won't turn off! I unclick the option in Google Assistant and exit the settings, but it reverts to being on. I've tried restarting my phone and unclicking the option several times. In addition to the annoying popup, I don't need my phone always listening for "OK Google". 
Anyone else experiencing this?
You have to turn off the OK Google on any screen option.
I have...It'll turn off, but when I exit the setting screen, it turns back on. Urrrgggg.

replies.text: I was getting that same error message while trying to record voice messages on Facebook Messenger. I think I went into my Settings app and then to the Google section, and disabled "Ok, Google" from there. But yes, that was very annoying. Especially when you're trying to send funny noises to your brother that last longer than two seconds. :P

Same thing happened to me. I was using Viber and Google Duo. I couldn't turn off Ok Google- it would just turn back on. Here's what I did : go to phone settings and microphone permissions, deny it for google app. I may have turned off Google assistant too. See if it works and post results here. Good luck!
Thanks, Vanessa!!!!! Denying the microphone permission worked. It sucks that I can't use voice search now, but I use it rarely compared to other things that trigger that annoying notification.

thread.text: Mine is stuck on automatic and I don't know what that is and I'm still stuck on voice
Mine is stuck on automatic and I don't know what that is and I'm still stuck on voice it's making me really angry
Turn off Google assistant.

So I've turned assistant off but whenever I long press the home button it still launches into the app and asks me to set up. Is there anyway to disable this as well? I'd rather use the long press for something else.
I don't think you can set the long press on the home button to anything anyway.

replies.text: Hmm, that may be true. I'd be nice to not have assistant pop up when I accidentally press the home button for a bit too long.

thread.text:
You can disable assistant pop up when you press the home button:
Settings
Apps
Settings (down to the left)
Default app settings
Assistance & voice input
Assist app
Chose "None"

replies.text: Oh my yes that worked, thank you!

thread.text: You might need the latest version of "HiSuite" from Huawei.HiSuite - Android Smart Device Manager - Huawei Device., Co Ltd..
Or use WiFi File Transfer. Or MyPhoneExplorer.  But if you haven't, download Huawei Download Suite Including Drivers and install the drivers into the PC.
@Guytronic I installed it and there is no music option...
When it is connected to the PC, did you select mtp mode?

Your phone is probably on just charging mode. When you plug in your usb to your pc, pull down your phone's notification bar, you will see two buttons indicating photo and another for files with the message that, without selecting any your phone will be on charge only mode. Click on files, and internal storage will appear on your pc library (when you click on your phone). You will probably have to do this any time you connect your phone to your pc

thread.text:
So my Sony Xperia X Performance cane in today which I had gotten a really good deal on but here's the problem and which is why I don't like buying used phones. The phone was indeed like to new in box but when I turned it on the entire bottom part of the screen was discolored badly. I know the seller had to know this and dis not disclose it. It could not have just all the sudden appeared during a three day shipping period. See it was hard to tell when you were not on a white page and I'll post a pic to show you how bad it was. 
So fast forward to now. That phone is on its way back to him and although I have to wait until my money hits my account again I'm open to buying a "new" phone this time around instead of used and wanted to see what you guys would recommend I buy for roughly $275 and nothing more. Should I buy another Honor 8? Will $275 buy me an honor 8 still. I haven't checked their new prices lately. Any help on what to buy would be appreciated. I also thought about buying the model step below the X Performance i bought which is called the Xperia X. It runs a nice 650 processor and I just ordered a ton of accessories for the X Performance which is an identical build to the X model. Out of the two, which should I buy. I can get the Xperia X on sake right now for $229 which is a pretty good deal considering it brand new from B&H and it's a $450 dollar phone. Or on the other hand should I buy the Pearl color honor 8 the only color out if the top three color choice I haven't owned? Let me know your thoughts. Anyone have any experience using the 650 processor at all? If so how did you like it? I've used it once and recall it running very smooth and pretty fast. Out of the two a 650 processor and the Kirin 950 which is faster?

replies.text: There was an honor 8 deal posted earlier today from jet.com. $226 for the 32 GB and $245 for the 64. Can't help you with the sd650 though as I have no experience. From what I understand it's a tad faster than the sd625 but not quite as power efficient.

Just my luck. I think they sold out!! Plus my refund is tied up clearing the bank right now. It probably won't show for a couple of days now. Man he did me wrong. I'm sorry but that screen damage did not happen during shipping like he claims.

Yeah and even if it did happen during shipping (which I think it didn't) that means he did a pretty crummy job packing the phone as well. At least you're eventually getting your money back. Maybe the xpera x from b&h is a good buy after all since you have all the accessories already.

Man thank you for saying that to me. I think that's what I needed to hear. I'm just so torn between going with the Xpreria and Honor right now. I guess my money being tied up for a few days is kind of a good thing as it'll allow me to think it over some more. One other phone that has just came into the mix is the regular Axon 7, but used. I wanted to stay away from used but I'm very close indeed on having enough to get this phone in like new in box used which would be kind of cool being that I already own the Axon 7 Mini. In fact I'm using it right now and it's fast become my reliable go to phone. You just get do much for so very little with the Axon 7 Mini. The same for it's bigger brother the Axon 7. I found a few on eBay that.i have contacted people over and I'm very close to being able to land one of those which I very well may do. You get a 2k full HD quad display, 5.5 inch display, 820 processor, 4k video, premium all metal build which I believe they coupled with B&W to design the phone and a ton of other flagship specs for a retail of $400 used around $275 to $300. I'm very tempted on that one even though I told myself to stay away from used phones now after being burned with this guy. No wonder he was not responsive until I bought it then became super nice after that. He was just praying I wouldn't notice which thankfully I did and for him to even try to take me makes me so mad. I kind lost my temper with him today while on the phone with him but I just got angry over me knowing he knew it as there is hardly even a chance something in shipping would make that phones screen look the way it did. What he was hoping I'd that I would stay off an all white screen but I kept seeing this haze at the bottom so that's when I decided to pull a white screen up and sure enough there it was and it was bad too. I just think that is so sorry for someone to do to another. He actually hoped that I wouldn't notice and sold me a defective phone. Which by the way ended up costing me about 75 dollars in accessories. So in the end like you said and I appreciate you saying it, maybe I should just go for the Xpreria X which by the way is on sale right now which White and silver is $229 and Black Graphite is $239. That's for a $450 dollar phone or basically these days a $350 to $299 dollar phone. It's not a bad price and like you said matches all of my accessories and on top of that the least expensive route to take. I don't know. I've got a couple days to think on it so hopefully I'll make the right decision bc I really do want another honor 8 but like now I just missed that awesome sale on jett.com for a 64g for $250!! I would have jumped on that but then again this darn guy has my money tied up in the refund process which he basically screwed everything all up for me. If not for his lying backside I'd be okay right now and I would have come out the best. Like new in box phone that was Sony's flagship in 2016 that ran a 820 processor with a nice heavy and beefy feel to it compared to the much lighter X model.

Yeah I hear ya, it sucks what this guy did and that he's probably going to turn around try and sell it to someone else. I've never used swappa, can you give this guy a bad review or anything.
I'm the same way. I search the interest for the best possible phone deal then I spend way to much on accessories. I'm sure if you end up getting the xpera x it'll be a good phone to you.
Before I bought the honor 8 I also researched the axon 7. People seem to really like it except to for OS skin.

Oh I did leave him bad feedback. I definitely did that. I mean he made me want over $75 dollars for basically lying to me and knew that phones screen was defective. No way I'm buying it happened during shipping. That's not even remotely possible. That phone was clearly defective and now I loose on it. I guess I could send everything back to Amazon or just get the Xperia X model. I haven't decided yet. To be totally honest I really don't even need a new phone as my axon 7 mini is all that I need but you guys know how it is. We all like phones so it's hard not to buy another one.
Oh and that's a bummer about the Sony you had to return. Did the seller think you would not notice!?

That's what I was thinking. He claimed it happened during shipping. What are the odds of that? Like a million to one? I was very angry with him on the phone today. So much that he paid for shipping back, gave me a refund when I dropped it off at UPS and gave me the 10 dollar swappa fee too. All that right there tells me he very well knew that screen was bad. My very first ever used phone I buy and I get bitten hard. Now my money is tied up until it clears back in to my account. I'm out all those accessories I bought for that phone which if I get the X model I can use them though.

thread.text: Well getting the X would save you on accessories.
Honor 8 64gb is $246 right now. 32 is cheaperhttps://forums.androidcentral.com/sh....php?p=6027521

replies.text: Oh wow they're back! Thought they sold out.
They were but they came back in stock today

title: What web browser or you using for your Honor 8?

thread.text: What web browser is everyone using. just curious cause I'm always on the lookout for power efficient browser apps. I'm actually using the Samsung internet beta. Seems not to tax the battery as much as chrome and is pretty zippy. It's one of the few things I thought worked really well when I had my Galaxy s6.
I'm using the good ol' Chrome browser. How much battery do you think it zaps?

Not sure exactly. It seems to be a common issue that chrome is a bit of a battery hog. Whenever I use it is always pretty high on the battery consumption. When I use chrome all day it's usually above 30%. Other web browsers are usually around low 20's.

replies.text: That's good to know! Thank you for sharing! I'm sure there are more battery-friendly browser apps out there!

thread.text: I am using Chrome.
I use Chrome. Keeping lots of tabs open causes a bit more battery
Firefox.

replies.text: Oh, never tried Firefox. I always forget they have an Android app. I'll have to test it out.

thread.text: I use Chrome because I haven't found any other browser that uses the swipe down to switch to tabs pane gesture, and I really prioritize that over the battery drain that I know happens.

replies.text: You're right, that is a very significant feature that I too enjoy. Otherwise, I'd look into Firefox.

thread.text: Ghostery. I really enjoy it.

Well, I just installed the MS Edge beta and I have to say that I'm surprised at how well it's performing. It's opening pages considerably faster than Firefox and so far I've had no freezes or crashes. At this point, it's replacing Firefox as my main browser. That works well for me because I come from Windows phone (which I'm still using at least 60% of the time) so I'm used to Edge both on my phone and my PC, so it's nice to have everything in sync (and familiar feeling). But I wouldn't be using it if it was a struggle. So, if you're looking to try a different browser, give the Edge beta a try.

replies.text: I may try that, because I switched to Firefox and I'm not really enjoying it so far.
Who woulda thunk, a Microsoft browser that works well !  I'll have to give it a try.
It is still in beta, but so far I haven't run into any problems. YMMV

title: Honor 8 NFC problems

thread.text: Anyone else experiencing some stuttering with NFC on the Honor 8? For me, when I try to pay with Android Pay, the phone makes the connection, then disconnects, then reconnects dozens of times before maintaining a connection long enough to put the purchase through. I tried removing my case, but that only seemed to make the same problem happen faster. Maybe I've got a defective phone?

Im interested in what people have to say about this as well. Ive always had NFC issues with Android pay similar to what you mention. I've given up on paying for things with my Honor 8. I used to use Samsung pay when I had my s6 and that worked really well.

replies.text: Samsung Pay is really great, honestly it's the main selling point of the Galaxy like for me and probably why I'll be getting one for my next device.
Yeah, I miss it soo much! Not enough to switch back to a Galaxy though.

thread.text: The nfc chip is below the camera lenses

replies.text: Hmm, maybe I'm holding it up to the credit card machines in the wrong spot. Definitely give this a try. Thanks.
Yep, I noticed that too. Even when using that exact spot, I run into these issues.

title: How do I downgrade from EMUI 5.0 on Honor 8? I just received the update and can't stand it.

thread.text: Please help me downgrade my phone. I really wouldn't have purchased this phone a couple months ago if I knew it was going to look like this. I hate EMUI 5.0. I respect that others like it but please just help me get my phone back.

The instructions are on the support site.
Downgrade package and then apply the package for 4.
Pretty simple process.

If you have FDR-L04 which is the 32gb version, then you can from their site.
If you have FDR-L14, Honor doesn't have the firmware in their site. Please talk to the support.
What part did you not like about 5.0?

Thank you so much as I have found the link to 4.1 on their support site. I am a noob to this though. I am downloading the 1.6gb package right now to my chromebook, but how do I go about applying that to my phone?

I didn't like the look of the notification icons in the top right in addition look of the notification shade. Everything seems to have changed in a way that looks foreign and horrifying for me but I am very sensitive to changes.
I found the download but not the instructions. Any chance you can point me to what I do after downloading?

replies.text:
Unzip the file and instructions are in there if you downloaded the rollback. 
Sent from mTalk

thread.text: Sorry you didn't like EMUI 5! Let us know if you need anything else!

replies.text: I am having the same problem. Additionally my phone gets hang so often now after update to new EMUI 5 in my Honor 7. How to rollback to EMUI 4

thread.text: I need to go back aswell, simply because it has stopped my barclays banking apps from working, can you easily do this just using the phone

replies.text:
It's possible but I would proceed with caution if I was you. Trying to do that with the US 32gb model broke my phone but fortunately Huawei/Honor is fixing it.
So your mileage may vary, good luck either way.

thread.text: I'd say stick with it in order to get Nougat's enhancements e.g. split screen and better quick shortcuts. And then install Nova Launcher Prime for a vastly superior front end with gestures and granular control over your homescreen. If you use widgets then those giant EMUI icons just take up too much space - as on iOS. (Wonder were they designed for the visually challenged?)

I don't see all these huge changes from 4.1 to 5.0 to be honest. Could be that I may just adapt easier to it bc my main concern was I didn't want to loose the feel and interface of EMUI which I didn't so the upgrade to 5.0 has been painless. I will say 4.1 was awesome but I'd much rather have their lastest e everything to include security too. I understand though if some see a difference bc there is but it wasn't enough to me to make me want to downgrade back.

Question related to this post: I was robbed so bought the P9 Lite and it is great. Soon as I got it, I updated to EMUI 5.0. Then found out about app twin. That is not included but apparently it will be back in future updates, was told this by support today. I am not so trusting. Third party apps work but significantly slow down the phone. What would anyone suggest? Rollback?

replies.text: I would just rollback if you need it now... No idea how long an update will take to fix it...
There's third-party apps that do the same thing - try App Cloner from the Play Store

thread.text:
I wanted to downgrade from EMUI 5.0 to EMUI 4.1 but the 5.0 is far better than 4.1 in terms of ui and features, but i don't think the battery life is same as that was before, seems to drain a little quicker in 5.0, just now i have bought the mobile (past week), updated it before 2 days. But it requires some stability patches in future. 
Or
If there is any recommendations or suggestions for better battery life. Please help through.

I think part of the battery problem is that emui is based off nougat 7.0. seems Google fixed some battery Gremlins when they updated to 7.1. unfortunately Huawei has us stuck on 7.0 . You can do the battery settings and turn off all the background processes you don't need. You can also set nonessential app to close when in sleep mode. Other than that, hope and pray we get Oreo soon (or ever).

title: How long were you able to use your Honor phone(s) for?

thread.text: I was wondering how much utility people were able to get out of the Honor series phones (9, 8 Pro, 8, 7, 6X, 5C, 5X, 4X, Magic) they once owned. In other words, how long you were able or wanted to use the phone for, until it broke or you decided to move to something else for any reason. My Honor 8 served me well for around 6 months, but unfortunately it is not in working order anymore.
I have had mine for ten months and it is still working.
@dpham00: I assume it is Honor 8 you are talking about. Is that your primary phone? Have you owned any other Honor phone?
almost 10 months, no issue. still runs pretty much like it did when new

I've had my phone for close to ten months and it is still working very well. I can't part with it yet! Plus, I haven't found anything that is really convincing me to upgrade. I'll keep it and use it until it breaks.

I have had my honor 8 for a year and it works perfectly still.
I get the feeling you just come on here to slag off huewai because of one bad experience.

replies.text: Not really. I am truly interested in understanding market trends. With the conventional wisdom telling that Americans tend to upgrade their smartphones every 2 years, it would be interesting to see how Honor stack up against that assumption.
Asking on the forums is not going to give you an accurate portrayal of the general USA population though. People in the forums tend to upgrade much quicker than the average consumer, imo.

Agree, nothing to be implied about the population here. But still an interesting piece of information, in my view. Do you know or would you be able to suggest how to find out what Android Central's user base is and what fraction is contributing to the Honor forum?

thread.text:

title: Honor 8 Note Owners?

thread.text: I'm curious...Any Honor 8 Note Owners out there? I just got one and it rocks. We need our own thread.
Are you referring to the 6.6" honor note 8?

replies.text: Yep...Sorry got the name mixed up I guess
Ah ok . I know that the name is somewhat similar but the phone is really completely different

thread.text: Please tell us about it! It sounds like a great phone! What's your favourite feature about it?

replies.text:
Sure ☺
There is a lot to like here. The build quality is amazing! It kinda reminds me a bit of a Nexus 6P is some regards, the metal body finish and all.. I mean really...it's like a piece of art. It feels really good in the hand, is super thin especially for a phone this size, and is a joy to use all around. Oh...and HSPA has been just fine...No LTE. 
My favorite feature has been both its size and the screen. It is VERY vibrant, making it perfect for viewing content (news, articles, social media) and is even pretty good at productivity because of the screen size. Just today I was able to really edit a PPT I've been working on for a presentation without a hitch on the run. The size also makes it excellent for viewing and writing emails, something I do frequently.
Drawbacks so far has been the camera and pocket-ability the size can at times can be noticeable when carrying in jeans, so there is the trade off. This will be a deciding factor on whether I'll keep this phone long term. Another drawback has been the notifications. I have EMUI on my regular Honor 8 and no matter what I do I can't get my notifications here like I have them on that device (it runs perfectly). I get some but still not all. But I'll work it out soon I'm sure. 
This really is a true Note/phablat. GREAT phone!

Thank you so much for your review! How big is the screen, and what colour do you have? Hope you get your notification issue worked out! I agree with you: Honor makes excellent devices with good displays and vibrant colours. It's a great line, for sure!

thread.text:
That's pretty good to hear! 
One more question... Is it on nougat?
Yes android 7.0.

replies.text: Glad to hear it. I was afraid it was going to be another honor5x

thread.text:
I am also an owner. i love the phone itself BUT:
i am not getting any push notifications. i tried everything that is mentioned on different forums, in videos or blogs.
i have to manually keep my apps open, if i want to get push notifications. i dont want to give away my phone, because i really like it. but thats a dealbreaker for me :/
does anybody know how to fix that problem?
EDIT: EMUI 5.0.1, Android 7

replies.text: That sounds like a frustrating issue, for sure! Have you tried restarting your device? Are you using a launcher or anything like that that may be encroaching on your notification settings? If all else fails, I recommend a factory reset; so long as all your important information is backed up.

thread.text:
Thank you for your answer!
First I tried the stock version of EMUI 5.0.1 and it was pretty okay. usually i dont like bloatware but this custom android was okay.
When it first happened, that i could not get push notifications, i tried other launchers like the Nova Launcher. I wanted to try the Google Now Launcher but EMUI would not let me start it. Maybe it's too old.
I already did a factory reset but it stayed the same. i dont have important data on it yet, so i will maybe try it again.
There is actually a way for me to get push notifications: when i open the app-manager, that shows all the running apps, i can click on a lock. when i "lock" whatsapp and gmail and slack and messenger and trello and, and, and, i will get push notifications. but this is a weird workaround. i just want it to be like on my old android phones :P

replies.text:
Have you looked through your basic Settings app to see if anything is turned off that shouldn't be? App Manager is a good place to start as well. I just don't understand why you're not getting them, especially after a full factory reset! Hmm... 
I don't know much about this step, but there's something more experienced helpers on this site know about; something about clearing app caches or something like that... So I would recommend doing that. Sorry, I'm not too sure how it's done, but I think you can do it through App Manager.
Oh, perhaps if you uninstall one app and then reinstall it, that may solve things. I had to do that with my Textra app about a month ago when I was experiencing issues with it.
Keep us posted! Hopefully another user more well versed than I can assist you as well!

thread.text: When i use the button that is marked red, it works, until i manually close the app. But then i have to keep all the apps open, that i want to get push notif. from.
sorry, double post

Yeah, i will keep going. i want to solve this problem and not give away my phone :P
thx for your support!

Ohhh I see what you mean. You've pinned the app or locked it or some such! Well, at least you have a workaround for convenience; but hopefully this issue gets fixed for you! As a last resort, you could always contact Honor/Huawei Support and see if they have any suggestions for you.

Hi all, why shouldn't we have a separate topic for Honor Note 8? I personally have one and like it a lot. It's now my main phone replacing my iPhone 6s and LG Pro 2, since it accepts 2 SIM. I hate to bring 2 phones all the time and I like its big screen and very long battery.
Having said that, one thing I don't like about it is I cannot sync contact directly with my Google account. I have done some research's and find a way to get around but it does not always working. I wish there was an int'l firmware so I could use Google account directly. That would make the phone perfect IMHO.

That is if the latest os is as important as you said previously. Honor 8 getting oreo is likely but will take a long time, and even then not guaranteed.

Yeah my thought is that the honor 8 won't see oreo most likely. I could be wrong but the 8 has already out lived most other Android devices and is still going strong. I think if it gets Oreo then we won't see the honor 9 here in the US at all. With the potential of the 9 I think Oreo won't hit the 8. Like I said I could off the mark but it's just a gut feeling with what I know about Huawei Honor from being such a fan of them. I read a lot of articles on them. I love that they have went on record stating that they will indeed the number one mobile phone company in the world in a few years. I truly believe it too. I mean just take the honor 8 alone. It's their version of a budget device and simply put there is nothing about the honor 8 that is budget really. It does everything at a flagship level but yet you can get for under 300 bucks. That's why they will be number one as they have said. Plus they innovate. That's important too. As long as they don't come to the USA and all the sudden raise their honor prices to become greedy then they will definitely become number one easily. I have no clue why EMUI receives such a bad wrap from some people. What's not to like about it. We all know apple IOS is by far the smoothest interface on the planet. So what if EMUI is a little bit like IOS. To me EMUI is nothing like Android and it's not IOS either. It's in its own league and could easily be branded as a third major software choice within the mobile industry. It's unique and different but it's butter smooth like IOS. How could anyone not like that. Stock Android is just plain choppy and sticky. I'm sorry but it is and EMUI is not. So I guess you can call it a hybrid but Huawei did an awesome job with it's interface. You simply won't find anything remotely like it. So I'm not sure why some people dislike it so much. I think it's a bandwagon thing and they really do like it but have to say they don't bc they are an Android purist. Anyways I've sat here and basically talked myself back into wanting another honor 8 like really badly now lol. I get carried away when it comes to the honor 8. It's such a strong and well developed device for the money. I do know that there is not a better device on the market that even comes close to the honor 8 in terms of price point. It's so close to a flagship that one could not really even tell the difference and if they didn't know better would easily pay 500 for it. To be able to pick one up at 275 is amazing to me. I miss mine but I'm afraid I'm stuck with the Axon 7 Mini due to being such a long wait if I returned it then bought the honor and wait even longer for it to come in. What I think I'll do is keep my Axon since it's going to run 7.1.1 and then next month pick up an honor 8 to use some in rotation as I do like the Axon. It's a really premium build for 194 dollars. It's no different than the regular axon 7 in terms of build quality plus you add the Atmos Dolby surround sound speakers it has which are amazing alone by itself and to get it for under 200 is a steal. I wished it had a 625 processor compared to the 617 but it's not that big of a difference. It's still pretty zippy and the screen resolution I'd say has a slight edge over the honor 8 as its AMOLED. Color saturations are very good on the axon mini. They both have 5.2 inch screens. So all in all I'm not unhappy with it but I do prefer the honor and EMUI in the end.

So glad you are still liking the Axon Mini! It's a nice phone and I remember being swayed to buy the Axon 7 last December too!
With regards to EMUI, I agree with you. I really love the experience. There isn't anything that I actually dislike enough to switch to a launcher, for example. I even thought the first initial upgrade (to 4.1?) was good too! I remember thinking, "I wish my lockscreen looked like X;" and then with the update, it suddenly was! Haha.
I think people sometimes get afraid or anxious about differences - or changes to things. So if something is suddenly different from what they're used to, it makes them nervous.
Yes, the Honor 8 is definitely one of the greatest bangs for your buck out there. It certainly does have flagship-level specs and potential. People pick up my phone and have no clue what it is - which I also like. At work, most of my co-workers have iPhones, and they marvelled that 1) it had a fingerprint scanner and 2) that it was at the back of the phone.
I hope Honor does well and that their brand goes far. It's a great brand and I'm really happy I gave it a shot. Plus even though I want to upgrade in the next half year or so I refuse, because I can't give it up lool.
It makes sense to pay a little more for the honor 8 and be happy, so long as you can afford it.
I couldn't agree more!

title: Low Volume Handsfree Bluetooth in 2015 Kia Optima

thread.text: Just got my Huawei Honor 8, paired fine with my 2015 Kia Optima, but the volume is very low when sending/receiving call, almost like it is muted. Did not have this problem with my previous phone, Samsung Galaxy S3. Is there a setting on the phone I am missing? Also cannot get any volume through my speakers when using Waze, not sure if that's a related problem....HELP!!!!
Welcome to Android Central! Is the volume turned all the way up on the phone while it's connected via Bluetooth?

Yes, tried it with volume all the way up on the phone and the car. Also, when it's dialing the ringing goes (loudly) through the speakers, as soon as it connects it goes muted. I have also tried re-pairing, same problem.
Go to Settings>Bluetooth and tap the gear icon next to the car system -- is everything checked on there?

Don't know if you have found the Volume slider for Bluetooth calls, if not, do like this:
Make a call from the car, phone connected via Bluetooth of course.
When answered, ask your friend to hold on, don't hang up.
Press Volume button on the phone and you will se the volume slider for Bluetooth calls.
Use it!

replies.text: Thanks, will try that.

Tried increasing Bluetooth volume during a call from the Honor 8 (ALL the way up), still not getting anything from the speakers. My WAZE app doesn't play through the speakers either, it is set specifically in the APP to play through the car speakers. As I mentioned before, when I make the call the RING goes through the speakers, as soon as it connects it stops...frustrating...

thread.text: Yes, everything checked.

title: The device has suffered liquid damage which voids the warranty - Really?

thread.text: Please share your experience if Huawei/Honor has rejected to repair your phone by claiming "liquid damage". It happened to me and the only written response I received is this:
Yep. They run those amazing ads with phones being used in water, but won't honour warranty claims of you get the device wet...

replies.text: Nobody does. The phones aren't rated water proof. They're rated water resistant. Resistant means they can still get water damage under certain circumstances. Also, enough drops and the phone may have enough stresses placed on the gel sealants to come loose.
Is the honor 8 even rated as water resistant? I didn't think that it had an IP rating?

It's because they are water resistant not water proof. There is no way to prove how much water a phone was exposed to, should manufactures replace phones left in the water for hours or taken with someone while diving?

thread.text:
@Tim1954: Thing is that it was never exposed to liquid (no drops into water, no spills, no soaking in the rain, etc). I do admit that I started noticing strange things happening after I took the phone with me running in quite hot and humid weather. (That was the only instance.) Although, I would expect the device to be engineered as sweat and humidity resistant, there is a possibility that it is not true at all in case of the Honor 8. Alternatively, "liquid damage" could just be an excuse for not doing the work to fix the phone.
BTW, if you have any info regarding the number of people, who have been told their phone cannot be repaired under warranty because of the "liquid damage", would you care to share it with us?

@chanchan, I'm well aware of the difference between water proof and water resistance, the point I was making being those misleading ads that trick the unsavvy into taking their device swimming etc... @vtua, I can't give you numbers re warranty refusals but there are many posts around the forums regarding that. The manufacturers themselves actually say they won't cover liquid immersion damage in the paperwork that comes with the phones.
And yes, high humidity plus running with phone in pocket could cause condensation inside the relatively cool metal contacts which could then be detected by the sensors and be evident upon inspection...

replies.text: Any other phone I owned would take the running perfectly fine, so it is hard to believe that one timer would be anough for Honor 8. Further, it is really strange that the customer service is unable to substantiate their "liquid damage" claim.

Well not to create conspiracy theories, but I remember CPW in the UK losing a complaint about false water ingression findings to avoid honoring warranty. It was noted that the phone really had no water damage. It was some time back. So there is that possibility.

I have mentioned this before but if they are fraudulently denying your claim due to water damage when there wasn't any then you really should file a complaint with the state AG. Granted one complaint won't make much of a difference, but if they get a lot of complaints then they might do an oil investigation.

thread.text: Yes, I've taken all my phones running, been caught in rain storms and never had any issues... One wonders..
I see a future with phones completely sealed, wireless of course just around the corner...

As much as all the comments are appreciated, I really need to put the discussion back on track. This thread is meant to give an opportunity for Huawei/Honor phone owners, who were denied warranty repair because of the alleged liquid damage, to share their stories. Thank you.

I recently sent my Honor 8 in for repair under warranty because some features were not working (auto rotate, compass app, proximity sensor). When the phone was received by the repair center, I received an email stating so and it also said that if the phone could not be fixed under warranty, I would receive another email with further instructions. I never received another email except for one containing a tracking number as the phone was being shipped back to me; after repair I assumed. When I received the phone back, inside the box was the same letter as vtua shows. It said it had liquid damage. I 100% dispute that. Plus, when the phone was returned to me it had the glass backing coming off, the fingerprint ID under the settings menu was gone and the camera is completely blurry. None of these issues existed when I sent it in for repair. I have contacted Huawei numerous times and they simply won't do anything. I have contacted the BBB and filed a complaint. Others that have experienced the same thing need to file complaints because that's the only way to get their attention.
Isn't the water damage indicator in the headphone jack port?

@Kelvin N: I am not quite sure, but it seems there may not be any humidity indicator in the Honor 8. The customer service did not point any on a picture they have provided; red circles supposedly identify the liquid damage:

title: Alarm not working since update.

thread.text:
Hey guys . . .
my phone did a small update last night. I'm sure a lot of you got the same update within the past few days or so. This morning, the alarm doesn't seem to be going off. I use the Google clock. Does anyone else know how to fix this, or what happened? Thanks.
You could try a cache clear for the clock app and do a restart.
That's a good idea, thanks. I'll experiment with the alarm this evening--I doubt people in the cubes next to me would be very happy if I tried it now.

replies.text: Lool I'm sure they'd be surprised! Please keep us updated on what happens!

thread.text:
That worked! Should have thought of that, but the other updates have been so seamless that it hadn't even occurred to me. 
Having other issues too. I was not getting notification badges for incoming texts--reinstalled the teslaunread badge app for Nova launcher and it seems to be working again. Also just noticed that that the WUnderground app isn't automatically launching on restart, so who knows what else. I wonder if there was a power setting that was changed in the update or something like that. If you couldn't tell--I'm not that up to date on such things.

replies.text: Glad that you are sitting out these issues! Sometimes updates like these mess with our phone stuff!
Try a cache clear for Nova.

title: Issues with camera focus

thread.text:
Hi. I'm rocking a hardly two months old Honor 8 and I'm having an issue where sometimes the camera focuses properly and sometimes doesn't. This just started happening about a week ago. 
Before you ask, no, I'm not using wide aperture mode and I don't see any scratches or anything like that on either of the lenses. I have a few scratches on the phone screen, though.
Swipe into the camera options and check how your focus is being weighted.
Any updates on your current situation, OP? And welcome to the forums!

Hi, OP here. No progress and I didn't really understand organgecroc's suggestion so I couldn't follow up on that.
The camera does tend to work properly more often, but it's still only maybe one out of five times that it does. 
Thing is it works great for macro shots when the subject is maybe 0-5cm away. I tried to go to pro photo and use manual focus but no luck there either. It's like the camera is stuck focusing on objects up close.
There should be an option for object tracking. Toggle that.

Hi,
I am having the exact same problem with my honor 8. It focuses perfectly when the object is near the phone. But does not focus when the object is further away. 
It started this behavior a few weeks ago. Until then it was fine

Same problem here.
The mechanical focus system seems to be very capricious. Sometimes it just refuses to activate either when you want it to focus automatically or when you do it manually.
It seems to work even less when you try it in a low light environment.
Sometimes a gentle hit near the captors fixes the problem though, sometimes.
Any one with a good solution?
It's impressive to see that when it works you can hear the focusing system, but when it doesn't not even a sound. The thing isn't even trying.
Maybe it is the laser that is used to do the focus that doesn't align properly anymore, what do you think?

Even expensive DSLRs struggle to focus in low light situations, decrying a small sensored mobile phone camera is a bit odd. How close is the subject you're trying to focus on, the minimum focus distance on the camera is about 30cm

replies.text:
True.
Did anyone tried to change the cameras and fixed the problem? I'll got no trouble doing it myself but I'm bit worried the problem will still be here even with new lenses.

thread.text: It's a phase detect auto focus, it's never going to be perfect.
Have you touch the screen to make it focus?

Yup, course. Even with the stock application (and others non-stock obviously) you even have access to a slider to manually change the focus.
When it's "unblocked" it perfectly works of course, and you can hear the mechanical focus going up and down, but when it doesn't work, well... it doesn't work manually or automatically, it's just "blocked".
You really shouldn't be able to hear the focussing motor anyway, which makes me think your device has a hardware problem.
Have you dropped it on the corner with the camera module at all? That might account for the strange noises as well as the lack of fast or accurate focus.

To be honest it started before I dropped it a lot of time (never from high though. 30-40cm max each time). And the drops never made it worse or better.
I'll try to change the lenses I guess. But god I hate warming that fr**kin' glue they put everywhere now...

title: Phone Waking Up Randomly?

thread.text:
Hey guys!
I love my Honor 8. It is doing so well for being 7 months old. However, the phone sometimes wakes to the lockscreen, even when I have no notifications. It didn't bother me much at all until today, when it happened multiple tines. Has anyone else encountered this glitch? Any particular meaning behind it?

I've had phones do that, but realize the thing is always checking stuff. Have an alarm set, whats the weather, hows the mobile data connection, list is very long on what modern cells do when they're sitting doing 'nothing'.

replies.text: Thank you! It was just a little concerting that it happened so many times yesterday. Otherwise it's running okay.

thread.text: Are you having any problems with battery life? If not then I wouldn't worry about it

replies.text: Nope, battery life is still pretty good. Thank you!

thread.text: Yep, roll it in a sock, put it in your purse and call it good

replies.text: LOOOOL sounds like a plan!

thread.text: I've had that happened to my other phones. Dunno the reason to it

replies.text: Have you tried to do any troubleshooting on the other phones? Even if you don't know what's causing it, perhaps it can eliminate some possibilities.
It's very strange, for sure! My phone isn't waking as often now, but it's still every once in a while.

Actually I ugh remember why. I have the 360 Security app that let me hide some notifications away. And when the notifications show up, my phone will wake up but then the app will hide it so it shows there's nothing on my phone when I open it
Oh wow! Glad you got that solved!
Do you have any app similar to that
Nope! But I do have notifications disabled for specific apps so maybe that's why my phone randomly wakes sometimes... Thanks for the tip!
Try to re enable thise app notifications to see if you still have the same issue
Good tip! Thanks for pointing that out!
That's weird that the app won't fully disable the notification, just hide it. Hopefully it can be improved in the future. Still, thanks for sharing... This could help someone who has this problem

thread.text: If you're okay with a sort of hack-y fix, perhaps using a flip cover case (that has magnets) would stop it from turning on and/or registering accidental touches.

replies.text: This is a good idea! Thank you! It's weird - now it doesn't wake nearly as often as it used to haha. Sometimes I'll notice it wake, but it's still not very often... Unless it does it while I'm asleep or something. 🤣

title: questions for current owners.

thread.text:
Hey guys, 
I'm going to be buying a new phone within the next month so I can finally throw my note 5 in the trash. Anyways, I'm wanting to stay under that $350 window and the honor 8 has been interesting to be since release. I have a couple questions though. 
How is the camera, would you say it's on the same level as the Note 5? 
Is emui really as annoying as all the reviews on AC make it out to be? 
And finally is it even worth buying right now, or should I continue to look around?

replies.text: If you haven't already get it. Trust me? The camera is awesome. It's light, smooth and ripping fast. And emui 4 is has the issue with notifications. Emui 5 on the Honor 8 works just fine. Get it!

thread.text:
Probably not far from the note 5 for the camera. 
Most complaints on emui are on the 4 version. There is an update to emui 5 which is closer to other android devices.
For $260-280 based on recen sales, its a pretty good phone.

Camera is one of it's strongest features. You will absolutely love it. I don't think the Honor 8 is anywhere near dated. It'll be a while before the honor 9 is released here so it's still a very good buy. The only real difference you'll see is the screen size compared to the note 5. The honor 8 is 5.2 inches. Like I said the camera is one of the best features on the phone so you will be happy. If you get one let us know how you like it. Oh as for EMUI, it's fantastic!!!!! Best software interface on the market to me. I love it. It's nothing like Android and is a hybrid type mix between IOS and Android. Very easy to navigate and very smooth and fluid. You'll enjoy it.

replies.text: What is your screen on time on average?

I'd agree with most of this. I've just switched from the Galaxy s8 to the Huawei P10 and its my first experience with EMUI. I was a little worried after reading a lot of complaints in here especially to do with notifications but it's been awesome and notifications are all spot on once you set them all up properly. The P10 is also 5.2" and considering I usually go for bigger phones I've found it to be the perfect size. The camera's and camera so are fantastic and have so many features that you'll never get bored with it. I'm definitely going to be sticking with Huawei for a while and I'll be trying a few more of their phones too
Are you referring to emui 4 which the honor 8 was launched with it emui 5, which came with the nougat update?

thread.text:
To answer your questions, as someone who has used the phone for almost ten months:
The camera is great. I've never used the Note devices, but the dual cameras on the Honor 8 make for excellent shots. I'm usually very happy with my photos. There's a pretty cool editing feature for photos as well.
I actually really loved EMUI 4.0 and then 5.0. While it's true that some users found EMUI annoying, I personally loved the different experience and how an EMUI Theme Editor app can change my phone to meet my exact needs. It's super fun to tweak your theme to your own liking. It's definitely a feature I use frequently.
Lastly, I absolutely think the Honor 8 is worth it for purchase now. I am wondering about my next upgrade (which always happens when it's been around one year since I purchased the phone in question); but I honestly can't give up my Honor 8 yet. With the release of the 8 Pro, you'll be able to find good deals (check out Newegg). It's a very reliable phone, and I've had minimal glitches in almost ten months.
Let us know what you decide!

The camera beats the Note 5 one. No doubt about it. The EMUI really isn't bad. I like it but its different for other people. You can always use a different launcher. I did put Nova in there. The phone got updated to Nougat. Not sure about Oreo though. Honor 8 is a great phone and you won't be disappointed.

replies.text: True - different launchers will take care of the EMUI situation. These forums have been a bit of a mixed bag with regards to who likes EMUI and who doesn't.

thread.text: Compared to when I used a Note 5 (briefly), I'd say the camera on the Honor 8 is actually quite a lot better, with more features too. EMUI isn't all that annoying - especially after the Nougat update, I've grown to enjoy a lot of the proprietary feature that come with it. And, it's worth it if you can get that $290 or $260 deal on Amazon. Otherwise, I'd recommend waiting for the next Honor phone to come to the US (if that ends up happening).
The Samsung cameras are pretty limited in function compared to Honor. The note 5 is also two years old which is near eol.

replies.text: Probably cause it's getting old. Missing features that newer phones has.

Other then the fact I've had to turn just about all features that aren't absoutly necessary to just get more then 3.5 sot and the random force reboots it's a fine phone. I'm sure it Iis a degraded battery, it was better new. But now I'm just getting tired of it and wanting something new. I'm also not wanting to go back on a lease plan from the carrier. And with the good options in unlocked now.i wanted to go that route.

title: Honor 8 - A Solid Buy?

thread.text:
Hi Everybody,
I recently bricked my iPhone 6s, and I've been looking at a few mid-range Android phones as a replacement, but the Honor 8 is the one I find the most intriguing (Moto G5 Plus is the other big frontrunner). My biggest concern is reliability and overall quality. I've read some great user reviews about the Honor 8, but I've also seen issues around forums about connectivity issues, outgoing call issues, etc. I just want to make sure that the Honor 8 is, both, a cool, solid device, and reliable (won't bug out after 5 weeks, etc). Granted, it seems like a lot of the negative issues I've read about are before EMUI 5.0 came out, but I'm still weary. Can anyone share their experiences about owning an an Honor 8 - good, bad, and ugly?

replies.text: You can't go wrong with the Honor 8 at all. EMUI whether it's 4.1 or 5.0 is at the top of any user interface experience on the market. In fact if you had a iphone 6s or iPhone in general, you find that EMUI is very much butter smooth and fluid like IOS as it's a hybrid software that is nothing like stock pure Android. The only reason I would say possibly wait on the honor 8 is bc the honor 9 is now released but not yet in the US. That said the honor 8 is still your best choice by far out the phones you mentioned. If you liked IOS you will very much like EMUI and also there are no bugs with either 4.1 or 5.0. Sure you'll read the bad experiences bc no one posts about how awesome EMUI is but I'm posting that it can easily be branded as it's own type of mobile tech software. It's just that different. Nothing about it indicates that it's Android. It's great and very fluid. If you are unable to wait on the honor 9 then you will be hard pressed to find a better device for the money. Good luck and update everyone with what you decided. You won't regret the honor 8 at all. The camera is amazing and fast. The 950 chip is really zippy and quick. Screen resolution is 1080p which is good. It is 5.2 so if you're coming from a 4.7 6s then you may find it to be pretty big. The honor 9 is actually a tad smaller at 5.1 which doesn't sound like a lot but in the real world is very noticeable to the feel. You can easily watch movies on it and browse the web. Read articles. You may enjoy the screen real estate more than you expect to. I know I did coming from exclusive apple up until a little over a year ago now. I recently went back to the iPhone SE as I used to love it but when I got it back after a year with Android sure I loved IOS but I could not stand how small the screen was and I quickly got rid of it. Now I use the Samsung S8 regular size which has a lot of screen but yet still a one hander. The honor 8 is pretty much a one hander most of the time. You'll definitely like it. Just try and find one on a good sale since the Honor 9 is now rolling out. Once it hits the US is believe the market value of the honor 8 will decrease a lot yet it's still one of the best devices money can buy. Like I said you can't go wrong and you'll be happy about your purchase. I've owned the honor 8 twice now. It's a killer device.

thread.text: I should probably add that I'm not a fan of big phones (5.5 and above), and that I mostly use my phone for the basics (call and text), Watching YouTube, reading emails, and listening to music/podcasts. Reliable performance and battery life are my biggest concerns at the moment.

I actually had both honor 8 and moto g5 plus so i can give you some of my experience. Moto g5 plus has snapdragon 625 so battery is much more efficient than honor 8. Everything else goes to honor 8. Better camera, faster processor, better build quality. Honor 8 is really underrated smartphone IMO. I sold mine and i bought one again lol.

replies.text: I miss that honor 8 too!! Lol. You got a good deal on it for sure. I give really good deals lol
Oh you sold him your old honor 8? I didn't know that. Nice to pass it on to another forum member!

We originally traded each other and when I went to the iPhone SE I sold it back to him. By the way he is a great guy and a friend now. We text all the time about tech. I'm about to send him a ton of honor 8 cases that I no longer need. It's nice to meet great people on here. I've enjoyed chatting with him ever since we did our first deal together.

That's great to hear that the forums have helped to facilitate an HONORable friendship! 
Also, nice that you are see sending him the extra Honor 8 cases. Should have gotten my honor 8 from you! I am so jealous!
Your pun game is stellar.

thread.text:
I wanted to upgrade my phone around December 2017 due to issues with my LG G3, and landed on the Honor 8. The experience has been wonderful! The size of 5.2" is perfect for my small hands, and the screen quality is great! I can still watch my Netflix at night before bed. The screen brightness is good, and as long as you snag a tempered glass screen protector and a case to protect the glass on the front and back of the phone, you're set!
With regards to quality, I've never before had a midrange phone before and this one performance flawlessly. Sure, it has the odd glitch or two, but in seven months I've never had to deal with battery issues, I've had minimal call dropping (and compared to my G3 in the same locations, my Honor 8 stays on call longer and had less drops; and this would be due to réception/roaming issues). I've really enjoyed my experience and I actually like EMUI 5.0!
For the price, you are getting a great deal. The dual cameras are wonderful! Photo quality is good, sound is pretty good too. I'd say a lot of these specs are on par with flagships and you aren't breaking the bank. One of my favourite features about this phone was that I had it paid off faster and I wasn't locked into a two year contract where I'd be paying out more money.
It is truly a great experience, and I'm a phone geek who craves new phones often! I want to upgrade next year, but I'm feeling like I'll have a lot of trouble doing so. I love my phone!
Good luck with your choice, and let us know what you decide!
Most of the connectivity issues will be down to location, where are you based?

Honor 8 is a really great bang for the buck. Really near flagship in every way except price.
No call issues here, but those could also be due to a weak signal or a problem with your carrier in the area.

replies.text: Couldn't agree with you more. Flagship in every other regard except for pricing - and that's okay with me.
Also , even though they are number three internationally,in the states, it doesn't have a widely recognizable flagship name brand. Hopefully that will change soon though!

Hopefully it does! It's sad that so many of these awesome devices are not as well known or very underrated... Blah! Samsung and Apple are great but there are also a myriad of other cool and even better, in some respects and depending on your perception, devices out there.

That's unfortunately true of everything. People tend to buy from brands that they are used to or at least that they recognize.
But to an extent,it makes sense. A lot of the Unknown brands tend to be really poor quality. Of course there are exceptions and Huawei is a glowing example.

It's true, and a lot of people follow what their friends/others are doing and so those brands get even more recognition. 
That's true! Sometimes the unknown ones can be a bit of a gamble.
Which is why I think that Huawei needs to invest real marketing dollars to get people familiar with their name in the USA. Word of mouth is doing to take a long time.

thread.text: Thanks for all the intel everybody. @Dconn1975: At this point, I'm really caught between the Honor 8 and the iPhone SE. What's the battery life, and the audio quality (through headphones) like in comparison to the SE?

replies.text:
My boyfriend has the SE and I have the Honor 8, and though my battery life is really good, I'd say his is a bit better than mine. It definitely depends on every individual model and battery, as they are probably all a bit different in some respects, but for our two specific devices, I'd say his outperforms mine in low battery, for example. But they're still quite comparable. I wouldn't say his is way better than mine, but I have noticed he gets more mileage on 10% or less than I would on mine.
Audio quality on my phone is pretty good. I've heard some users say it can be tinny but I use headphones frequently and really enjoy the experience. I do a lot of Netflix viewing on my phone and I've thought headphone/non-headphone use on the Honor 8 has been great. My boyfriend does a lot of gaming on his phone and we've listened to stuff on it with and without headphones. I'd say it's equal to the Honor 8. I feel like Apple is known for its media performance though, so perhaps it may outshine the Honor 8 with regards to that. It's hard to say, as I have more experience with my Android device. I'd say both are great choices if you're looking at those specific variables.

thread.text: That's tough choice. They're both very good value for the money.

I have used both and really both are great. Battery life is pretty good on both. Neither gave significantly better battery life than the other, in my usage. 
Headphone jack was pretty good on both, but at the same time I am not an audiophile.

@the_hadlander: You may already bought your new phone, but if you did not, you may want to consider the following. The replies so far seem to paint a picture of how great the Honor 8 is, but my experience was drastically different. My phone was not turning on after only 6 months of mild use. It looked like something serious, and I decided to send it for warranty repair. The service center returned it back unpaired, claiming a liquid damage, and damaged. Later, I found out that the phone was not turning on because the power button is dead. In addition, there is a major issue with the fingerprint sensor.
Long story short, I think there are some major engineering flaws that caused the device to malfunction in such a short period of time. Customer service is unacceptable. I am sure there are more reliable phones out there on the market. Hope this helps.
What did you end up deciding, OP?

title: Random lock screen wallpapers & live wallpapers

thread.text:
Somehow I've disabled the option to have random images on the lock screen only and can't for the life of me find where to turn it back on?
I've found the bit where to randomly change the home screen wallpaper but not the lock screen?
Also, live wallpapers? I see I can download a load of them for the lock screen. Can I ask, what;s the difference between a normal and live wallpaper?
Whilst I'm at it, as I'm on a roll here  On the lock screen when you swipe up there are options for the stock music player but I use Google Music so can these options be removed at all?
Thanks in advance will all my questions!
PS - I'm so loving this phone, it's crazy good

I believe to return to the random lockscreen wallpapers it's:Settings>Display>Wallpaper>Lock screen wallpaper>Use other wallpapers>More>Gallery>MagazineUnlock
Also there is a "Random change" option on the Wallpapers screen (under settings)
Live wallpapers look a little like a movie that loops or they have some moving features like a star field or moving planets etc...
The swipe up options are tied to the honors built in EMUI apps far as I know.
I'm sure someone else here probably has better answers for you.
Glad you're enjoying the phone!

title: Who's going to give their Honor 8 up for a Honor 9?

That said the iPhone SE is a very small device so I'm definitely in the market for another Android Phone that has a larger screen size. I'm a long time apple user anyway which is one major reason I like EMUI so much. It's simply nothing like stock pure Android which compared to IOS is quite choppy and sticky overall. I typically keep two devices one small and one larger. To me the ideal screen size is 5 inches. To comment on people buying new devices to me big time varies on the person. I find it to be a hobby and I enjoy learning a new interface so for me I have gone through a lot of Android devices for only having been using Android now for a little over a year. It's fun to me but it can become very expensive too so I've cut back a lot and I actually used my Honor 8 exclusively for quite a while for me anyway.
