title: My phone cannot make a Call

thread.text: My honor 8 phone is not able make a call and people cannot call me either. It just beeps once and then the call just ends. I tried to turn it off and take the sim card out but the problem remains. Can someone please help.

Hi and welcome to Android Central. 
Have you tried your SIM card in another phone? If so, does it work?
Have you tried contacting your carrier and getting a new SIM card? When I've had issues with connectivity in the past, replacing the old SIM card with a new one has solved the problem for me.

Do you by any chance with TMobile?
If so, can you try turning off VoLTE calls under Settings->More->Mobile network and see if you can make calls then?

I also suggest seeing if another/a new SIM would work in your device. Keep us posted!
By any chance, have you dropped your phone or gotten any water in it recently?
This happens to me sometimes when I'm out of range of a cell tower - have you tried it in different locations?

title: Android 7 with emui 4?

thread.text:
I am new to the Honor 8 world. Sadly, I am realizing that several Huawei phones (including the Honor 8) have issues with the screen automatically dimming when opening certain apps (Chrome, stock SMS, Gmail, dialer, etc.). I find it very distracting.
I have heard that emui 4 had a feature called "performance mode", which would prevent this issue from happening. Unfortunately the feature went away when upgrading to emui 5. 
Is there a way to upgrade to Android 7 while still keeping emui 4?
Unfortunately not. Android 7 means it is EMUI 5.

replies.text:
That's too bad. So, even if I didn't want to use EMUI at all, i.e., if I used another Launcher such as Nova, there is no way of upgrading the phone to Android 7 without getting rid of EMUI 4?
There is no standalone Android 7 installer then?
I basically don't want to lose the "performance mode". Well, actually, what I want is for the screen not to dim, and this seems to be the only way.
Just turn off auto brightness? I've never had that issue though with my device.

thread.text:
Emui is what huawei calls their version of Android. Emui 4 is based on marshmallow, emui 5 is nougat. It isn't a launcher or skin, it's the name of the OS. Huawei doesn't provide a vanilla version of android. 
You can use nova or whatever you want and it works as it should. But that won't fix how huawei handles screen brightness. 
The screen dims whether you like it or not (of course we don't, but they've gone this far without a fix). This issue occurred with EMUI 4 as well, it isn't nougat specific. 
I like the phone a lot but dimming the screen with auto brightness OFF is just cruel
I think you can still get performance mode if you go to the phone manager app

title: Dead Power Button: how to restart Honor 8 without it?

thread.text: The Honor 8's power button stopped working. I am still able to turn on the screen by reading the fingerprint. But I cannot see how to restart the phone without the use of the power button. In addition, I wonder what would I do in case the phone is turned off completely.

Welcome! I would contact Honor and see what their suggestions are. They may suggest that you send your phone to them. How old is your device, and when did the power button stop working? Maybe it's suffering from water damage?
You can also set scheduled power cycling in the battery settings.

Thanks for good suggestions. Scheduled Power On/Off seems like a good workaround, but in my case it does not work as expected. It does power off the device but fails to turn it back on. I found that simply connecting to the charger turns the device back on.
My $400 investment is barely 7 months old and progressively falling apart. The power button stopped working after a series of strange behavior, like "Charging other device via USB" notification, not responsive "Smart Key", random launch of applications set to be opened with the smart key. (Honestly, I have serious concerns about build and components quality of Huawei products.) Regarding water damage, I don't think this is the case. The device was never exposed to liquids. Also, I would expect it to be engineered as sweat and humidity resistant, which may not be necessarily true.
I wonder how many Honor 8 customers experienced issues related to water-, dust- or heat-damage, without actually abusing the device.

replies.text:
Random thought - can the Smart Key be used to power down or restart the device? But then again, you've stated that the Smart Key can be unresponsive, so scratch that idea.
To be honest,I've heard some bad experiences with Huawei customer service. But I've also seen how they can turn things around and help customers out. Either way, my device is 8 months old and since I bought it unlocked, I'm kind of worried about if anything happens to it. Keep us posted!

thread.text: you can use adb shell to restart the phone. do a quick google on how to restart android without power button

The responsiveness issue of the Smart Key went away after a day or two, only Fingerprint ID stopped working. Good thought about using Smart Key to perform restart/power off, but such an option is unavailable. I don't know if my device is sort of special (as so many issues surfaced during the first 6 months of soft use), although my friend warned me against buying Huawei. In his experience there were a couple glitches and extreme slowness passed the first year of use.

replies.text: It's too bad that kind of option isn't available. For sure: Huawei has mixed customer service reviews. Hopefully you won't experience any more problems with your device.

title: Honor 8 warm/hot when I use camera

thread.text: I bought honor 8 not long ago (some 3-4 days ago) everything seems right so far except that when I use camera the camera part gets warm and the side of the phone (volume + , - ) part gets a bit hot , so I turned on the camera for like 8,9 min and the CPU temperature was around 50 according to CPU temp, and the battery dropped from 94% to 88% . Also during charging the phone gets warm as well, is this normal? I can still return it and get a new one with in 7 days since I bought this one on Wednesday, if this is not normal I can return it by tomorrow

Hello! While I think it's somewhat normal for a phone to get a little warm while charging - or if it's being put through the ringer with lots of heavy usage, so to speak - but if it's getting warm only by using your camera for a short period of time, I recommend that you return it and get a new one.
Let us know what happens!
Cpu temp of 50c is pretty cool, I would not worry about it. If it was battery temperature then that's pretty warm.
Battery temperature is around 38 c. I don't know if it is normal
So I called huawei help center and they said it's normal , android phones do heat up a bit. I'm totally confused
Try using camera without GPS Tag / Location ON. You can disable it in camera settings.

Turning on camera for 8 to 9 mins continuously and doing camera manipulations, that is, using the camera app, it is ideal your phone will heat up. I think the temperatures you are reporting are also ideal given your use case. I have seen this behavior even in Samsung Galaxy phones and sometimes in my iPhone 7 Plus when the camera app is open for quite long time like yours.
Hi i got the phone 4 days back and I'm experiencing the same issue and don't know if its normal.. can u please help me?
Having light hitting a light collection sensor for that long will always heat up the sensor. It's not unusual and the sensors are made to work with higher tolerances.

title: Honor 8 frequent crash/reboot

thread.text:
I recently purchased a used Honor 8, and love it almost all of the time. Biggest problem I've had is a frequent crash/restart issue. Seems to happen most frequently when using the stock (Huawei) camera app, but I've had it happen when answering and making phone calls, using multiple apps, etc. It even went into a boot loop once while just sitting idle on a table.
It's most repeatable by simply taking a few photos with the camera and then, boom the screen goes black and either reboots by itself or has to be restarted. The fact that it has happened elsewhere leaves me wondering if it's not solely tied to the camera. Perhaps there is a hardware issue, but I can't find anyone else experiencing similar issues with this phone.
I've tried booting into safe mode and it's happened there as well. The only thing I could think to try was a factory reset. Done that a couple of times now with no improvement.
Can anyone think of any other way I can troubleshoot this?
Honor 8 FRD-L04
EMUI 5.0
Android 7.0

The only thing that i can suggest would be to do a factory data reset. If that doesn't work then I would suggest that you try to contact Honor support to see if they will help, or if you can return it then i would do so.

I've been using my phone for months now and apart from one random reboot I've never had the phone act strange. I've even used it as a camera for a family function and took about 190 photos in a span of 4 hrs and the phone didn't let me down. It would be best if u contact Honor support since I think u have a a defective unit.

Thanks for the responses guys. I've tried a factory reset a couple of times, but it hasn't helped. I bought the phone used, so unfortunately I don't have any warranty support. I hate to dump the phone, but I'm beginning to think I may have to.

replies.text:
Welcome To AndroidCentral! Thanks for the question 
If you are recording 1080p video at 60fps for 5 minutes or more, there is a possibility that the phone can get a little warm. It normally happens when people record 4K video though and not so much with lower resolutions. I wouldn't worry too much.
Do you have any other Applications running in the background at the same time?
If you need additional help or have more questions or details to share, please join the site so you can reply in this thread. See this link for instructions on how to join Android Central.

title: Do Not Disturb?

thread.text:

Does anyone use Do Not Disturb on their Honor 8 regularly? I use it almost every night, and I've noticed that it does put some tax on my battery. For example, if my phone charges at night and I then unplug it and have DND enabled, I will notice a slight drain in the morning. Today, it was a 13% drain; but sometimes it's a little better or maybe fifteen percent. I guess it depends on the amount of notifications I get that need to be silenced; and/or LED notifications going off if I get a priority alert.
Does the same kind of drain happen for anyone else? Other than this, I'm experiencing good battery life.

That sounds strange but it could depend on how you have your DND setup. As in what you let ring/notify. Personally, I've been too lazy to setup mine and end up muting my phone when going into meetings or nights when I have my phone in the room. Oddly enough, I don't sleep with my phone in my room because it is the only time that I can get without being tied to it for work.
Somewhat off topic but on the subject of battery life, mine is not as good as it was when I first received my phone last year. I would get 4-5 hours SoT and a good amount of time for voice calls and now I average 2.5-3.5 hours of SoT before needing to charge. This still does the job for me though and is much better than my previous Moto X 2014 PE.

title: SD card already inserted, how to transfer the songs over?

Open the file manager (my files). Open internal storage. Find the songs. Tap the three dots in top right corner. Tap edit. Select the songs you want to move. Select move.... Follow prompts

title: My Thoughts on the Honor 8 (after 5 days)

thread.text:
I recently bought an Honor 8 to replace my troubled Note 5 and boy have I been impressed!
The hardware I find to be VERY aesthetically pleasing. In many ways it kinda looks like an iPhone 6 or 7. It's light, shiny, and pocketable. What's not to like? And I find the 5.2 inch display to be the perfect size.
At first I didn't really know about the EMUI. It's very IOS like IMO. But I think I like it. It's like having the best of IOS and android in one device. From the former it's VERY smooth and from the latter it's also very customizable. But to me.The best things are the all the tricks this thing has up it's sleeve like the finger print button, it's split screen features, dash buttons, gestures, etc. 
Battery life is great, camera I really haven't tested.
In short this it's a SOLID phone. It may be categorized as a mid ranger but nobody told Huawei that, as it really is a flagship like device. This phone is so good it makes me think of buying an Mate 9 in time. 
Last thing. One thing this phone had taught me is that with the right "mid ranger" companies like Honor or Oneplus there's no need to buy a super expensive $80" phone unless u just want to. And if u do that's fine too...But ALL the features one really could want could be found with an Honor 8 or a Oneplus 3.

title: Honor 8: Nine Months After

thread.text:
For the past nine months, I’ve been using the Huawei Honor 8 (Sapphire Blue, 32GB) with a matte plastic screen protector and a silicone case on the T-Mobile and MintSIM networks as my daily driver. After a brief (and rather alarming) bout with some snow and water in January, I thought the Honor 8 was done for, but after some percussive maintenance (of all things!), I was able to continue using it. It has been a rather hardy phone; surviving falls, drops, and dunks in water (even without an IP rating of any sort), and I am quite fond of its resilience.
However, all good things must come to an end, and no industry better exemplifies this than the smartphone industry. After a particularly hard drop onto concrete from about 5 feet in the air, my Honor 8 landed (in a case) on a corner, and cracked along the top bezel. The crack did not, however, go over any important components such as the camera or proximity sensor, nor did it encroach onto the screen. Thankfully, the phone is still very functional, and the damage was simply aesthetic.
What’s my plan now? Well, because the damage is just aesthetic, I’ll simply fix the aesthetics. I’ve ordered a tempered glass screen protector that has coloring along the bezels, so the crack will be covered up (and yes, I know, I should have been using a tempered glass screen protector from the start, but the matte looked so nice, especially for reading e-books). I plan to continue using the Honor 8 for at least another school year, however, that decision will heavily depend on how it fares for the rest of the summer. I may buy a battery case, as the battery is beginning to show signs of usage. However, all in all, the Honor 8 has held up very well in terms of performance, sturdiness, and usability, and I am looking forward to continuing using it for a long time.
How's your Honor 8 holding up? Let me know in the comment below!
-lumivalo
P.S. - I'm out of school, so I have more time to dedicate to the forums, now! As always, feel free to PM me if you have any questions.

Otherwise, my phone is holding up really well other than the occasional glitch. Still loving it! Can't give it up for another phone yet!

title: Honor 8 Laser Engraving - Back Glass Customization (Pictures included)

thread.text:
With a 60W CO2 laser cutter/engraver (in my school's MakerLab), I have engraved the back glass of my Honor 8 with my name:
Also, I have engraved my silicone case with a similar engraving:
I used Adobe Illustrator for the fonts/logos, and the proprietary laser engraver software for rendering.
Thoughts? Questions? Comment below!
-lumivalo

replies.text: FPS rubbing off?

thread.text: The laser etching is a pretty good idea. I am curious if anyone has thought of using a glass etching applique in the same manner?
It's possible, but I prefer laser etching for speed.

replies.text: I brought up glass etching acid due to it's more widely available and cheaper than a laser etcher.
Have you ever done etching acid? How difficult is it to make something that looks good?

I did it in grade school shop class. There we had a choice of a template that had the acid already on it. You applied it like a temporary tattoo and let it sit for a while ( honestly can't remember how long). The other choice was we could take a clear sheet of heavy plastic, cut our own design and we could spread a small amount of a jelly like acid. 
I remember it was thick like jam or creamy PB, and it was somewhat translucent.
Seems like the hardest part is the template... To get what you want. Then just slap on the acid gel?

The template...like the temp tattoos already had the acid applied. Think more like a sticker where the adhesive side is the acid.
The free form template might be a bit more difficult depending on your artistic capability. Where mine is like...none..lol
Edit: but as I recall, it is just cut your design and apply the acid.
I wonder if you can get some place to do the template for you, for those of us who don't have a lot of artistic capability. Sounds like the application part is simple enough.

I found the etching stencils on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Armour-Etch-S...cUvbUpU5860648
Also some already made stencils that look like they are reusable: https://www.amazon.com/Armour-Etch-G...cUvbUpU5860648

My wife is a bit crafty so we have some equipment at home...
But you could potentially take a Silhouette Cameo, some vinyl, and that etching cream and do the same with your own patterns and designs.https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01I51ME1S...cUvbUpU5860727
That's pretty cool. A bit pricey for a one time deal but if you use it a lot then it could be worth it.
That's cool. I guess if they have the stencil design that you want then you are golden.
Definitely, you're right on that. It can be difficult to get the stencil right, though.
Fair point. Sorry for somewhat hijacking your thread.
Lol, no worries. I really enjoy the tangents that these threads tend to go on.

thread.text: That looks pretty sweet! Very nice customization. I think that it would look sweeter with a clear case, IMO. That would really show off the etching on the back of the phone which to me is more unique than a case etching.
I agree - but I think I've had my fill of clear cases for this phone being unprotective and flimsy - especially when I want this phone to last for a while as my daily driver.

replies.text: There are protective clear or at least translucent back case manufacturers, but not sure if they make them for the honor 8. Things are probably too late for the honor 8 , But hopefully things will change with the honor 9.

replies.text: Yes this was done at the equipment from school. One of the perks of going to school i guess.

My school has a MakerLab with all the equipment and tools (we've also got stuff like 3D printers). I'd be pretty open to engraving stuff for you as long as it's non-metal (most metals don't engrave well). Feel free to PM me if you're interested ^_^

title: Selective outgoing call issue

thread.text: Stumped by this problem! With the phone. I have a handful of numbers (that I know of) that I can receive a call and text back and forth, but cannot call them. When it tries to dial it quits and the call log shows the call as cancelled. When I swap it in another phone, I do not have any problems with this SIM. I've reset network settings, deleted contacts, but am stumped. Any ideas before I send the phone back to Amazon? Thx!!!

replies.text: I have this exact problem.are you with TMobile? They tried several options and are unclear where the issue is. The troubling thing is, when I put the same sim in my iPhone and everything works, calls go through.
Are you on the Digits beta with T-mobile? I am, if that makes any difference. Still, it has no problems in the iPhone.

Yes, I am also in the Digits program. 
I will try the VoLTE thing today morning and let you know if that works.

thread.text: Try a different dialler?

Yes, I am on T-mobile. Like you, I have no problems calling these same numbers when I pop the SIM into my iPhone. I have six lines on my account, and mine is the only one having these issues. I can even receive a call from the number but cannot call back. I have tried everything short of a factory reset, which may be my last option. If that doesn't work I may have to return the phone and get something else. It's a shame too, since I really like this phone.
Oh yeah, I've tried different dialers to no avail 
Thanks. LMK if you find the solution.

I think I have found the problem. Unfortunately, the solution sucks!
If I toggle off VoLTE calls tab then the call goes right through. The phone is only a few weeks old and can still be returned to Amazon, so I'm not sure I want to hold onto this one if I can't have VoLTE. Grrrr. I'll have to see if there is a fix, otherwise, I'll have to find another phone.

Update: I plopped my SIM into daughter's Nexus 6P with VoLTE calling and the dialing is fine. Also no problem with the other daughter's iPhone 7. Afraid it is a problem with this phone. Hmmm, hate to see it go...

Wow. After turning off, the calls go through. And now the calls go through even if VoLTE is enabled. I will do more testing. 
BTW, are you in EMUI 4 or 5?

Had a long chat with TMobile reps. Since this is not a TMobile branded phone, they say the recommendation is to turn off VoLTE for now if it doesn't work as expected. They also assured me it doesn't affect my current service in any ways as it is an additional value that works on TMobile phones. 
I can live with this for now and we should raise this issue with Honor I guess.

I am on EMUI 5 with Nougat. I seem to recall when I first got the phone before Digits, I had an intermittent calling issue with a few numbers as well. Turning off VoLTE is not really thrilling since it was one of the selling points for me on this phone.

replies.text: Sorry to say but this is an issue with emui 5. I have never had this issue with emui 4 and I am also on T-mobile.
Could be as I was with ATT when I had EMUI 4 in my Honor 8. I just switched few weeks ago.
Do you have this issue as well then?
I haven't been able to test this, my sim hasn't been in that phone since installing the update.

thread.text: I don't know what changed but VoLTE calls are now working in my Honor 8. May be it was something to do on T-Mobile servers, but is working now

It's like I have a 2016 phone in the small form factor of the G2. The best part is the screen is 5.2", so lots of screen real estate, but small print. 
The phone is surprisingly snappy and the battery life very good. It's not Z Play good (that is my other phone), but about on par with the Z Force or Turbo 2. The camera was fantastic for its time, but probably below average by today's standards. Shutter is exceptionally fast though. The speaker kind of sucks, but I mostly use headphones, so it doesn't matter too much to me. 
Sure, the plastic back looks cheaper, but it in a case and it doesn't matter. And the screen, even by today's standards, is amazing.

thread.text: It's a nice phone, but if you've never used a Huawei/Honor phone before, your going to have to get used to Huawei's battery management and notification issues. If you're familiar with all that, you might like the 8.

I will of course be biased here, but I have had my Honor 8 for about five and a half months and love it! I paid $400 for it at the time and it was worth every penny.
My favourite thing about the Honor 8 is how unique it is. You get a brand that not a lot of people know about; a UI that is original and amazing (EMUI is great! And customizable! And fun!); the design is gorgeous and the size (5.2") is my preferred sweet spot for phones. The dual cameras take great shots. I'm not a huge camera enthusiast - if a phone is great but the camera is so-so, it won't bother me if I buy it - but this phone has given me some great shots. My boyfriend has an iPhone SE and he tells me he really likes the quality of my photos - and coming from an iPhone user, that's huge!
I would say that the Honor 8 is a great phone - it delivers flagship-level specs at an affordable price. Even though I usually get the itch to upgrade phones at the six-month mark, and even though I see some phones out now that I'd like, I honestly can't give up my Honor 8. I'll keep it and use it until it gives on me. I would personally recommend it to anyone who is interested in a unique user experience that would differ from more mainstream Android devices.

It's a very noticeable lag between when you touch the screen and the response on the screen. It's definitely not an isolated incident as I've noticed it on 3 of my Honor 8s, all different colors (don't ask lol) on Nougat. It's funny you mentioned about the S7 being laggy and the Honor 8 being not, the S7 Edge became kinda my baseline when comparing devices due to its touch responsiveness and other goodies. Occasional lag, yeah I've noticed that with all my Android devices but none of them had touch latency issues as bad as the Honor 8. Devices I've owned and used so far are the Moto X Pure, Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P, Honor 8, Galaxy S7, Galaxy S7E (Exynos) and next week it'll be the Galaxy S8.
Edit: One thing to note, I use Google Now launcher on all my Android devices. I've noticed the touch latency mostly on the home screen on the Honor if I remember correctly. Not sure if it's a Google Now thing or an issue with Honor. I want the regular size S8 but I can't stand touch wiz so I fear it. I'd be curious to know if they have refined it any to be smoother?

As I mentioned in my comment above, this is not an hardware/software issue but a quality issue. I remember reading on xda that the EMUI 5.1 update will definitely improve the latency issue but so far the Honor hasn't received it.I haven't really used TouchWiz/Samsung Experience skin but I have heard its better on Nougat. I used it briefly for a couple of hours and it does look alright. If Samsung could give a way to disable icon notification counter and throw in a vertical scrolling app drawer then I would gladly switch to it.
BTW here's how you could test the latency...slide your finger slowly on the screen without lifting it and see how delayed is the scroll response. The Nexus 6P, S7E have a very minor delay, the Honor's was pretty noticeable on the first Nougat update w/ Dec 2016 patch.

Once they commit to the US which won't be much longer their software will have a huge following and I'm sure they already know or have in the works that they will release some software that will be branded as the third choice but only to be compatible with Google play and parts of Android. Who knows they could go all out and build their own community and play store which isn't far fetched. Their vision is number one and like they said innovation will definitely take them there by 2021. It'll be cool to watch it unfold. I predict there first full year here to be dead slow but year two will give growth to like 400 percent compared to year one and they will start their rise from there.

Definitely agree, it would be awesome to have more choice and more competition when it comes to mobile operating system. it's just really hard to get developers to starting making apps for an OS that has no customers when they are guaranteed many sales with Android and iOS. 
Blackberry did try back in 2013 to make their own OS called 'BB10' but customers were not that interested because it didn't have all the Apps they wanted. 
One company that does have a chance is Microsoft with their Windows Mobile OS. There are already a wide variety of devices running the OS so there is potential.

I agree! It's just going to take a company like Huawei to do this. They are already number three with sales steadily on the rise. Their mission as the article stated was innovation and with innovation comes change and with change brings new life to a dormant eco system. The door is wide open for them and lets face we all are looking for something different and new. Huawei plans to do just that. I read where their plan is to hit the US when 5g hits which isn't that far away. Talking maybe a year or two max. Once they are fully carrier supported their stock and sales will explode here in the US. A flagship company at 3/4s the flagship price if they stay true to their core will blow this market away. So if anyone can build their own OS and community and bring customers over it's Huawei. EMUI has already proven that there is more than just android and IOS.

Making a new OS is very difficult and costly. Especially consider how well refined ios and Android is today compared with the first release. It would take a major push from a major player if you want to see it with any following anytime soon... Like Samsung Tizen. 
But really the biggest issue i think would be apps...app devs are unlikely to want to put the effort to make apps for small os. Even look at windows mobile... They lack apps and the apps that they have aren't as refined as Android/ios

thread.text: Honor is a very unique organization and I really think it will do well in future years. Hopefully Huawei/Honor do great this year!

title: EMUI Email & Calendar App?

thread.text: I'm curious how many of you like or use the default email and calendar app in EMUI?

I use my default mail app, definitely. Sometimes it has sync issues - sometimes I know an email has come to me (ie, the sender tells me they just sent it; or I'm on my email account on my laptop and see that it has arrived) but it won't sync on my phone for a few minutes to an hour. Or sometimes the sync is automatic and I get the emails as I should. It's a little finicky but it's okay! I get my work emails just fine mostly.
As far as the calendar app, I use the "Event Flow Widget" app to better organise and display my upcoming appointments, events, etc. Doesn't do anything to my battery life and I really like the widget's transparency.

I only recently started using the EMUI mail app. I usually used Gmail but lately my Yahoo mail has not been connecting correctly. I like to use one app for all my accounts, so I decided to give this a try. so far no issues.

replies.text: Glad you are enjoying it and that you are having no issues so far!

thread.text: I prefer to use Gmail and Google's calendar app mainly because it gives me a consistent feel across my android devices.

title: Dropping calls on sim2

thread.text:
Hi everyone,
First post so be gentle
I got my dual sim honor 8 some months ago as I dont want to carry 2 phones around with me.
My personal sim and the phone are with Three UK and my work sim is with EE.
The three sim is in slot 1 and the EE simin slot 2 and I am finding the calls keep dropping for no reason on the EE sim. I can be in an area with full signal but when the call drops I cant dial out or receive calls. The phone goes to dial but just sits with the calling screen and then fails to connect.
After I have moved it works again, its generally happening in the same places too but places that shouldnt be an issue. 
Whilst the sim 2 is in this condition I can still call out from sim 1 (Three) and this problem never occurs on sim 1 (Three).
I have tried swapping the sims over but the problem remains with the EE sim. I have tried to swap the 4g priority over but the Three sim is 3g only so wont work as the secondary sim.
I have spoken with my work IT and they have replaced the EE sim but this hasnt fixed it, I have called Three tech support who have reset this and reset that and run diagnostics and say nothing wrong with the handset.
Any ideas or any one else experienced this?
Many thanks

title: It isn't able to hold GPS tracking app in background

thread.text:
Hi, I have a problem with RAM management, or keeping an app running in the background to be more specific. I'm running stock EMUI 4.1.
If I have too many apps opened and stored in RAM (like 5+ or so; such as fb, messenger, email, youtube, instagram, ...), it often causes restart of the apps while switching between these apps I have already opened and stored in RAM. Even if it shows I have 1,5 GB RAM free. What's the point in high RAM capacity in phones (3-6 GB thesedays) when even with that much RAM (and that much FREE RAM) the phone isn't able to hold them really "opened" in RAM all and the apps "reloads" (as if it was launched for the first time) when you try to recall/launch them (quickly, but still).
It doesn't bother me that much generally, but only with one app - GPS tracking apps. After some time (maybe 1-2 hours) it always "drops" the app from RAM (it's still in recent apps though) therefore deleting my existing workout and tracked route. It's annoying. And yes I have the tracking apps selected in "protected apps". It happens still. Once I rebooted the phone, cleared apps stored in RAM so the only app running was Runkeeper. I went cycling and after some time (1-2 hours) I stopped, took the phone out of pocket, turned the display on, clicked on the GPS tracking app and it started to reopen/reload itself and once it reopens -> no trace of my existing workout, everything was gone. All of that with ~2.2 GB of free RAM.
What good does 2.2 GB of "free RAM" do when the phone isn't able to keep the only running app in the background for few hours? I tried many GPS tracking apps, happens always. It didn't happen with my Moto G (1st gen.; 2013) with 1 GB of RAM, but it happens with a lot newer and better phone with 4 GB of RAM?
Any tips for that, anyone? Please?

I'm sorry that is happening man. I would be irritated like no tomorrow had I biked two hours thinking I was tracking and to find out nothing. For some reason I still may think it's the app shutting itself down once a certain time has lapsed. I've had similar if I didn't keep it on the the work out screen it would eventually shut itself down for I suppose non useage it thinks. Have you tried the honor fitness app yet? I know mine runs non stop has it tracks my steps through the entire day. Never shuts down. Try that app and see just see if it remains active for testing purposes as you may not like the app. It will rule out why some are shutting down if it doesn't. The other thing I think of is you're running 4.1 still and if you updated to ,5.0 it may change and fix your entire problem. I personally was against 5.0 but to be honest it's not really that much different than 4.1 but very very minor changes. I bet that plays a role. They both of those and let me know and I'll try and help you the best I can.

Don

replies.text: So long as you aren't using disallowed characters there shouldn't be any reason you can't rename the file. What file explorer app are you using, and what precisly are you trying to rename the font file to?

I've got it downloaded and renamed but I just can't get it over to hw themes for some reason which if I could would enable me to choose it as my font. Somehow I did it right on my last honor 8 but this one I've hit a brick wall. Please help man.

First, I strongly advise using a different file browser if that's the stock one you are using. I personally recommend Root Explorer ($3.99 USD), or it's free version Explorer. Navigate the base internal storage path to locate "hwthemes". Open another internal storage tab, find the font file, long-press it then tap the scissors button. Now tap on the tab that has the theme folder open and tap the paste button.

thread.text: Here ya go. From this point I cannot get it over to hw themes. What am I missing?

Only on 4.1. Not 5.0.

replies.text: Apologies, what do you mean by "it"? The font, or the hwthemes directory? Could you provide a screen cap of your internal storage?

thread.text: I mean when I select the hwt file to move or copy to themes when I select it to move my options it gives me hwthemes is not listed.

Got it guys and pretty girls! I was only moving from the selected directory and I tried the file manger internally and all the files I had transferred were there but the internal file manger pushed them through. This is my new font. Had to make it large but it's my favorite font. Called comic sans. So finally. Thank you to those who tried to help me. I appreciate your time.

thread.text:
As a person who has changed somewhere around 100,000 thread titles over the past 5 years, I can share my guidelines if that helps avoid this in the future. 
1. Whenever possible, the device being talked about should be mentioned in the thread title
2. Whenever possible, the thread title should be a complete sentence
3. The entire main point or question of the thread should be represented in the thread title
Examples of good thread titles:
How do I change the font on my Honor 8?
Is it possible to change the font to Comic Sans on the Honor 8?
I would like to change my font to Comic Sans on my Honor 8
Examples of less than good thread titles: 
Hey yo, what's up?
Does this make sense?
Wait until you see...
etc. 
Two reasons:
1. The exact nature of the thread should be immediately clear to readers without any need to click on the thread to find out what it's about. 
2. The exact nature of the thread should make sense to a person searching for the same thing on search engines. Make the title a complete sentence that includes the key words someone else would be looking for. We're not about the click bait or confusion. 
Hopefully that helps.

title: Calendar entries not syncing - is this the solution?

thread.text:
Hi 
So I've had the Honor 8 for 3 months now - quite liked it to begin with; then didn't; then got used to EMUI 4.1 and liked it again; then didn't like it after the upgrade to 5; then liked it again - but then I started noticing a problem with the calendar app - I use Pocket Informant - meaning I haven't really trusted it for the last month.
I see clients for my business out of a couple of different locations plus the odd home visit and usually book follow up appointments on the Honor before they/I leave. Unknown to me to begin with, some of these appointments subsequently disappeared from my calendar meaning I've missed several client follow ups over the past month (NOT good for business!!). Once I realised this was happening I started paying attention and on one occasion I left the office in town having booked 3 follow ups and by the time I got home 20 min later, all 3 had disappeared from the phone. But it's not every appointment that vanishes and appointments I make when I'm at home (on wifi) don't disappear.
In desperation I did a backup and factory reset yesterday but on setting everything up again I realised that I had previously had all apps set to close on screen lock to save power. My theory is that if Pocket Informant hasn't synced before it gets closed, those new additions get deleted. So I've now got it set not to close and hoping that'll solve the problem.
Anyone else encountered this kind of issue? 
Is this a likely solution? 
Am I missing anything?
Thanks in advance
Chris

Update - I posted this question to Honor support UK and received the following reply:
Try enabling a few things to see if this helps resolve the issue...
1) Please go into Settings » Wi-Fi » Advanced settings » Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep » Always
2) Please go into Settings » More » Wireless & networks » Mobile Network » and enable Always-on mobile data
3) Please go into Settings » Networked apps » and mark the desired apps that you want to work with both Wi-Fi and mobile data
4) Please now go to Phone Manager app » (swipe left) Protected apps » and enable any apps that you want to keep running after the screen is turned off.
5) Please, in the Phone Manage app, also select the Battery Manager and select the normal performance power plan (the smart power plan will disable Wi-Fi and other apps to conserve battery life.)
6) Finally, when you make an appointment, you can close/lock the screen but do not actually close the app (you can close it later when you're sure that it has synced).
7) If you think that your battery life or other circumstances are going to prevent your phone from syncing, you should be able to go into Settings » Accounts » Google account » and find an option to sync the account there.
Please let us know if the above helps to resolve the issue. We do apologize that some of these settings have caused some missed appointments. The default settings are designed for people who use their phone with a wide variety of uses and to conserve as much battery as possible for you.
So this looks like it confirms my theory that aggressive app closure is the reason for the dropped appointments. And it appears to have resolved the issue since booking client appointments today without a data connection, all appointments have subsequently synchronised.
Hope this might be helpful to anyone else experiencing this problem.
Chris

Update #2 
It's been a quiet 3 weeks but yesterday I made an appointment at a venue with no data signal. When I left 3 hours later, I checked the phone and the appointment had disappeared.
Another search later and I've found a thread from April that might hold the answer. Turns out there's a known sync problem with Huawei's own calendar and the recommendation is to install Google Calendar and kill all permissions for the built-in app.
See https://productforums.google.com/for...g/Hffn2aV-DgAJ
Interesting calendar info here as well describing a sync problem:https://ptacnikt.blogspot.co.uk/2017...-calendar.html
And I'm not the only one...https://forum.xda-developers.com/hon...roken-t3548791
Chris

While the screen in nice on the honor 8 the infinity display is absolutely amazing on this damn phone. The battery life is miles better than the honor 8 get 2-3 days light use and a day of mid to heavy use. Average around 6-7 sot. 
Then there is Samsung pay, which works on just about every card reader made. It had the ability to use the magnetic strip as if I were sliding a card. The rewards program for Samsung pay is also freaking nice. 
And the sound on this phones is miles ahead of honor 8. It's no HTC 10 or v20, the akg head phones that come in the box are really nice and have a great sound for earbuds. I can actually use the Android Easter egg in this phone as well. 
Then there is the water and dust resistance, along with wireless charging. When it can be utilized the Bluetooth 5.0 is going to be a nice feature. 
Don't get me wrong I loved my honor 8 at least up until emui 5 when they pulled their performance profiles and made it look like every other Android UI. For 300 bucks you can't beat what the honor has to offer.
I was just kidding lol. S8 is definitely better phone but honor 8 is very reliable phone.
While its easy to compare both, i think its unfair, and, clearly S8 being Samsung's Flagship phone carries more weight than Honor's budget category of devices.

title: Honor8 vs OP3 vs iPhone7 vs Samsung S7! Verdict (Indian Version)

thread.text:
With the launch of the much awaited Honor 8 on October 12 in India, the battle among the top flagship smartphones has become even more exciting. While the market has got a new competitor to watch out for, here we open the debate to all by comparing top flagship phones from the current market leaders. Read on to know who takes the cake...
Below table shows the comparison of various technical specifications and pricing for the flagship phones.
Based on the above table, we can clearly see the flagship phones from the top manufacturers around the world. They all boast of high-end specifications and are capable of doing much more than a smartphone is supposed to do. With the launch of Honor 8, the competition just got tougher and Honor 8 is really giving a neck to neck fight to all top guns here with almost half the price than that of iPhone 7 and 60% than that of Samsung S7. The only competitor we have in the price segment is one Plus 3 but Honor 8 definitely outshines OP3 with some quality specs and also from an end user's real life experience. It has a slim profile that redefines design. Icing on the cake is you get expandable storage and dual cameras.
Honor 8 definitely has some additional factors over the other competitors here which makes it a clear winner:Dual camera with RGB and Monochrome sensors to give 300% more light than iPhone 7 in low light conditionAdvance Fingerprint supports NFC and Mobile payment along with additional features like taking photos, answering calls, stop alarms, shows recent app, access notification panel, scrolling through the photos in gallery, opening app etc.Expandable memory with SD card up to 128 GBThe built-in dual ISP improves focus, speed, and process time while clicking pictures.Wide aperture mode to redefine the focus even after photo is taken.The Eye-Care Mode makes looking at your phone more comfortable and safe by filtering part of the blue light to reduce eye strain.Smart Battery saving modesA-GPS+GLONASS *
*this feature is present in all of the above listed flagship phone
Design- Honor 8 is stylish, sleek and it looks premium. It uses 2.5D glass in front and back making the device shiny. The Sapphire blue color that honor has launched is just stunning and breaks away from the regular greys and silver colors that most of the smartphones offer.Battery- There is no match to the battery life of Honor 8 with any other smartphone in the market even with a 4000 mAh battery. Honor 8 is able to stretch the screen on time (SOT) up to 7+ hours easily (even few users were able to touch 8 hours SOT) and that’s the biggest advantage here over any other phone.Display- With 5.2 inch FHD IPS LCD display and 96% NTSC, every pixel reproduced on Honor 8 looks stunnning making it overall a great screen to view the content. With 423 PPI, everything displayed on the screen looks so natural and real. All the images, videos and other content looks so real and vibrant that you can't take your eyes off the display.Camera-The Honor 8 undoubtedly has the best camera even beating the likes of iPhone easily in its color reproduction and the details in the image. The Honor 8 is the only phone apart from Huawei P9 and the iPhone 7 Plus that offers a dual-camera setup in India and Honor 8 easily beats the camera quality of iPhone, even in low light condition. Hardware- OP3 comes with tested Qualcomm’s SD820, iPhone with in house A9 chip, S7 with Exynos 8890 and are capable of lag free multitasking, Honor 8 is matches up to their standard being powered by hi-Silicon Kirin 950 processor-- built on 16 nm technology; i5 co-processor coupled with 4GB of LPDDR4 RAM is capable enough to do multitasking smoothly. Rapid smart file processing system ensures lag free user experience. This phone wont slow down with time unlike other Android devices.UI/OS- OnePlus 3 offers a near stock Android experience with OxygenOS, Samsung comes with TouchWiz UI over android, iPhone7 offers iOS whereas the Honor 8 comes with a very intuitive Emotion UI 4.1 over Android Marshmallow. EMUI is feature-rich and provides lot of other options over other UIs and have built in phone manager, harassment filters, traffic manager and various innovative messaging features that really outsmart other UI and their features.[Verdict] Who Takes The Cake-
Based on various specifications related to hardware, software, battery, design, look and feel, performance, camera and reliability and keeping in mind the price for the large number of users in Indian market, the Honor 8 is an excellent high-end flagship smartphone. For the power users who do not wish to compromise on the performance, look and other aspects of the phone this device is premium yet priced reasonably. Battery life is good, the dual camera produces superior professional quality shots, the fingerprint scanner is excellent and works almost every time and with 32GB of storage and a microSD card slot, there’s plenty of space for apps, photos and music. I give a thumbs up to Honor 8 among the top four flagship phones.
Link to my original post on Honor Community

title: How To Transfer Apps To SD CARD In Honor 8lite

thread.text:
I Recently bought A Honor 8lite And I Am Facing difficulties Trying To transfer apps to SD Card. It Has The Latest EMUI 5 and Android 7.0 But I Am Having A Hard Time Finding how to transfer apps to SD Cards. I have almost filled my internal Storage So I Bought 16 GB Card To transfer Apps But I Don't Know How ?
It would be grateful if you tell me how to transfer them to SD card 🙏 
Thanks

Welcome to Android Central! Moved from the Android Apps forum to the Honor 8 forum.
Not all phones support the Move to SD feature. If you can't find a Move to SD button for any app in Settings>Apps, then the phone doesn't support it. You'd have to root the phone and use an app like Link2SD or App Mgr III.
Does the phone support Adoptable Storage? If you insert a blank SD card, does it give you the option to format it as Internal Storage instead of Portable Storage?

Will Rooting The Device Cause Negative changes in performance or future updates ?
If No Then Should An Average Person consider rooting or getting there Device rooted?

I don't have any direct rooting experience, but from what I know, it depends on how much you modify the system after rooting.
What about my other question -- does the phone support Adoptable Storage for the SD card?
Honor phones don't support adoptable storage. I'm almost certain this spans all huawei phones.

Thanks, @orangecroc! So that makes Samsung, LG, and Huawei that don't support it. Lenovo does, but it seems their implementation is less-than-perfect, judging from the relatively common issues mentioned in these forums.

The real world read/write speeds for sd cards aren't really consistent enough for app usage anyway IMO. It would impact the phones performance, and is probably why most manufacturers don't support it yet.
I also suspect that the inherent unreliability of most SD cards (even ones from prominent companies like Sandisk) makes companies reluctant to offer it.

Oh It Doesn't Support Adoptable Storage
But my 2 years Old Samsung Galaxy tab 2 did
I Even Moved Apps To SD Card.
But It Was very unreliable And caused problems 
It got bad to the point where it started Effecting other apps like YouTube 
I Thought it was all my tablets fault but when I removed SD Card It Was stutter Free
Well That Explains why most Companies Doesn't Support It. Even Though I Have a Samsung's​ SD Card.
BTW 
I really appreciate these forums 
They make solving problems For An Average Joe a lot more easier
I really like your Co-operation
THANKS

replies.text: As others have mentioned Honor 8 (and any other Honor device) does not support adoptable storage and moving apps to external storage. Unfortunately there is no good workaround for this. This is the reason I bought 64gb

thread.text:
Glad that you find these forums helpful!
The feature you're referring to on your old Tab 2 is actually not the same as Adoptable Storage. Your Tab 2 was using the older "Move to SD" feature, which only moves a portion of an app to the SD card (usually just a data portion). Adoptable Storage means the SD card is regarded by the device as part of its overall Internal Storage, so technically the entire app can be stored on the card. But the disadvantages include slower performance (since SD read-write speeds are typically slower than for onboard memory) and higher risk of system crash if the card fails (due to the lower quality of SD card memory chips).

So If I Set My Default Location To SD card 
Will It Effect Performance?
If No Should I Do It If I Have 16 GB Samsung's SD CARD?

replies.text: Setting the default location will most likely affect only downloaded files and possibly some data files that certain apps use. If you have a fast SD card, you probably won't notice a significant performance drop. But if you were to use a slower card as Internal Storage on a device that supported Adoptable Storage, you probably would notice poorer app performance, since the app would actually be running off that card.

thread.text:
So At The End
Should I set SD Card as default if I have a Samsung's 16gb SD ? 
Because my phone is already getting pretty full
Setting it as default should be fine. Just remember that SD cards are not completely reliable -- they can fail without notice. Don't use them as your sole storage space for important data.

I Mainly Have Music And Some storage From AAA Titles. AND Social Media but I don't think social Media Will Need A Lot Of Storage. 
I Am In Highschool​ And Don't Have Important Stuff On My Mobile.
Sooooo I Am Going to set default to SD Card
Do you think it will be fine?
Mine is set to default SD, but I have a top of the line card.
Is Samsung's good enough?
Which one, they have different classes.

I Do not Know
But It's An Orange One.
I got It With 1 Year Warranty
That should be as good as anything, it's a class 10 grade 1 card.
Thanks!

title: Need some feedback. Contemplating going back to exclusive apple. Help me figure it out

thread.text:
So I love my Honor 8 and my Media Pad 3 but I've been feeling the urge to walk away and go back to Apple which I was exclusive to up until a little over a year and half ago. Since then I've come a long way in the Android world. I even won a contest here that I had no idea I was even competing in for my articles or posts. So in a short amount of time I've come a long way with Android although I still don't consider EMUI to be anything remotely like Android but they had to place it somewhere which personally I believed it to be a third mobile software option who don't truly like pure Android. I'd probably fall into that category to be honest. Anyways give me some pros and cons of what I should do. I'm riding the fence as of late. I miss being able to text from my tablet or take calls from it. I miss the simplicity of IOS. I know it's not a software one can customize but that isn't a concern of mine. Then there is price point. Apple is so highly priced. I think if my media pad 3 was celluar and I could text from it and take it out and about with me I'd be in a different mindset. So I'm looking for some honest feedback to whether I put it down and walk away from a world I've become quite knowledgeable at or stay with it? Any suggestions or thoughts? Feedback and help is appreciated. 
Don

This won't help you any, but I ordered an iPhone 7 Plus this weekend. I'm sure I'll be back to Android once I get bored with iOs in a few months. For me, switching things up is the fun part of technology nowadays.

+1
It is fun.
Do it Don. If you are really thinking hard about it, that means that your mind isn't at rest. It's not going to go away until you do it. Try it out for a week and see if you'll miss out the features on the Honor 8.
I agree with libra89. There's a reason why it's still on your mind. Go for it and see what happens! You can always switch back if you feel like you miss the experience of the Honor 8.

thread.text: You should buy what you want to work with  There are a TON of people in the AC forums that have iPhones, nothing wrong with that. We also have a lot of overlap, membership wise, with our sister site iMore | Learn more. Be more., which focuses on Apple products.

I have been having the same debate with myself. I like the simplicity of ios and how well it works together. Im waiting to see if the lady at Sprint is actually going to hold the Galaxy s8+ for me on launch day. Would have preordered but they were already on back order through Sprint the day after preorders went live. I didn't feel like paying for a month of service I wasn't going to use(switching carriers to Sprint). If she doesn't hold it for me, I'm going to go for the iPhone 7+ and return my tab s3 and probably pick up the iPad and jump into the apple ecosystem head on again. 
I use to be the guy who would argue Android and Apple. At the end of the day they both do an amazing job. I recommend going to what you feel would work best in your situation.

replies.text: I agree: they're both phenomenal platforms. In some respects, I think Android could learn a thing or two from Apple; and vice versa. Nothing is perfect.  And yes, it all comes down to personal preference and your specific needs.

title: life with out the honor 8

thread.text: I ended up selling my honor 8 and picking up the mate9. Also due to inconsistent billing issues with att I will be switching carriers. Most likely to a cdma carrier, which means no unlocked phones. I hope that us carriers start to actually pay attention to the honor brands and Huawei in general. What I can say is that I don't actually miss either phone. What I miss is emui 4.1. The most solid functioning UI in have used that was distinctly different from all other basic android phones. Then emui 5.0 was just another basic *** UI that copied everything everybody else did. Absolutely no difference from any other UI on the market. Having used LG, Samsung, ZTE, HTC, ASUS AND EMUI 5 all with in 4 months it was clear that emui 5 was just another cookie cutter crap UI. I thought the mate 9 would be different nope same basic samsung UI copy. I guess what I'm getting at is I thought would miss the honor 8 and the mate 9. In the end they have successfully made another copy of the same exact UI that is on every phone ever made that has android running it.

EMUI 4.1 was really good - I liked its innovation. And I think I also had better battery life under 4.1. EMUI 5 is pretty good in my opinion; but yeah, the quality and uniqueness of 4.1 is definitely something to marvel at.

replies.text: Battery life may have taken a bit of a hit, but EMUI 5.0 manages ram better. IMDb used to lag for me on 4.1, now non-existent on 5.0. Also, on 4.1 I consistently had about 2.4 gigs of ram available with no apps open. Now I'm around 2.8/2.9 consistently.

I'm not saying that 5 is bad all I'm saying is that it's 110% not any different from any other Android experience. This forum use to be full of howmnice and refreshing 4.1 is and how well it works. I haven't found one. Probably because there is nothing unique about 5.0 it's just a basic UI that copies what other people have already done 100 times over. They went from innovating to following in a single update.

title: Quickly launch the Honor 8 camera using fingerprint scanner or volume down button

thread.text:
The camera is probably the app you will find yourself using every day and there is no doubt you want to launch the camera app as quickly as possible to capture every moment.
Honor 8 provides two options to quickly launch the camera either using the fingerprint scanner or the volume down key. Let us look at how to configure those options.Using fingerprint scanner
Honor 8's fingerprint scanner also acts as a button and provides options to tie specific actions for a single press, double press, and press & hold. Honor calls this Smart key. You can configure to launch the camera in any one of those options.
This option works when the device is locked or unlocked.
You can access the smart key options in:Settings->Smart assistance->Smart key
Below is an example of configuring double press to open the camera. Using the volume down key when locked
Under camera settings, you can setup Ultra Snapshot setting to open the camera specifically when your device is locked. You can launch the settings by swiping left in the camera app. The Ultra Snapshot uses volume key and you will need to double -press the volume key to open the camera.
Note that this setting only works when the device is locked.
Thank you for this! I need to update my Smart Key functions!

title: Tips to customize the Honor 8

thread.text:
Android has always thrived to offer personalization as one of the key selling factors. You can even take a test from Google to build the right homescreen with recommended links to icon packs, wallpapers and custom launchers.
Not only apps, but phone manufacturers also pack some great customization options in their modified version of android. Before diving into what apps and icon packs to download, it is worthwhile to dive into your phone’s customization settings to make it your own. While those settings may not provide you with great wallpapers and icon packs, they can give you just the things you need to customize the hardware and software options.
In this post, lets take a look at some of the best personalization options available in the Honor 8 smartphone. Honor 8 offers great performance and personalization options in a small yet powerful package. It runs Android 7.0 packed with Huawei’s own Kirin 950 processor, 4GB RAM and dual lens 12 MP rear camera. Honor’s android version is called Emotion UI (EMUI) and has tons of options to customize your device.Note: Huawei and Honor share EMUI and you may notice EMUI options and apps sometimes prefixed with either Huawei or Honor. While there shouldn't be any problems, such apps should work in Honor and Huawei phones but it is always good to check the reviews before you install it.Fingerprint scanner
Fingerprint scanner is probably the most accessed item in your phone. We use it for several things — unlock phones and authenticate for purchases. Honor goes one step further by providing custom button options on the fingerprint scanner. Honor calls it Smart key. Your fingerprint scanner now acts as a button and you can set actions for single press, double press and long press.
I quite enjoy this setup and find it very handy to open my favorite app or launch the camera quickly. You can also setup to show notification panel when you slide down on the scanner.
You can access the smart key options in: Settings->Smart assistance->Smart key
Don’t forget to also look into the fingerprint options to find out more options: Settings->Fingerprint IDKnuckle gestures
Gestures are one of the smart ways to ease clutter in your home screen. Many launchers provide the ability to tie specific actions like opening an app or launching camera to specific gestures.
Honor provides knuckle gestures which as it name goes, you use your knuckle to do the desired action. 
For example:
- I can tap twice using my knuckle to take a screenshot
- I can use two knuckles to quickly start screen recording
- I can draw (specific, but limited) letters to open specific apps
I use these gestures everyday and enjoy every moment of it! Here is an example of me using the knuckle gesture to open calculator app by drawing the letter C.
You can access the knuckle gestures options in: Settings->Smart assistance->Motion control->Knuckle gesturesMagazine unlock
Lets get it out, lockscreens are boring. You see the same wallpaper every day and there is nothing you can feel happy about it other than getting notifications from your loved ones.
Well, with the magazine unlock option you can now configure and subscribe to dynamic wallpaper collections so that a new wallpaper is set for the lockscreen every time you turn on your phone.*
The wallpapers are beautiful coming from the Leica photography collection. You will start loving your lockscreen as you see a beautiful image when you turn on your phone.
Below are some screenshots of my honor 8 lockscreen:
You can access the magazine unlock options in: Settings->Screen lock and passwords->Lock screen->Magazine unlock
Make sure you have set your screen lock style as Magazine unlock.Themes
While there is no official app to download and set themes for Honor 8, there are plenty of themes and apps available in the Play Store to theme your Honor 8. One such app is Huawei Theme Manager which allows you to download themes for your Honor 8. Final thoughts
Its quite amazing how these simple options make using your phone easier. They make your mundane daily tasks easily accessible. 
Thanks to Android, phone manufacturers are able to provide such options for their users.
Wow! This is really thorough. Definitely like the gifs for the gestures and examples. Good job!
Thank you for this! Will delve into this soon!

title: Fingerprint sensor not working well after nougat update

thread.text:
I came from a galaxy S7 edge to the Honor 8 back in November and the thing that impressed me the most was the speed and accuracy of the fingerprint sensor. I found it to be far quicker and more responsive. I also really liked the gesture abilities, particularly the swipe down for notifications. At first I didn't really get this feature, but grew to really appreciate it. 
However, I've had major issues since the nougat update. Now my fingerprint sensor is considerably slower, but even more frustrating is that the swipe down for notifications only works about once every five times I try it. Used to work perfectly every time. Anyone else experiencing this? Really hope it's just a bug and will get fixed with a minor update soon.
Sometimes I think I notice a lag with my fingerprint scanner, but I'm always unsure if it's "just me." Perhaps this is a bug that will be fixed with ensuing updates.

There is a known bug that after you unlock your phone the fingerprint sensor won't work for gestures - swipe down. There is no workaround for it so far other than to just press once and then it will start working.
It all works for me. On the B380 update
Mine had a serious lag today - it stopped working for a few seconds. But it seems to be working well now.

title: Calendar not opening after update

thread.text: After 5.0, calender doesn't open and crashes every time. This seems to be specific to calender as installing Google calender also behaves same. Tried deleting system cache but that didn't help. Any suggestions?
Mine works. I have the B380 update, but I had been using my calendar before the update too.

Yes, mine's been working fine as well... In my experience with calendar and mail apps that kind of behavior is due to some kind of database corruption.
In my case all my calendar items are stored in the cloud - either google calendar or Exchange. So for me, I would probably just clear calendar data - settings/apps/calendar/storage/clear data. However if you can't lose your calendar appointments / aren't certain that you have them stored somewhere in the cloud or don't back up your settings you might not want to try that.
I tried deleting data on the calender app too but no luck.

replies.text: $180 is not typical. It's more like $250 average majority of the time. I would love to have that 5.9 screen for my second device as my larger phone but I'm not paying $180 nor $250 for the screen difference. Battery helps too for sure but let's face it other than performance, these are two totally different phones that targets two totally different buyers in terms of overall marketability. So the segment of the market for a 5.9 in screen, market value may suggest or demand this price point where as a 5.2 inch smaller phone my demand or reflect marketability of much cheaper which I believe plays a pretty large factor here. I know there is no $180 nor $250 marketability supported difference in performance between the two so it's a apple compared to an orange and one side of the market expects the apple to run around price A. The other, the orange, the market who prefers to eat it over the apple expects to pay a price around price B. That right there is the only way to support the price difference bc performance isnt really a factor that is different enough to really come into play. On paper there isn't $250 dollars worth of difference but in the real world market expectations, there is. Has nothing to do with supply and demand either. Just pure marketability no different than what I do every day for living which is appraise residential homes based up on one of the factors of its marketability. Typically larger demands a higher price than smaller in just about all tangible items. So there you have it. This is the exact reason there is a rough average of $180 to $250 price difference which is totally market driven. One other factor here that doesn't come into play yet is brand name demand. Majority of mobile phone users could not tell you one thing about Huawei or Honor like they could Samsung and Motorola. It's simply what I've described to be the difference that determines the two different prices. Sorry that's technical but it's the honest truth and is a market driven fact.

The Mate 9 is also a better phone in every way including performance, if you do heavier stuff like photo/video editing on Lapse It/PS or even just saving recordings/audio in everyday karaoke apps you'll find Kirin 960 really is much faster processing wise compared to the SD821 or Kirin 950. Tech Zilla has a video comparing video processing speeds in Lapse It and the Kirin 960 is the fastest Android SOC. Better screen, performance, SOC esp. GPU, speakers, software (as of now), cameras, dual SIMs, mics, battery life, charging speeds etc., there is also a generation difference between the two, is it worth the 180 extra for all the upgrades? I think so.

I've had the Honor 8 for a few weeks with no issues. Tonight I'm having issues connected to WiFi. I'm about 2 feet from the router and things are loading either real slow or not at all. 
Speed test is all over the place and most of time it fails to upload anything during test. I have an iPhone and that is testing out fine with no issues.
I've done every trick in the book, reset phone, hard reset, reset router, forgot WiFi network and rejoined, switched airplane mode on/off, etc. 
I did use airplane mode for the first time yesterday but WiFi was working afterwords.
Anyone else have this issue?

Update: when the phone is a foot away from router it works fine. 3 feet or more and nothing.
Also tried switching to the 2.4 band on the router and still nothing.

replies.text:
Judging from your description it sounds like the internal antenna the problem. It's basically just a wire that extends along one side of your phone so maybe it became disconnected from the motherboard, which account for why you can get a WiFi connection holding your phone close to your router but not when you're farther away.
The pic is taken from this Honor 8 teardown site:Huawei Honor 8 Teardown | MyFixGuide.com
Not very familiar with Huawei phones but most Samsung phones just have a press-fit connector for the antennas. Looking at the above pic it 'appears' that maybe it instead is using a solder joint.
A lot of phones use a single antenna for both WiFi and Bluetooth, perhaps you're also having issues with Bluetooth that started around the same time as this WiFi connectivity issue?

thread.text: I just picked up a Motorola Moto z Play unlocked and tested the WiFi speeds next to each other in 4 different locations in my house and the Moto z Play was consistently about 8 to 10 MB higher on download speeds and about 5 MB higher on uploads. So maybe it is the antenna Huawei uses in the Honor 8. It's still good enough though.

I did a factory reset this morning( I've been holding out on doing this as this phone has so much bloatware initially) and it seems as the wifi is back. 
The clock was messed up showing one hour ahead after the reset but after toggling Auto date/time it looks to be back to normal.
Had really good things to say about this phone coming from Nexus devices but now im not sure.

title: Honor 8 after Nougat update - mini review

thread.text:
Reading this forum the last few weeks, it seems like I might be one of few that actually enjoy the update and EMUI 5.0. So, here are my quick thoughts on Honor 8 after the nougat update.
- Fingerprint scanner is faster. I notice before the update, there would be a split second delay with the scanner. It was accurate, but little slow. Now, there is no delay. It's almost OnePlus 3 fast, which to me is the fastest fingerprint scanner I've experience to date.
- Camera is also faster. Again, this was another area which was annoying. The picture quality was fine, but I always thought the shutter speed was slow. Again, a split second delay. But after nougat, shutter speed feels more acceptable. Not S7 Edge or OnePlus fast, but much better than before. 
- Before the update, I was using Nova Launcher, because I really needed the app drawer. I can't stand having all the apps on the home page and then have to create folders to organize them. This is more of a personal preference, but now that the app drawer is an option, I have not needed to use Nova. 
- Battery life has not been as good. But I'm wondering if it's because of Google Assistant. I just turned that off, so we'll see if the battery life improves. On 4.1, I had about 3 hours of SOT with about 30-35% still left when I went to bed. Now, I'm down to 10-15% with similar SOT and usage. So, I'm really hoping turning off Google Assistant makes a difference.
- To be honest, I'm not a big fan of stock android. I enjoy the various skins OEM puts on their phones. Some do it well and others don't, but for most part, I enjoy the features they add to android. But I am definitely not a fan of iOS. I thought 4.1 was little too much iOS, but the overall package of the phone was great enough for me to overlook that. With 5.0, it feels more android. 
- I'm also getting that weird audio error message, but it doesn't seem to affect the actual recording of the video. Just annoying that it shows up.
Overall, I thought this was a great upgrade. For me Honor 8 now feels like a complete package. YMMV.

That audio error message pops up if Google assistant/the Google app has "Okay Google" turned on from any screen. Turn off that setting and the message goes away (though obviously the phone will no longer respond to the command unless you are in the Google app).

UW,
My experience with battery life is the same as yours. It is not quite as good as before. 
Also, i like the update too. I like the notifications better even though I didn't think the EMUI 4.1 notifications were bad. The return to the normal android task switcher is a plus and android 7.0 features such as double tapping the recents menu to switch to the last app you used is super handy and one that i use almost every day.
The layout of the settings app is much better than before. Under EMUI 4.1, the battery/power settings were buried under the advanced settings. In addition, under EMUI 4.1 if you plugged in your phone at night, when the alarm went off in the morning, the dismiss/snooze control wouldn't appear on the lock screen because of a notification that your phone is plugged in and charging. That annoying behavior does not appear in EMUI 5.0.
I don't know why Huawei/Honor felt like they had to change the share menu from the stock share menu but it is at least visually appealing.
Again, I agree that it is a great update.

replies.text: I'm on 4.1, plug my phone in when I go to bed. Snooze my alarm every morning. I cant remember a time when I wasn't able to snooze it while plugged in.

thread.text: Glad you are liking your device and the new update!

It just has a completely different feel altogether. I don't feel like I'm using a basic Android phone with 4.1. With 5.0 it looks and feels and acts just like Samsung, LG, HTC, ZTE and ever other basic *** phone UI ever created on planet Earth.

thread.text:
So, whether you like 4.1 or not, you should be aware of the issues with 4.1 which are discussed a lot in this forums and other forums.
On a serious note, EMUI 4.1 doesn't really do a good job on making this phone special. Its notification management, rude battery management policies (like blocking all apps except what honor "deems" good for background updates) and a huge drift from normal Android UX are some notorious issues that plagues EMUI 4.1.
While some users love the "not being android UX", it doesn't help Honor to sell more, at least here in the US market. This is to not say "dont change the UX, keep stock". Its about some of the common elements like notification management and recent apps etc.,
While I was happy with 4.1, I wouldn't push myself to go downgrade when I have seen how beautiful EMUI 5 makes this phone!

I had way way way way more issues with battery management in 5.0. I had to turn of the power intensive notification it popped up ever single time I opened my phone. It really sucks being able to choose a power profile designed for heavy gaming. Even Samsung added that into nougat while Huawei dropped it from emui. 
The best part of emui 4.1 is was it was so vastly different. While harnessing the power of Android but not making it feel like another crap implementation of the same basic UI that every other company uses with every phone that has Android. 
5.0 is an exact copy of what ever other company has done there is absolutely nothing different about it or any other Android phone.

title: Anyone else having trouble with Honor 8 answering calls while it's in your pocket?

thread.text:
Last couple of days this started happening. It's odd because I haven't changed any settings and it never happened before. Any ideas? I don't even hear the phone ring.
Edit: raise to ear to answer and press volume button to answer are both off. Touch and hold fingerprint to answer is on, but I don't see how that could happen in my pocket.
Nope. Check settings->smart assistance to make sure that touch-disable mode is ON.

replies.text: That's the funny thing, it's on!
Hmm, how odd. Glove mode is off too?(...wow 1k posts. Oh how I love this phone.)

thread.text: I had the same thing happen yesterday. Touch-disable mode was on, raise to ear was on, press volume button to answer was off. In looking around settings, I see that raise to ear to answer shows up in two spots, so I am going to make to turn both off for now.

Yep, glove mode off libra89. And good idea Joel Malone, I'll double check that. I suspect it's just two different paths to the same setting, but worth shot.
Edit: Now turned off in two places. Thanks Joel Malone for the idea--even though I'd seen the two different settings, it never occurred to me to they might not match. Odd, but hopefully it does the trick.

Phew, crisis averted. After half an hour or so of scrambling around my phone settings (I've been using android for a long time, I know my way around the settings VERY well), I found the culprit wasn't even an Honor smart feature. In the android accessibility menu, I somehow had "Raise to ear to answer" turned on. Apparently on the Honor 8 (and maybe more android phones? I'll have to do some testing), this setting only watches the proximity sensor and not the proximitey sensor AND the accelerometer. The Honor's smart motion feature "Raise to ear to answer calls" watches both sensors and works properly. OP, go to Settings->Advanced Settings->Accessibility and make sure the "Raise to ear to answer" settings is switched off!
