title: Android OS is using a lot of data while locked and screen off

thread.text:
My phone was on 4.1 and i upgraded it to 5 a week ago
I have data saver on
I have removed all custom application
I have "keep mobile data on when sleeping" in the battery setting to OFF
I did a cache wipe
I have tried to turn off all and every setting that could use data
Android OS still use data...
anyone know what is going on?

Yeah, I've been experiencing that too.
I literally turn off data, 4g, gps, wifi, and also the keep mobile data on when sleeping off
but over the night, my honor uses like.. 30% of battery for some reason,
I really don't understand.
All app usages are < 1amh, so calculation doens't make sense to use up almost 30%.
Google+ and Hangout turns on for some reason as well, but other than that,
I just don't see why it uses so much battery
Also, the Wifi and Mobile Data bar in the battery management is just always on.
So,, yeah No idea what the problem could be

Likewise. Just did a factory reset and early returns are promising for battery life, but it's only been a day. I'll let you know if it really does improve battery life, in case that's something you all would consider.
Well, battery still draining fast post reset.

Has the exact same issue. I went into mobile data under settings.
Painfully I went through all apps under data and LTE usage and made sure only wifi could access. You have to select each item and scroll down to see what each app is using data wise. Google mail has mobile/background and roaming. I turned off all three and did the same for Google fit and so on. Why is each app set to roam is beyond me. 
Once I did this I rebooted my phone and checked the settings. Since then my data usage has dropped a ton. I was using 7 to 11 MB per day plugged in at home on wifi. That's crazy. Now I'm using about 850kb to 1MB a little higher to 3MB is I leave the house. Hope this helps. You may have already done this but who knows it may help.

title: Poor battery life when streaming audio

thread.text:
For the past two days I've been streaming fair to moderate with Pulsar (local), Soma FM (4G), and Pocketcast (Wifi) and it must be the biggest battery sucker of any daily activities. Until now I've been pleased with the battery life - I can usually go two days before having to charge it. Now the battery is in the 30s at the end of the day which is twice as bad as it used to be. My SoT today was only 1hr24min, and since I believe this phone could max out at 4hrs it's really egregious to see it vanquished by music. While I don't know if I am actually listening to music longer this is the first time the battery has been a problem.
Then again, if there's one thing I've learned, restarting solves 99% of Android problems.
So did restarting fix the problem? What do your battery stats say? which app is using the most battery?

How was your network signal during streaming? If you were in a bad reception area that could explain the excess drain. If you can try to switch from streaming to downloading to a SD card. I have music downloaded to the SD card through Amazon prime (Google play also works). This hardly affects battery life compared to streaming over network or wifi.

It does sound like you may have poor optimisation on your apps access to data and your battery settings not killing apps properly. 
Today I have had over 3hrs screen on time by 50%

I did restart, but battery is still hit and miss. Today 10 hours after unplugging it's at 40% after listening mainly from an SD card. My LTE signal is 2-3 bars where I work but I even toggled it on and off when I wasn't using data. I don't know if any of the apps are known to be power-hungry (mAh ranges fro 50-150) or if it's abnormal.

Hi
Same for me with Pocketcast. Absolute battery killer. I changed to BeyondPod and it cut the power consumption level by half. I have a Pixel XL and don't get this probelm.

My battery has never been as good as it once was and I've come to the conclusion it's most likely two things which will or should fall in line with your case too. One, we've all used our phones now day in day out for a while now. I believe a battery takes a while to settle in and find its typical normalcy mark (after heavy regular based usage) and two, like one of the posters said, App consumption. Even if I think I've shut all my power consuming Apps down, they end up reopening and remain to run in the background which pulls from battery life. That said, the honor 8 I'd still consider to be above average even though it doesn't appear to as good as it once was. Overall with most of us using our phones daily heavy usage we all still get a decent and above average battery life I think. I just know I'm charging my honor 8 much more often than I used to have to. I used to get my best battery performance when I hovered between 75 percent to 85 percent but now it even drains from my old optimal level. It's two fold. One being us the user and two, being the phone and how it is consuming the battery life. The only sure fire way to fix it is wipe the phone factory fresh and load the bare minimum of apps and you'll see a much better overall battery life but then where is the fun in that limiting oneself of apps that you typically keep on your phone whether they see daily use or not. I'm just dealing with mine and have accepted that it's both of those factors that come into play.

title: Honor 8: How to keep an app from shutting down?

thread.text:
Hello. I have a few important apps that I'd like to keep running always. There is one application that won't stay running in the background, and I do not receive the notifications that are crucial unless the app window is open / in recently used applications.
Phone is Honor 8, with Emui 4.1. Android 6.0. I have enabled auto launch for applications by PM Plus by Huawei.
On Settings / Apps / App info / Notifications everything is enabled: "Allow notifications", "Priority Display". Notification methods are all enabled: "Status bar", "Banners", "Lock screen".
On Settings / Apps / App info / Battery / Detailed power info / Settings: "Power intensive prompt" is off. "App auto-launch" is on. "Keep running after screen off" is on.
On Settings / Advanced settings / Battery manager / Protected apps this application is Protected.
On Phone Manager app / App auto-launch the settings for this app are "Launch in background". Some other apps have also "Launch with system, launch in background". (I don't know where I could enable this problem app to also "launch with system", but it doesn't seem to be a solution since I don't have to reboot my phone in order to stop getting notifications from this app.)
On Settings / Developer options / Running services / Show cached processes there is a "cached background process" for this app while it's visibly running. It disappears immediately after I've closed the app, and there's nothing else running that'd be obviously related to the app.

title: What doesn't work in Honor 8/EMUI?

thread.text:
There are lots of threads that talks about the good things but I wanted to start a thread that captures features that doesn't work with Honor 8. Idea is not to thrash but have a gentle discussion around areas we all find problems with. Maybe we could send this to Honor as well.
Let me start the list:TMobile VoLTE does not work with Honor 8
You can't call other TMobile phones if you have VoLTE calls enabled in your Honor 8. I have heard very few say they can, but it doesn't work for many others too.Google Voice does not integrate with Native EMUI Dialer
This seems to be widespread with devices using EMUI - Huawei and Honor. When you have set up the dialer to route calls to Google Voice, you get an error saying "Call not sent". Workaround is that you will have to open the Google Voice app and dial the number you wish. This is a real pain, as I always have the international numbers router through Google Voice.Cannot set an encryption password
Encryption is enabled, as it is now for any android device since Android 6.0, but Honor 8 does not allow you to set up a boot password to further protect your device.

It seems to be flaky. It works for some and it doesn't for some. I am also part of the TMobile Digits beta which could have caused this. TMobile said they are investigating and I have not heard anything back yet.

title: Renamed download files don't appear in gallery integration.

thread.text:
When I rename files in my downloads folder, they don't appear in the download section of the gallery integration menu, and the old filename persists with no thumbnail.. 
Has anyone else experienced this issue, and if so have you found a solution.

This isn't a direct answer, but how about using your file manager app to copy or move the downloaded pics to a separate directory (like the Pictures directory)? That should show up in the Gallery app.
I always find it a little risky to keep important files in the Downloads directory, because some phones have apps or features that might automatically clean out the Downloads directory intermittently, if you're not fully aware of the settings.

I do move them. But I when I collect some images, I have to I rename them before I upload them to a hosting service, and the default folder that opens in the gallery integration menu when I click to upload is the downloads folder. 
Just frustrating to have to go through nearly 10 extra steps instead of just renaming them.
How are you renaming the files -- using a file manager app, or using Windows Explorer while connected via USB, or some other way?
I rename them in the stock files app
Have you already tried restarting the phone to trigger the media scan? Are you using an SD card?

My phone powers off every night. And yes I am using an SD card. The issue only occurs when an app other than the gallery or files app accesses this feature. It's really odd. I work around it, but it bugs me because it is the only problem I have with the phone.
See what happens if you connect the phone to your computer via USB and use Windows Explorer to change the filename. Or try a 3rd party file manager app, like Total Commander.
I have started using the recent option instead of the downloads option in the menu, seems to work. I don't want to be plugging the phone into something every time I change file names.
It might still be worth testing out a 3rd party file manager app, in case this is a quirk of the stock file manager. The one I mentioned above is free and ad-free.

Glad to hear it! I have been very impressed with this phone's battery life and radios. Awesome that you have had a solid experience! I have gotten almost 8 hours running it all the way down to the end lol.
I sold my pixel recently and pixel is definitely a great phone but honor 8 has way better battery life. I think kirin 950 chipset battery efficiency is awesome.

I think my battery might not be as good as it was when I got it about two months ago, but it's still really good - especially compared to my other Android phones/experiences. It's rare that I ever have it down to less than 25% at the end of the day, even with heavier use (ie, Netflix, web browsing, Facebook, a few calls). I'm very happy with the experience. And the quick charging makes my life so much easier. I love never having to worry about only having a half hour to leave my apartment and my phone won't charge fast enough.

Coming from an Exynos S7E, I knew battery life would take a hit and so far I'm not that impressed with it. I've been using the phone since 2 days and managed to get only 3 hours SOT on Nougat. I don't have any special settings to minimize battery drain, though I do turn off NFC/Bluetooth/Wi-Fi when not in use. I'll give it a few more days until I decide to stick with the Honor 8 or go back to the S7E.
My battery life is not as good since the 7.0 Nougat Emui 5.0 update, and I used the phone for a week straight before coming to this conclusion.

This.

My second working day today and battery life is still bad for me

Unfortunately with Android, it is difficult to point the culprit in battery department. It is mostly one or more rogue apps that may be accounting to your bad battery life. So ensure that is indeed the case.
If everything fails, I would recommend a hard reset or factory reset, use the phone from 100% to 0% before you charge again. That will certainly help.
The phone was reset after receiving Nougat.
Not unless you go in and turn on the option.

Unfortunately 3 hours of SOT did not cut it for me, I'm back to my Exynos S7 Edge. I'm a pretty heavy user and S7 Edge almost makes the 5.5 hour SOT with my usage pattern. The Honor 8 is listed on the marketplace.

title: Wi-Fi suddenly slow on my Honor 8

thread.text:
Hi
I bought my honor 8 two months ago, and it was working fine until this morning. The internet through the wi-fi connection suddenly became slow. It works for my girlfriend's phone, and both of our laptops, and my phone works fine in other wi-fi networks. This problem is only with our home wi-fi. I checked the speed with speedtest app, and after about two minutes of waiting, it showed the right speed, but surfing is painfully slow.
I did a hard reset on the router, and a cache wipe on my phone, but did not hard reset my phone, because it works on other wi-fi networks. 
So my question is: what do you think is the problem?
Thank you for your answers!
I'd try rebooting the phone (not resetting) or resetting your home wifi router (unplug wait 10 seconds then plug back in)

I'm OP
Thank you, but I already rebooted my phone several times, and even did a cache wipe, and I already rebooted, and resetted the router several times, and still no luck.
Do you have Wi-Fi+ enabled or disabled on the phone?
Disabled. I always disable my mobile data and enable wi-fi manually when I get home, because my mobile data isn't unlimited.

Are you connected at 2.4 or 5G?
Sometimes a 5G connection will slow the internet over Wi-Fi.
2.4G, and it was good until this morning, and I haven't changed any settings since yesterday.

I'll ask around and see if another 8 user has the answer.
Maybe someone in Honor 8 forum can figure out what's happening.
Mod note. Thread moved to the Honor 8 fórum.
Try getting your phone to "forget" your network and add it again. Or if you can access your router interface, remove your device from the routers device list and then reconnect.

Do you have a router that has dual band and smart connection feature which switches band automatically for a device based on its usage? 
It could also be a router problem.

My router only has one band, and I didn't find anything about smart connection in the settings, so I guess it doesn't have that feature. Also I did a hard reset on my phone out of frustration, and it didn't help.
This is a general guide but perhaps it can helphttps://www.google.com/amp/forums.an...ems.html%3Famp

Thank you, but my problem is that the connection is slow on my phone, not that I can't connect. And It was good until yesterday, and no settings have been changed. That's why I don't have a clue about what's the problem.

Thank you for all your advices, but I honestly tried everything. I hard resetted my router and phone, I went through all the settings, and still the same. At this point I'm just waiting for a miracle.

Hi, how did you fix the issue? my phone have the same issue started a couple weeks ago. The wifi is very slow or totally can not open a webpage after a while, while the connection is good, and other devices work very well meanwhile.

I don't know if this will help, but the same thing happened on my Sony tablet, can't find a solution (tried factory reset etc). Also happens occasionally on my Honor. Only solution is to turn the WiFi on the device off and then back on. That helps for a few hours. My guess is that the issue is with Android in general, not related to the device, because the issues on my tablet started when I updated to Marshmallow and Honor came with it.

replies.text:
Okay guys I've gotten my update a couple of days ago now and I'm pleased to say that it's still very much EMUI all the way. Few tweaks here and there but it's definitely to me still not Android nor IOS. EMUI is its own software interface and I assume either you love it or dislike it. In no way does it remind me of anything like real Android which is why it's very strong enough to be branded it's own EMUI name and offered to the masses as a new and fresh third mobile software option to Android and IOS. I can tell you I'd pick this over Android or IOS any day of the week. It's unique refreshing interface is something none of the industry as seen before and I believe it why it has gotten criticized at times because it is just that much different. However it's still a mobile software and the layout is no different than Android or IOS. No way around a mobile software general layout. What is different about it is it's user interface and the experience and totally unique to it own feedback the user gets from it. Even if you throw a launcher on it, it still very much EMUI which to me isn't Android nor IOS. It can be branded easily to compete with both and as well it should be. I know with certainty that EMUI if branded would have its own market share or followed, supporters and users. It's just that strongly different. 
No problems here with my update as I can tell it Nougat a bit which personally I'm not a huge fan of but I'm especially glad I still have what I know and have become to absolutely love, EMUI.
Fantastic.
Thanks!
So glad you got it and that it's tweaked to your liking!
Not too bad at all. I was mainly worried that EMUI was going to turn into Android. It didn't change so that's the main thing. It's definitely still EMUI.
Agreed! It's still unique and I'm really enjoying it!
Nice! Finally someone who doesn't see Android but rather EMUI as I do. I thought I was alone in that world.

Haha, no you are not! I see it as a totally unique experience, for sure. It's made me re-examine my future of smartphone usage - I may stick with Honor/Huawei from here on out! We'll see! In the meantime, I'm loving my Honor 8.

title: Has anyone had a problem installing software since the Nougat/EMUI upgrade?

thread.text:
Hey,
Several months ago I purchased the board game humble bundle, which includes several small phone versions of popular board games. It is not on the Play store. I set my phone to allow from sources not on the play store (or however it's worded). Click the downloaded file to install, but the "Next" button to install the program is not "clickable." 
I read in a few places that using a "screen filter" app will make this happen. I'm not using any, though, other than what's already included in our phones. About the only non-standard thing I'm using is that I am using a theme. I AM running Nova launcher, but no luck either through Nova or when I go back to the Huawei launcher. 
I feel like I'm not doing a good job explaining myself, but does this make sense? Is anyone else having this problem? Otherwise I'm really liking the improvements since the update.
Had a small issue using avast, but install via Google app verification instead.

UPDATE--I figured it out. I changed from the downloaded theme I was using to one of the "standard" ones that came out with the update. Everything worked fine. Not sure why, but I'm putting it here for the sake of people that might be googling to find an answer to the issue. 
The launcher didn't make a difference, but the awesome all black theme I had on was keeping me from being able to "click" to continue on the installation screen. It wasn't pressable.

title: Occasional shut down during phone calls

thread.text:
Hi all, 
Had this phone since November 16 and for the most part I'm very happy with it. 
But twice now I've been on a phone call and the phone has just died for no reason. I had plenty of battery, but the phone just turns off and I can't restart it just using the power button, I have to do a hard reset. 
Now, it has only done it twice so it isn't the end of the world, but one of the times was during a telephone interview so not ideal.
Just wondering if any one else has had this issue at all? 
Thanks!
That sounds like loose hardware connections. Possibly being shaken by sound from the call, you should get a replacement.

replies.text: I've never heard of that before! I guess the difficulty is proving that its an issue as it doesn't happen every time.

thread.text: Oh no, I'm so sorry that happened to you during a telephone interview! As stated above, I'd aim to get a replacement device. Keep us updated!

title: Okay guys my update is finally here. One specific question to all who have updated

thread.text: Will I still have what I know to be EMUI if I update. Does that make sense. I guess I'm asking is it still the EMUI league of its own category software or is it a tweaked out version of Android now? Please let me know bc I pushed my upgrade at 1 percent as I want to be sure I'm not about to get a totally Android like software. EMUI is uniquely different but in a strong enough good way to actually be considered its own category type software. Am I forced to use the app drawer. Does the interface change in terms of how seamless EMUI is? Has it turned choppy or like block letters pure Android? Please let me know before I hit resume. Thanks to all for your input. It's definitely needed here and definitely appreciated. Big time.

Seriously though, whether EMUI 4 or 5, it is a customized version of Android. 
All the new things are configurable. Honor has improved quite a bit in the user interface and it's a beauty to use. 
That said, it is up to you to upgrade and use it to see the differences. There are plenty of videos in YouTube too to check out.

replies.text: Much appreciated. I honestly don't think it at all favors stock Android interface wise. Maybe it's compatible but similar not in the least and I owned a Nexus 6p and tow Moto Zs such all those models are pretty close to stock Android. EMUI is remotely nothing like stock Android. I maybe alone here but it's worthy to be offered and branded as compatible only with Android but not Android interface or similar software in general. It's just that different but good though.

thread.text: It's still not like stock android, more a case of improved notifications and streamlined settings menu. The improvements are nearly all geared towards usability, and you get Nougat features that you won't have on 4.1 like split screen.

replies.text: Sounds good man. Thanks. I appreciate the feedback. For some reason I thought 4.1 was killer. Hopefully I'll be good with it and to honest if not I'll just get used to it. I won't downgrade back. It's about 90 percent uploaded now. Takes a while I see. I still think at least the 4.1 EMUI version was nothing at all like true Android and that it was basically a totally separated software all together. I don't think many agree with me but I found EMUI to not remottlety be anything like my Nexus 6p at all what so ever. If anything closer to IOS so it makes me think it really could have been branded and marketed as just what it is. EMUI alone not being Android nor IOS but only compatible with Android usage. To me it's that strongly different. I guess I'm the only one who thinks this but it's simply not anything like Android other than the ability to use the play store for apps. Thats all.
I would say that emui 5 is much closer to stock, but not stock by any means

thread.text: Actually I was just typing a good post and it crashed right in the middle of my post. However and like I was saying it's nowhere remotely near pure Android. If anything EMUI is a hybrid software of both major versions anyway. It could definitely hold its own if branded and offered as a true software choice bc I maybe the only one who see it but EMUI isn't Android at all what so ever. It's only compatible with Android apps and Android type outside related software. EMUI could easily be branded and offered as an alternative to IOS or Android pure. Put it this way. If it was seriously near Android all together I'd not be using it and loving it bc I never was a overly huge pure Android fan like I was with IOS and EMUI offers a user something totally different than both major choices. It's compatible with Android and that's as close to Android as it gets. I strongly believe this.

replies.text: It's a hybrid design, not hybrid software. There is no IOS code, only android with UI modifications.

It's just quite different is I guess what I'm saying. Different enough to be it's owned branded software. I know I'd pick it over pure Android and in your face IOS. I love it. How ever it's deemed. So far my update really isn't much different. Things seem more crisp for some reason. Anyone else notice this just on the home screen. Seems like the resolution is higher. Overall it's fine. It's different here or there but not enough to bother me. I'm okay with it.

thread.text: The dpi is different to 4.1, that may be why it looks more crisp. Also, the battery saving low resolution is done by the software when appropriate instead of being always low.
The white notifications remind me of iOS. Looks just like sons iPhone. Some things seem larger than before. MM or 4.1 seemed a little more minimalistic than Nougat or 5.1. Overall no complaints.

I'm glad that the app drawer is a feature you can turn off, as I am actually quite happy without it! Though EMUI still resembles Android in some ways, I like to think that it is still a unique software experience and a fresh, new take on the Android OS.

replies.text: Other than general layout, the actual real user interface meaning the way it feels and how the user experience is real world isn't Android like at all to me. Android or true Android has a totally different feel or real world feel interface. This software isn't anything like Android nor IOS. The only Android thing is possibly has is it's layout but a layout is just that and even iOS and Android both have similar overall layouts. No way around that for any mobile software. EMUI is totally unique to the mobile software real world user interface. This is why it could easily be branded as a third option rather easily in my opinion. If you sat a true Android in front of me and than SAT EMUI next to it and I did the same exact function on both devices you'd get totally different user experience of interface feeling. So I only see the layout to be the only similar facet to be Android. I maybe the only one but I strongly believe EMUI could hold its own easily being branded and released to the masses as a third option to choose from with in the mobile software world. There is a reason a bunch of us are using this Honor 8 over a other tweaked versions of Android. I've tried them all and even the totally tweaked out versions of Android you can tell right away it's an Android product. EMUI gives me zero Android feel feedback. To me it's only compatible with Android and is easily strong enough to be branded and offered to the masses as option 3 instead of only 2 options for a mobile device.

It is actually the right build for the right model you have. Folks who are comfortable finding this information have shared the response codes for all the models. It is just that you are requesting it manually from the official servers earlier rather than being pushed at a certain bucket. The only thing you get into is that you may have some early bugs. Yes, if you request the update for a different model than your model, you just install a different build and does not bring/corrupt your phone down. You can easily rollback to EMUI 4.0 build from the instructions available in Honor site for your specific model.
Of course, this is not for normal folks and I would recommend to wait in that case.

right build or not... it hasn't been pushed to your phone yet. If you try to update other than through an approved method then honor would be within their legal rights to deny warranty.
Granted it is unlikely to have any problems and honor may honor warranty repairs regardless.... Just that it is a risk.

It's 'called' Android because it is android. The core and Base programming is android with a different UI over it. The underlying processes are android.

title: Notification problems with clock and lock screen

thread.text: I have two problems that suddenly arose just today. One, my clock in the notification shade is frozen - it changes sometimes but I don't know when - but the clocks on the lock screen and the widget work fine. Two, I cannot interact with any lockscreen notifications, like pausing media or opening an email. I've had EMUI 5 since the 13th. How on earth do I solve these bugs?

For lock screen:
Go to settings -> Notifications & status bar
1) Select Notifications management
2) Click on the gear settings icon on the top right
3) Select your option for what to do when device is locked

title: [EMUI 5/Nougat Tips] Enable Split Screen gesture

thread.text:
As you already know, Honor 8 supports knuckle gestures that you can configure in the settings. A new addition to this gesture is the ability to enter split screen mode in Nougat.
You can now use your knuckle and draw a line to enter this split screen mode. Pretty handy in many cases.

title: WiFi calling is coming.....

thread.text:

title: Thread for 5.0 withdrawal symptoms!

thread.text: If you need help coping with your 5.0 withdrawal symptoms please post your concerns here. No appointment is needed. I'll address each of you the best I can and together we will rise above this crisis and make it through to the other side . So please let it out here. Don't be shy and let me hear your needs. My skill sets are specialized in this sort of problem that a select few Honor 8 owners are having to deal with. It's not easy and know you aren't alone. This can easily get you down and ruin your day if you aren't taught how to properly cope and manage the symptoms of atypical 5.0 syndrome. I'm here to help. title: Honor 8 size

In my unending research for a new phone, I found this site that makes it super easy to compare phone sizes.Phone Arena Size Comparison Tool
You can compare the size of all the phones you're interested in. Not exactly the same as holding them in real life but it does give you an idea of what holding each phone would be like. You can also calibrate the page so the sizes match up exactly.

title: Group Interview with George Zhao, President of Honor

thread.text: Wasn't sure what forum to place this in but to all those interested here's a link to an interview with the President of Honor. It's a quick read.Group Interview with George Zhao, President of Honor
I see an honor 9 mentioned in there.
Interesting, thanks for sharing.
Interesting read. Thanks for sharing
Interesting for sure. Thanks for sharing.
Thank you for the article!
Thanks for posting!

Very good article and very interesting too. He clearly states that Honor is its own identity basically. Plus he referenced that Huawei would be the ones who would be picked up by major carriers. Although reading his statement and owning an Honor 8 vs all the other high end flagships ive tested leads me to still believe that we will see at least one or two Honor devices carried by the major carriers. I'm just not totally buying that they will solely rely on e-commerce or online sales only for revenue. Not when there is an open door to bring them more customers which is another statement he makes about targeting age groups and introducing Honor to more and more meaning growth. You can see the corrupt underlying contradiction here bc you can only grow so far with online sales only. They may have not reached their potential but they will and for a company to have continued growth means having more than one avenue for revenue. He answered well and also avoided questions even better. That's my take and why it was pretty interesting.

One more thing. If a company's goal is to grow and increase sales or revenue then it's actually not even remotely logical to believe that Honor will only rely on e-commerce or online sales solely. They aren't making a flagship type device because they just love to. They do so like any company no matter the product. Money and growth is every company's goal. From small ones to large ones. Growth equals more revenue. I do not believe they are going to totally ignore other avenues that they either have available now or will very soon. Just like all of us aren't working every day bc we love or bc it gives us good health. It's because we need money and because we strive to make more. It will be a huge surprise to me if what he stated is 100 percent true. Honor is in this to grow and do to so means using the most productive avenues to do so which isn't the internet only. Carriers are definitely in their future too if they want to reach the masses and keep growing. Okay I think I'm done lol.

replies.text: Even if the Honor brand comes to carriers in Canada - even Rogers, to whom I subscribe - I'd hesitate to buy it through them. I'd rather buy them unlocked and then have it all paid off sooner; than going with a carrier and being locked in to an agreement.

title: How to contain your enthusiasm with the Honor 8

thread.text: I've been using my new unlocked Honor 8 for a short while now. OK, less than 5 hours and oh my.. What a well built, easy to use awesome sauce phone this is. Why did I wait so so long. I've used the One plus 3, Sony Xperia, Sony XZ and the Samsung 7 which I didn't care for too much. Half the price yet... All of the features you'd expect from a top notch phone. Well if you're considering or procrastinating buying the Honor 8 don't.. Go get it you will not regret it.

replies.text:
I currently own the OnePlus 3. In what areas do you think the honor 8 is better then the OP3?
Been looking at reviews of the Honor 8 and I'm very interested!

Also, what's the sound quality like through headphones?
I listen to a lot of music!
Thanks.

Haha, your 'Awesome Sauce' made me laugh. Great to hear people loving this phone. You really do get so much value for your money! If you are buying a S7 Edge or a iPhone 7 Plus, you pay a lot of 'Premium Tax" but with the Honor 8, you just get a great device. I especially love the back panel reflection. The 4GB RAM is also a nice touch. Keeps the device running smooth.

Congrats on seriously one of the best devices on the mobile market today without any inflated cost. How truly nice is that. Get all you could ask for from a phone and pay $350 instead of $699. I also definitely encourage you to not download a launcher on your new Honor and they that software out for a week or two. If you do so you'll find that it's some of the best and smooth interface you've ever used and it's just lId out a tad different then pure Android. Actually what you get is a very nice and seamless blend of mix of both Android and Apple iOS. It's much like a hybrid software that gives you both the best in both interfaces. Welcome to a great device. Hope you enjoy it as you definitely made a good decision man.

thread.text: Glad that you are enjoying it!

Be glad to give you some input. What I've found so far so interesting is how snappy and responsive the phone is. Opening apps is so blazing quick. I was really unsure with Huawei using their own software on Android if this would hinder the phone. It's quite the opposite. Somehow, they've managed to optimize the two combinations with success. The phone is a good hand size yet, the screen quality for reading articles, web pages etc is very good. Web video quality is amazing such as urine, sports videos etc.
The phone is light. It's nice to hold and easy to put in your pocket. The phone finish is Sexy. Though I do have a clear cover to protect. The back with its glass finish is slightly slippery so I go this cover thrown on with the deal.
B&H photo right now you can pick this phone up for $289 with their coupon at checkout. Crazy deal.
The EMUI embedded software took with a few hours to get used to. Now I have no issues. The layout is different than that of stock Android. I've read and article this am that some people are using Google Launcher on their Honor 8 and P9 phones with great success. For me, I actually like their launcher. Something new to explore.
As for music, the quality through the speaker at the bottom of the phone like the plus 3 has good quality. I have not tried earphones yet.
The dual camera is a wow too. Better images I think that the plus 3.
Setup was so easy. Loaded up by sim and memory card. Everything loaded up smoothly with no issues. It took me approximately 45 minutes from the time I took the phone out of the box, kept it charged with a complete setup. No too shabby I say.
I'm really glad I bought this phone. For the price and it's specs you can't beat it. Nougat will be released mid February.
I have the black version of the phone. The blue looks nice and white to me well OK then.

That should say UTube not urine, Sorry everyone.
Did I mention nope forgot how quick the finger touch sensor is. Incredible.
You're right. A combination of Android and IOS. You nailed it.

Best software interface money can buy on the market right now. I've tried just about every high end phone out there. It was fun to test them but for a long time I was exclusive to Apple. IOS is rather just too much if that makes sense. Then pure stock Android isn't bad. I liked it but it seamed unrefined. So when I dove into the Honor 8 I immediately was like, wow this software interface is by far the best experience hands down on the mobile phone market. I truly believe why people say it's different is because it truly is but what Huawei Honor did which was a brilliant move was take IOS features and Android features and blended them so perfectly that this software becomes different. The layout is a breeze to learn. Getting used to a superior user experience since we all are so deeply used to either in your face IOS and to me like Block letters pure Android that this perfect blend will throw you off for a second bc it's just that well done. You get a class act software that is so seamless and truly without any major flaw and most people just really don't know how to explain it other than using different. I use the best or superior bc this is exactly what this interface is. Additionally it does not favor one software more than the other rather it's just a new breed of mobile software without the extremes of either and it's so refined it's an enjoyable experience to use daily. It's like they created a third type software which I would not be surprised if you see companies in the future shaping their interface to be highly comparable to Huawei honor as opposed to extreme Android and extreme IOS. So yes it's different in that respect but better in all facets.

Another satisfied customer. 
👍
So glad that you are loving your Honor 8, OP! What colour do you have?!
Midnight black is what I have. It's a sexy phone!

replies.text: You know, "basic black" for a lot of phones is exactly that - basic. But not for the Honor 8. That midnight black is the sleekest, sexiest black I've ever seen on a phone. I had a choice between that and white for my Honor 8, and though I chose the white version, the black, IMO, is still just as beautiful.

thread.text: Morty2264, I'm assuming you're very happy with you Honor 8 even though you chose white lol. I'm amazed. I keep finding more and more options with this phone. I ask myself.. Why did I wait so long to purchase this awesome sauce phone.

replies.text: Agreed. Looks like the Moto Z Play shoots significantly better shots in low light settings.

thread.text: Moto z wins but moto still has issues with noise that has plagued every moto phone I have had since the droid x.
My vote is also for the Moto. Low light seems a lot better.

I think they're both about equal. In low light, the Moto is definitely brighter and slightly sharper, however, it tends to blow out highlights and wash out areas where the light is. As a result, the Honor tends to capture more details in an image. 
However, in virtually no light the Moto destroys the Honor pulling in more light to create viewable images.

I'm viewing these on mobile. Looks like the Moto Z Play is competent.
Honor 8 is probably more true to life.
If you switch to wide aperture or HDR mode, the honor performs better in low light.

replies.text: I took a number of shots but didn't see any difference with hdr on or off, though I don't think that I did any low light shots with hdr. Might have to try when i get a chance.
Does it need to be steadied more? My low light shots are usually baby related.
You are right, I'm all for just opening and shooting but it's not hard to turn on HDR. I can get beautiful low light shots just by turning on HDR

thread.text: Hdr shutter speed is quite a bit faster than night shot mode.

Wow, the Moto meters all wrong with night shots. It clips (blows out) the highlights, no detail, and those can not be recovered by anything.
The H8 appears darker because it is dark when those shots are taken. It preserves detail in the highlights much better.

In my opinion, at least, it looks like the Z Play does a good job at capturing photos under low-light settings. The Honor 8 still does a pretty good job, but the Play looks like it does it better. However, that isn't to say that I don't like my low-light photos on my 8 - they still look pretty good, as do yours, OP!

title: New Honor 8 has scratches UNDER screen and on sim tray

thread.text:
Hi guys,
I recently purchased an Honor 8. While unboxing and inserting my sim card I noticed that the tray was already a bit scratched up. I didn't want to be too picky about it, so I tried to look over it. A day later when I wanted to install a tempered glass I also noticed quite visible scratches on the left side of the screen. Because I had the phone for only one day and haven't used it a lot in that time, I really wondered. After inspecting that with a bright flashlight I saw that the scratches are UNDER the screen and there's even a tiny dust particle UNDER the screen. I'm not sure how that's possible, since the screen and digitizer should be one unit. But it's definitely underneath the glass. Little dust particles above the glass and perspective make that clear to me.
I still don't want to be too picky and actually want to keep the phone, but these are already two quality issues on a brand new phone. So I'm not sure whether I should return this unit. Downside is that I got the device for a really reasonable price (270 €) and will probably lose a discount when I'm going to exchange (new price would be around 330 €). The scratches and dust particle under the glass aren't visible when the screen is turned on. What do you think about it? Keep and forget or probably having stressful times to exchange but *maybe* a flawless phone? :-/

That would drive me nuts.
Personally I don't like surprises when buying something that should be perfect and isn't.
Was this advertised as brand new?
Mod note. Thread moved to the Honor 8 fórum.
Can you ask for a warranty replacement?
I would demand a replacement from the vendor if I bought this as new.

replies.text: I mention it because the OP mentioned that he might lose the discount if he did an exchange. Of course a new replacement would be best if possible.

thread.text:

OP here, unfortunately forgot my password, so I had to create this new account. After some toing and froing with the seller I got an exchange and also on top of that a 10 € voucher for the hassle.
So actually I should be happy. But I don't know if I am just out of luck or too picky, but the new (box sealed) device also had some dust specs under the screen and a tiny mark on the metal frame. Any way, I think I am going to keep this device now. Seems like there is just really bad QC on this device.

I'm glad you got compensated for your troubles, but I'm saddened to hear that your new phone has a similar issue! I'm hoping they're not too noticeable, but like you, they will irk me if I know they're there.

Good thing is, the dust specks are actually just visible under a bright light source when the screen is turned off. There is only one really tiny speck that gets visible when there is a white or greyish background. But even than it is more of a tiny bright dot and not a dark spot or so (kinda misleading in the photo). You really gotta search for it. :-D And for a price of about 260 € (~280 $) I am mostly satisfied. ;-) I also checked my previous phone, a Nexus, and even that is having some dust which gets visible under bright light (and the first Honor 8 had some as well). I think this could be more common than most people think.
Dust? You mean shinny sprinkles?

OP I had a pretty large scratch on my Honor 5X I just won and received. It came sealed like that. I put a screen protector on it and now I can only see it in the direct sunlight. My honor 8 was perfect rather both of my honor 8s as I have had two of them. These things happen from time to time and yes I believe it's luck of the draw if you get one scratched. Keep in mind which is what I have to do being as picky as I am is that "nothing is perfect". I'd definitely exchange the scratched model but the specs you see in the direct sunlight, 99.9 percent of every phone will have those. There is absolutely no way any factory can produce in mass these phones without micro dust fibers floating around that you can't even see unless you happen to be in direct sunlight. Those I'd just throw a tempered glass on and be on my way. Good luck.

replies.text: Does any carrier still have two year service contracts? Verizon,att and T-Mobile don't.
I live in Canada - we still have two-year contracts here!
Ah OK. Probably one of the few places that do

Basically everyone still does, it just isn't technically a "two year contract". Most of the phone payment plans are for at least 24 months, some 30 months. Most people won't upgrade until their phone is paid off, so they're basically locked in to a two year contract. And even if they upgrade at a year or whatever their carrier lets them upgrade at, they still have to turn in the phone or pay it off, just to get locked back into a deal with their carrier for a new phone.
Pretty much 6 in one hand, half dozen in the other...

That's why i mentioned service contract which no longer exists at least in the USA. What you are referring to is a finance contract , phone payment plan or whatever wherein the carrier finances the phone at zero interest over the life of the loan. This is just like you going to best buy and financing a TV. 
They have similarities but people lambasted the service contracts , so carriers gave you the dpp option. But guess what, it was a trick because carriers wanted to get rid of service contracts anyway.
And honestly what other option is there? You either pay outright ( new or used), pay over a specified period of time for the phone, or get the phone for a subsidized price, committing to a certain period of time to the carrier.

I know it's different. But at the same time, it's the same. It typically doesn't save the consumer much money over the previous two year contract, and most people don't even know that they can leave at any point in time. So the effect is the same. That's really all I was getting at.

If you don't know then that means that you either didn't ask or didn't read the terms... 
If you didn't read what you signed then don't complain later.

I'm not complaining or fighting about it. I'm just saying that the payment plans are still basically two year contracts. That's all. It's essentially the same out of pocket for the consumer and the average consumer will still upgrade only at two years.

Well the big difference is that carriers took the subsidy out of the plan price with the current plans so you are saving about $20 per line on service when not on subsidized pricing. That gives consumers more options to either keep their phone longer or buy a used phone or buy an unlocked phone to save money. Of course if you upgrade every two years then it won't make much difference in price.
Also you can payoff a payment plan at any time depending on carrier. For service contract, you cannot pay off the remainder of the contract without cancelling service.

Yeah, I definitely agree. And for us geeks, it's actually a nice thing. But all I was meaning is that for most of the public, it's essentially the same thing. And you and I both know that carriers wouldn't be doing this out of the goodness of their hearts - it helps their bottom line too.

Anyways, you could try this, but you need a sdcard. This has mostly worked for folks who are in beta upgrading to the latest beta build. title: OnePlus 3T vs Honor 8

thread.text:
I got curious, so I tried the OnePlus 3T. I have to say, it's a great phone. Everything about the phone was fast: the transition, finger print scanner and the camera. The camera took great pictures, but I think Honor 8 is more color accurate. But the OnePlus seemed to capture more details. Maybe that's the megapixel difference? And I really did like the size. Although Honor 8 is the perfect size, my eyes aren't what they used to be so a larger screen size was a welcome change. 
But in the end, I stayed with Honor 8. I just couldn't get use to the 'stock' feel of Oxygen OS. I was missing some of the native apps and features of EMUI. Really, the only thing missing is the app drawer, which I'm looking forward to when nougat comes out. I'm hoping Honor 9 might be a 5.5 inch screen. If not, then I might go with Mate 9. But it looks like I'll be sticking with Huawei/Honor for a while.

replies.text: One of the issues with OnePlus is the lack of expandable memory. I download music to my phone so that off the bat would be a deal breaker. Unless the 3t added this feature, have not done much research on that one only the previous.
It doesn't have microSD, which is a good thing. It has a 128 GB internal storage option, which is way better.
While i agree that internal is better, many people already have an SD card, and the 3t 128gb costs 66% more currently than the honor 8, based on current sales.
Good point

The honor X series (4X/5X/6X) has been going for the 5.5inch display size, and the flagship honor series (6/7/8) have been going for the 5-5.2inch display. Last year they did release the honor 8 Note with a 6.6inch display, so maybe they will do something similar for honor 9 (or whatever comes after the 8).

Oxygen OS vs EMUI?... yeah oxygen all the way. The double tap, dark mode and other gestures work flawlessly. That's something I could never say before and I was really surprised. H8 is a great phone but for me, it's not superior to the 3t.

thread.text: Hello Stalonge! We are sorry to hear about this inconvenience you are experiencing at this time. We would recommend making sure that all your apps that you are using are currently updated, The update will fix and bugs and glitches you may be experiencing. If it is not updated this will cause the app to run slowly and can even exit out at times. We also advice checking your signal strength to make sure you are receiving bars in your area from the cell towers. If neither of these solutions are not successful it would be best to contact your current network carrier. (JJ)

title: I'm a die-hard Honor 8 user, but I just won a Honor 5x

thread.text:
Hello
So I have been using the Honor 8 for quite a while now. Love it as I'm sure you may have seen my many posts here about it or to help others on it especially my love for EMUI 4.1 interface. Late yesterday I received an email from Android Central that I had won an Honor 5X! I had no idea that there was an incentive program where I was actually chosen twice to win the 5X. Has anyone here ever owned the 5X before? Should I use my free 5X as a back up or actually switch devices? I've read some pretty good reviews on it but am I 100 percent correct to say that the Honor 8 is far superior to the 5X? I'm totally honored to be honored lol with such a nice free gift from Android Central. I had no idea they kept up with all of our posts and information to enable one to win such a nice free gift. I'll be getting the 5X, Dr Strange Kit and a selfie stick that will arrive in a few days. Was curious of you guys thoughts between these two devices. Would it be with me reactivating my second phone number for the 5X? I actually had been in search of a device with a screen size of 5.5 to 5.7 ironically when I got word that I won this device. I'm super stoked but definitely want to get your thoughts of what I should do with my free gift?
Thanks a bunch to all

I got a 5X a while ago, and it has been thoroughly unimpressive. Performance is quite sluggish, even when "protecting" apps from Huawei's aggressive battery-saving/RAM-cleaning feature. It sometimes takes about 3-4 seconds for the Play Store to open after tapping the icon. I'm not sure if Huawei is even updating it for security patches -- mine is still on the 5/2016 security update. From what I've read of the Honor 8, I'd stick with that one. Congratulations anyway!

I would agree with the above. Poor performance and slow updates. I honestly cannot recommend it as a primary , there are better choices in the price range. Of course you got it free, so it's fine as a backup 
Did you even get marshmallow on yours OTA yet?

Congrats again!
It's a great phone for free Lol ... 
The 6X is looking a lot better after having the 5X.

replies.text: It's definitely good for free... But it feels very sluggish compared to the competition is all.

True.
I won't do any phone with 2 and 16 anymore.
Much too weak for my Android ways these days <<< (I rhymed there)

I am not against 2gb ram... I have used some that ran decently like the moto g4, zte zmax pro, ZTE zmax 2, Blu Vivo xl. In the 100-150 range, 2gb is what I would consider the bare minimum for decent usage, IMO. Of course if you can afford a little more then i would strongly recommend at least 3gb.

I wonder if 3GB of ram will be the new minimum for low-enders.
16 for storage is doable with expanded storage I think...low storage capacity caused me to take it easy with the apps and downloads.
These newer cheapies with better processors are getting much more pleasurable to use.

I think in the sub $100 range, we won't see 3gb ram for a while. But in the$150-250 range, I suspect that we will see more devices with 3gb ram.
16gb in internal is ok for light apps... Lots of apps and or large apps and it won't be enough. Most have SD card for media storage.

replies.text: Oh did you win something too? Was it a Paul or James that contacted you by chance? They were really nice and said I was voted as a winner twice on the 5X. They said my posts and my thread starters were well written and those two along with number of posts and how I helped others with questions was why they chose me. I'm definitely going to use it as my back up phone as I keep two numbers. I was originally going to get another Honor 8 but in a 64g and pearl white as my color then I changed my mind and decided on the Moto Z Play instead. I had still not pulled the trigger for some reason as the Z Plays 5.5 inch screen was why I was going with it instead. Then I get this very unexpected email that I won the 5X which happens to have a 5.5 inch screen. Pretty cool irony. I found with thread stating it was bc I myself had a question or I engaged a nice intelligent debate which that is a good way to gain knowledge in itself, hearing different points of views on a particular topic or product question. I'm super stoked as I've never won a free phone before. I'll use it and test it out and write a short review on it on the 5X forum along with giving thanks to Android Central and thanks to Paul and James. I'm still in shock. In total I'm getting the 5X, Dr Strange Honor Marvel Kit and a Selfie Stick. Pretty nice package overall, especially that I had no idea that my posts were respected and even recognized! I've been collecting and wasting lots of money on expensive watches since I was 26 and now I'm 41. My two favorite things I collect or enjoy buying are both tech devices and high end watches. I breifky owned a smart watch but it just wasn't the same high end quality of a fine Swiss made Diver or Chrono Diver on a awesome made bracelet. title: Anyone with kind all the sudden onset of battery issues?

thread.text:
So I've noticed lately that my Honor 8 isn't providing the same battery performance I'm so used to. It's now keeping a full charge less longer and I've found it kind of difficult to get a full 100 percent charge too on the flip side. Maybe 98 to 99 percent at times. Anyone have any ideas as to what is going on with my particular case with the battery? Do I have too many websites open in the background type issue that's consuming large amounts of battery life or do I indeed have a specific to the battery related issue? I'm well within a warranty with Honor but I thought I'd check with you guys and pretty gals to see if this maybe an issue I can resolve myself?
Thanks a bunch for any feedback or suggestions. 
Don

Hi,
Oddly enough I've noticed that my battery has been draining slightly quicker the past two days, thought it was just me. It's not a huge difference but noticable. Have you looked into the phone management app to see what is consuming the most battery? It seems for me that it's Facebook causing the issue. Even though I close the app and not allow it to run when the screen is locked. I'm thinking that Facebook updated and so some reason is consuming more. Otherwise everything else seems to be consuming the same as before. I would be interested to know if other people have noticed this as well.

I have noticed since the day I first charged, it takes longer to get 100% from say 95%. If you notice the charging indicator will be green even if it's 93%. I think that has to do with Honor telling you battery is good to go with full charge though it's not 100% yet.
I have not seen any anamolies in battery drain. Facebook and Facebook Messenger fixes a battery issue in their app last week though. So make sure you have the recent version of their apps.

replies.text:
I'm on the current version of both, maybe that's not the issue then. Thanks!
The reason why it takes longer to hit 100 from 95 is that quick charging does not work past I think 90 percent. Below that percent the phone charges much faster and cuts down to top off the battery.

thread.text: The fb messenger fix was done server side and requires the app is force stopped and allowed to restart.
Facebook and Messenger apps did make an announcement that if you restarted/reset the apps, your battery consumption would be reset, so to speak.

I closed down a lot of my open sites in my chrome app and I noticed a boost. I had like 50 widows open but that also gives you an idea of how my organized chaotic brain works. I'll be researching something and instead of bookmarking it, I would leave the window open so I could quick refer back to it when I needed to. I forced myself to cut it down to about 25 open windows and my battery definitely got stronger. The mind of a True ADHD person lol. Organized chaos. It's all I've ever known lol

replies.text: Glad things have sped up a bit for you!

Yeah I really think they have. I've about decixed that I'm going to back up one good time to cloud and perform a total factory reset and more or less start over. There will be quite a few apps that I will cut out and it'll kind of be like getting a new honor lol. I'll definitely get my favorite font back but in general cut back on all the built up clutter. I tend to do a reset every once in a while if I end up keeping a phone longer than 5 or 6 months. One can't help but just build up unnecessary apps and data over time. I believe this will definitely give my battery new life.
Great plan! Let us know how things go!

thread.text: Facebook claims it was fixed, but the drain persisted until I disabled background data for the Facebook app. As soon as I did that, my Honor 8 was back to normal performance.
The fix was done server side, so it required a force stop of the app and then restart to take effect.

replies.text: Even after doing that, I was still getting Facebook opening itself in the background when I had it restricted.
Same here...I don't have Facebook white listed and every so often I get a power prompt that Facebook is running in the background even though I closed the application

thread.text: Interesting. I'll do that too with Facebook
Have you set fb to close when the screen locks?

replies.text: Yeah, as well as swipe off from app switcher

thread.text: Weird.
Instagram is doing it too. Neither app whitelisted, close when screen locks, background data disabled.
I'm getting great battery life, but it seems fb is also my biggest drain, but when I viewed it in the battery consumption list it showed that it wasn't closing on screen lock.

I have to close Facebook some too when I think about it. Closing lots of my open windows helped me some though. I'm still not anywhere like I used to be. Makes me want to just get a 64g now. I say that just to justify getting a 64g lol. Nothing to do with a better battery lol.

replies.text:
Why not configure Facebook and those other apps you feel are eating battery to close when the screen locks? EMUI has some great battery optimization options just for you!
For me, I have done that and I dont push Facebook notifications to lock screen and I have disabled almost all type of notifications (like for comments, likes etc.,) from Facebook. 
At the end of day, if Facebook is something you use extensively and need it, then it is doing its job.

The issue is it seems like Facebook's app is ignoring those restrictions. I keep finding it in my running apps even though I closed it, it's restricted from background data, and closes when the screen locks.
Hmm..For me every time I open Facebook it does a full reload as you open the app first time.

thread.text: I don't use Facebook as much as I used to but my Facebook has been on mine since day one and my battery seemed much better back then. It also maybe me and my mind playing a trick on me as right now I don't have a second back up phone so I'm on my Honor 8 a good bit more lately. I'm in the middle of deciding on the Mate 9 as my second phone and there are a couple other phones I'm considering two. So probably me being on it exclusively along with the 50 plus Windows I had open was drinking battery juice like crazy. Hopefully once I get settled in with my second phone it will become a non issue and then I'll know this was the problem. Even still said, my battery isn't horrible. It's still pretty stout but I'm not used to seeing it get much below 50 percent hardly ever. It's probably just me and my mind guys.

title: Pairing a TomTom bluetooth remote to Honor 8

thread.text:
Has anyone tried to do this?
My Honor 8 is Stock ROM, unlocked and rooted, and running Android 6.0.
I tried following the instructions on GorgiLabs from October 17, 2011, to no avail.
The instructions above are useful for Android 2.3 and below, except that someone tried with a rooted Stock ROM 4.3 by replacing a file in /data/misc/bluedroid. I tried that also, again, no joy.
I'd love to use my old TomTom remote while I'm driving. I believe once it is paired, I will be able to map the different keys. The problem is that Honor 8 recognized the device as a keyboard and asks me enter the pairing code, which of course I'm unable to enter on the TomTom Remote.
Or more in general, has anyone tried to connect a Bluetooth device that requires a pairing code, but there is no way to type in the code from the device? Is there a work around?
Any, and I mean any clues to solve this puzzle would be very much appreciated by me and all drivers I encounter on my daily commute.
Thanks!

Yes. I am really liking the Axon 7, my first android phone. 
Favorite part:
1. Feel and look - feel good in the hands and easy to use/functional with one hand
2. Fingerprint scanner on back is much better than having it on the front, and it's very responsive and fast
3. Screen is vibrant and looks good!
4. Dual speakers with Dolby Atom is spectacular! When I show others sample sounds, they are like, "wow, that sounds really good coming from such a small device"
Curious about the Mate 9 though, ever since it was released and now finally in the US.

Thank you so much for your response! Sounds like a very good introduction to Android for you, and for anyone, from the sounds of things!
I do agree with you about having the fingerprint scanner in the back - it's much easier to do that and hold your phone one-handed than using a front-facing fingerprint scanner. Glad you are liking the phone! It certainly looks beautiful, and the size is good, so I can totally understand you enjoying how it feels in the hand.

Yes. I do like it a lot. However, I will most likely get the Mate 9 and see how that goes. I've been very interested in it ever since I heard of it's release. They just did not release it in time for the holidays, which was why I went with the Axon 7.
Let us know how you like the Mate 9!

I am liking it so far. Nice big 5.9 screen that does not feel big at all in the hands. Easy and comfortable to hold. 1080p resolution is just fine. 
Battery life is superb. After 7 hours of use, I am only at 64%. Performance is very speedy and responsive and EMU 5.0 is much better.
A cons is that they decided to have both ringtones and notification volume tone be controlled the same, instead of separate. After looking around, I found the app Volume Control, which can separate both ringtones and notification tones, which solved that problem. 
Overall, I am liking it very much.
I have a 5.5 inch iPhone 7 Plus in addition to my Mate 9 and they are about the same size! (Mate 9 screen is bigger it has smaller bezels) Also my 5.2 inch Microsoft 950 is NOT that much smaller!

I knew Huawei hardware was great, but the software was usually a low-point for me, until now. They fixed most of my gripes with EMUI, to the point where I find myself enjoying the experience.

replies.text:
So i am new to android. What exactly are these MiFavor, EMUI, called? They are not called launchers correct? Also, how does one know that it sucks? What makes it a good one vs a bad one.
Sorry for the noob questions but again, I am new to the whole android ecosystem.

There's base Android called Android open source project (AOSP) . All the manufacturers add customizations to aosp to make it their own, referred to as skins or user interface(UI). What's good and whats bad depends on what you are looking for. Some people like pure Android,some prefer pure Google,some like Samsung TouchWiz,etc.
Thanks for that info. So I assume the only phone with pure android is pixel? Or is that phone pure Google? I guess people who has used lots of different android phones will know which UI is better?
Pixel will be pure Google as Pixel has its optimization and customization on top of AOSP.

It is pure Google. Pure Android doesn't have the Google play store or the Google apps bundle.
There isn't one that is the best for everyone... You can try different ones out to see what suits you the best.

thread.text:
Some manufacturers are known to highly customize and add lots of features, most of the big guys do this, such as Samsung, HTC, and LG. And of course, Huawei (big in China not so big yet here) also highly customizes. Others do not OnePlus for example, the Google branded phones, Pixel AND the Nexus line. Also Motorola has done both nearly stock AND highly customized.
Different things work for different people. Many prefer nearly stock Android, while many prefer those manufacturer customizations, and still others like to add their own via custom ROMs (Homebrewed - and sometimes quite professional).

I am tempted to get one but i bought a new pixel XL on contract for$320. Going on contract also saves me an additional$20/MO or$480 over two years so the price difference between the pixel xl and mate 9 is$760 in my situation.

The LCD display, 1920 x 1080, is a deal breaker for me, and I'm certainly not going to spend twice as much for the Porsche Design. I'll wait and see what Samsung does with the S8 series. title: Honor 8 Charging Speeds

thread.text: Curious on how fast everyone can re-charge their Honor 8's? How quick does it charge from you from low battery to 100%?
From like 10 to 100 in 45 or 50min
Never really timed it.

I never really let it drop past 25% (if I'm not home) or 33-36% if I am on my way home or home already. In those cases, I like that I can wake up at 6:50 and leave at 7:35 with an almost full battery and finish charging that last 3-5% during my commute.

replies.text: Thank you, this is great information to know! My phone battery is either corrupt or nonfunctional right now, so it's great to be looking at a phone whose battery is reliable enough to leave it on a charger for less than an hour and get an almost-full charge.

thread.text: Honor says 100 minutes

Dead (3%) to 100% in 90 minutes.
I've tried it 3 times now.
It's the same every time.
100 minutes seems about right. I'll have to test and time this on my side too

Hi,
I installed the Android N over TWRP and now I "recalibrated" my battery. That means, I have discharged phone at 0% ( phone turned off itself and then I repeated once, so turned off itself 2 times = 0% ) then I put it off to charge it ( with orig quick charger for Honor8 ) and here are my times:
18:10 - 18:22 0% - 20% 12min
18:10 - 18:34 0% - 40% 24min
18:10 - 18:39 0% - 50% 29min
18:10 - 18:54 0% - 70% 44min
18:10 - 19:02 0% - 80% 58min
18:10 - 19:14 0% - 90% 64min
18: 10 - 20:01 0% - 100% 111min
Phone is not a bit warm, which I think is amazing. I know that before (with MM and with turn on the phone) is periodically heated. Next time I try charge and write times, with phone turned on. Now I'm wondering what will be the battery life of the phone with N.
...this was 3 weeks a go...

replies.text: Your poor battery getting drained to 0% so many times for these results. But thanks for the charging times!. Thats actually really good. Especially from 0% to 80% in under 1 hour! thats crazy haha. My phone (not Honor 8) normally takes around 2 hours from 15% to full.

thread.text: Amazing, thanks for doing that test!!

replies.text: Seems a little short for a full charge but maybe things are still calibrating

I do find it interesting though that some have it in under an hour and some take around 100 minutes. That's a pretty big spread.
Definitely a big spread, for sure! We'll see what it does next time it's charging.
Probably shorter because it wasn't a drained battery to begin with.

thread.text: Mine is roughly around the hour mark from 0-100.

title: Just a few questions regarding the Honor 8 Settings

thread.text:
Hi, I just wanted to ask a few questions regarding the honor 8 settings
Does anyone know what the "Always send and receive MMS" and "Mobile data Always On" Settings really do??
I just wanted to make sure I knew what I was tweaking with.
Additionally, Is there any way to use the finger print scanner without using the PIN or Password?
I just wanted to use the fingerprint to unlock apps and stuff, but I wanted to keep my magazine lock, as it just looks amazing. 
Does anyone know if there's any way?
Thanks.~

For the second question, I don't think so.
The settings you mentioned should do what they sound like, allowing for mms to be sent and received on your phone. Turning it off would disable mms. 
I think the other one controls if the radio is off when the device is asleep. Not 100% sure.

I think the "always send and receive MMS" blocks your device from receiving them. Since these messages also use data people may want to turn them off, however I could be wrong. In terms of mobile data it could always keep the radio on even when it is not needed...If this is the case I don't know why it would be used. 
As per the fingerprint settings, no the pin feature needs to be activated as well.

replies.text: You can hide the pin unlock screen until you swipe to still allow the lock screen to be visible.

thread.text: Just wondering, where can I find this setting? i couldn't find it

replies.text: It's in settings....More....Mobile network

thread.text: Oh, I was looking for the lock screen, but I think I found it. Thanks for letting me know!

replies.text: Oh, sorry about that...Glad you found it though
Just to confirm its the "use password lock only"option in the lock screen menu.

thread.text:
You can manage fingerprint under 'Fingerprint management' where you can choose what you want to use it for.

title: Sometimes Honor 8 does not charge overnight

thread.text:
Hi All, My wife has had her new Honor 8 phone since Dec 23rd. It's been a great phone and maybe even the best she has ever had. Lately, sometimes the phone will not charge overnight. She always makes sure the charging light is on when she plugs it in before going to bed. 
Couple items to note:
1. she is not using the stock fast charger but is using the stock usb-c cable.
2. The stock usb cable is plugged into her clock radio which has a usb port.
3. When she gets up in the morning, the orange charge light is still on but the percentage has not changed from the night before when she plugged it in.
4. She has tried other brand usb-c cables and has the same results, some nights it works, some nights does not work.
Any ideas? Is there some setting that can be changed in the phone?
Thank you

It sounds like the clock doesn't output enough charge through the USB port. 
The honor fast charging is proprietary, and not compatible with any other sockets.
Using a USB port in another device to charge a phone, I would always suggest the phone is off when doing this. A power off and on schedule can be set in the battery options.

replies.text:
So you are saying I really can't use any other USB port other than from the fast charging proprietary stock charger. That is crazy!
I do understand the charging is proprietary but to say that is the only way the phone can be charged is not right.

thread.text: I would try another wall charger preferably the stock one. I have used a number of third party ones and they all charged reasonably fast... Definitely overnight should not be a problem for any modern charger at least 5v/1a.

I think what he is saying is don't use a clock radio to charge your phone. Use an actual phone charger. I never use the one that came with it. I have a nice Anker charger with a 6 ft cable and I have never had this issue.

replies.text: Yes, this. Charging from a port in another device will never be the same as a wall plug.

thread.text: Yup. Just give it a try... But officially honor only supports their charger hence why i suggested to try that. If you are still having problems with the stock charger and cable then honor will do warranty replacement on whichever component they determine is defective.

replies.text: The OP says it is being charged via a USB port on an alarm clock and not via a wall charger.
Right hence i believe that the problem is with the usb port on the clock

thread.text:
You would need something higher than the normal wall clock USB port that feed more power. For example, like this Anker 24W charger. That will certainly charge faster than your wall clock USB port or any other low powered ports. You still need to use the Honor's charger to get the fast charging (0% - 47% in 30 mins) as that uses dual charge and there isn't anyone selling such chargers. 
Hope that helps.

title: Battery Charging slowing down

thread.text:
I've noticed some weird stuff with my battery
I got my honor 8 last week,
The quick charge is awesome, but, I've noticed that the charging is really quick up to 90%, but the last 10% just takes quite a while.
Anyone else had this?
Additionally, the first few days, I slept with my phone at 100%, not charging, and it was 99% in the morning.
Recently, I've noticed it went down from 100% to 75% over the night.
I thought it could be due to some applications, so I deleted the two apps I've installed since the change, but it didn't fix it.
So I was wondering if it could have been some setting changes I made. Could it possibly be a setting problem?
Thanks.

The charging thing is that thats how it works. Fast charge is only up to a certain % and then falls back to normal 2V charging I believe. So, what you are experiencing is correct.
I am not sure about the other problem as I have not seen it go down to 75%. 
Have you checked your battery consumption to find out the rogue apps using the battery?

replies.text: I think it's supposed to get to 50% in about 35 minutes? I thought I read that on the Honor site.

thread.text:
Oh, thanks. DIdn't know about the quick charge as this is the first time using it.
I've checked and I didn't notice anything much significant. My MMS App was running for like.. 3%, but it seemed like the hardware part of Cell Standby and Phone Idle seemed to be mostly in charge of the %. Wasn't really awake so Might need to check again tomorrow morning, but that's what I think I saw.

OP, please post a screenshot of your battery usage over the course of a 24-hour period; after it was initially charged to 100%. This will help us better pinpoint any possible battery issues. Thank you!

replies.text:
Okay, so these are the screenshots I got this morning.
The phone was 100% at 12, and 77~78 at 8am. 
Wifi, data, bluetooth and gps were all turned off, although I've noticed that Mobile Network Signal had a green bar making me think that was on for some reason??
The one app that's still on Kakao Talk, is my messenger app, but it used 1 mAh, which is like.. 1/3000 of the battery?
So, based on the data, I think Phone IDle and Cell Standby is taking most of the battery for some reason, which I don't think is normal.

thread.text: The drop over night is caused by data always on settings, can't remember where they are but you can stop data/wifi being always on in sleep mode.
I've turned off Wifi, Bluetooth, Data and GPS over the night but it didn't seem to change much...... or wait, is it set to always on for some reason??
25% drop on idle overnight is excessive. It's usually caused by a stray app. Do you have any apps white listed? If so then try to not white list any apps and see if you still have the same problem

Very odd. I'm quite a heavy user. My phone doesn't last long at all. As you can see though, my network doesn't stay on constantly like yours. 
Down to 40% with 2h30m screen on time so far.

That's what I would expect, as I'm quite of a heavy user myself. So I really want to get this problem solved since my phone is using 23% over 8hour screen off time. Which up to just a few days ago, used only 1%..
This is the option I suggest checking.

replies.text:
Okay, I'll try out this and see how it goes. Thanks for the help! I hope this works.. Guess I'll just test it out for the next few days.
