title: What is your favorite about the Honor 8?

thread.text: The Honor 8 is a great mid range phone. What do you like most about it?
Lots of great discussion on this topic already taking place in this thread.http://forums.androidcentral.com/hon...-new-post.html

replies.text: Let's stick to that thread so that app discussion can be in the same thread

thread.text: We love the quality of the innovative bionic 12MP dual lenses of the Honor 8. One lens allows for rich color and the other lens is monochrome to give your images more light and increased sharpness. Together they help you capture crisper, more detailed photos. Do you want high-quality photos under macro, black light, low-light, and complex conditions? No problem for the Honor 8. The hybrid auto-focus enables laser focus for short range, precise depth focus for long range, and contrast focus — each working together to help you take better pictures in complex lighting conditions day and night. Thank you for your comments! (NS)

replies.text:
Their software support annoys me. Same goes for moto. Totally would have gotten a z play if they hadn't left me in the dust these past 2 years.
ZTE has other problems. Really no down sides, IMO, with Honor.

Yeah I totally understand. They renedged on multiple devices like the droid mini which i bought for$8 no contract some time ago or the moto e 2015 which i paid$10 for a while back. I told myself that I wouldn't get another moto phone but saw the moto z play for$20 and couldn't resist. All prices after promotions but no service contract. I hope that Honor would do carrier phones in the future ... I know that I am in the minority but I like carrier deals

thread.text: Have to say software can be considered a downside for the Honor 8. With EMUI 5 that will likely change but for now it takes a lot of getting used to its quirks

replies.text: How annoying is EMUI if one uses Nova Launcher Prime? I always use Nova Launcher Prime, even on my stock Android devices.

With Nova prime or action launcher... EMUI is awesome. You can customize everything (custom nav bar, dark themes, etc.) right out of the box. The notification panel isn't set up ideally if you're used to stock android (as I was)... but it really isn't bad or annoying... totally usable. The built in software and hardware features are a huge selling point with EMUI.

I agree with both of you. I really like how much you can change. I am amazed that even just changing the font feels like a difference. It's pretty cool. It's not even bad like people have said. I have the stock launcher because I like it too lol. Also the hiding of apps is something I really like. The fact that I can hide all of the uglies (apps I never use) is awesome.
Also +1 to Honor for allowing us to remove most of the preloaded apps. The ones I don't use, I can hide and never see unless it has to be updated.

Have had the H8 since they were available and have not found any quirks. Just yesterday I downloaded an update that fixed several software problems. So far the support has been great. Gee whiz - - I have actually been able to get customer staff on the phone to discuss a question I had. Try that with HTC - - I have and it was awful.

thread.text: I tend to agree with most of MrMobile's points in the video above after having used the Honor 8 for some time now. It's a solid device no doubt. And for the price, you really can't go wrong.

Based on others' opinions, I thought EMUI was going to be terrible, but I actually like it. I normally use Nova, but I'm going with EMUI for now. The only thing I miss is an app drawer (which the lack of is a big con) and double tap to sleep. I've enjoyed tinkering with the many customizations in EMUI. I wish themes were easier to download, but I've had fun with the few themes I've found.

replies.text:

title: My temp remedy for slippery, pics

thread.text: So I'm waiting on my Skinomi full body kit and my case. This phone was so slippery to hold that I feared dropping it. I cut some material I had for wrapping things. 3m material. Then I cut to fit a temp screen protector all while I wait on my official products to arrive. This made a world of difference. I hated to cover up the back side but now I can grip it so much better with one hand.
That's a clever solution! Hopefully you'll get your case soon.
Nice solution!glad it worked out for you
Thanks! My case I think should arrive tomorrow. This phone has been a blast

Very clever indeed! I have noticed the phone is slippery for sure, reminds me a lot of the Nexus 4 when I used to use that one  The darn thing would always slide off surfaces onto the floor. Thankfully the Honor 8 hasn't taken a tumble yet 
As you point out though, great solution here for those concerned about a solid grip! Skins/cases always a good route to go.
For more see this Honor 8 cases, covers, & accessories thread.

Hey all,
This just came in from Amazon. Comes in a two pack. J&D is the product name and Amazon is the source. Gives full coverage basically and very little in way of lines that show that don't actually mold to the slight curvature of the Honor 8's screen. Im still waiting on UPS for my case but wanted to post a this so the ones looking for a good tempered glass would know which to order. I took a shot in the dark with this company but I've had their phone cases before which were of good quality. Definitely one I would say to get if you're on the hunt. If there is a better one, someone please let me know. This seems to be perfect but I'm always open to better.
The halos are very distracting to me,but it is a problem with many 2.5d screens

Coming up. Sorry. I had to take a conference call for work. I just got this. Actually the top and bottom have full absorption but are just shy of flushing out to the very top and very bottom. The sides give perfect coverage but just ever so slight non full absorption. Pics to follow.
Here are some close ups. It's a pretty good fit. Similar to say an iPhone fit. Almost fully absorbed to the phone now. At first it wasn't but it's set in now

thread.text: Clever. It is so hard to find something that doesn't compromise grip and protection and also lets that glass shine through.

This case is perfect. Gives no bulk to the phone at all. The shade of Red is perfect and now my honor 8 is full blown spiderman theme! Anyways the case totally protects all for corners but leaves a little top and bottom exposed taking away extra bulk. This case is a hard shell and it snaps into place. I think it comes in 4 colors on Amazon. The box says frosted shield and appears to originate from Japan. The Honor now has grip and no more slippery feel. Absolutely love this case against the blue color Honor. Here are a few pics to those who might have interest in picking up this case 
Any questions, let me know.

My plan is to use the full skinomi kit which isn't tempered glass but gives full smooth coverage even to the sides top bottom and back. title: Optimization shortcuts...

thread.text:
It's possible to add shortcuts for optimizing the honor 8 under EMUI by finding and tapping the "phone manager" icon from your apps.
You'll then see this screen:
Tap the cog on the upper right of the screen.
You'll then see this:
Tap to select "shortcuts" and you'll get this screen next:
From here you will be able to add shortcuts to the startscreen for optimizations.
I added the "System optimization" icon to one of the dock pages I have under Nova using this feature.
Hope everyone finds this useful.

Ooh I didn't know that you can do that. 
Thanks for sharing this tutorial and this information in general. I get tired of digging for the battery manager, so this will be very helpful to me.
Excellent! That will be very helpful to Honor 8 users here.
Wow,thanks for letting us know!

Woah. I never noticed this. Nice work Honor!
Thanks for pointing this one out!!
We really like your shortcut steps that you provided for "system optimization" on the Honor 8. Thanks for sharing this information @Guytronic! (NS)

thread.text: One last quickie... Screen protectors? Amazon? It seems this phone although specs out awesome is not known or spoken about too much. Hope I researched enough before I gave BB $350. They priced matched so I saved $50 from their current $399. Thanks again.
What a cool phone.

So much to say. Only put it on top of textured things because this phone is beautiful but slippy and will slide off the table. Set up your protected apps so that you can get notifications (settings->advanced settings->battery manager).
Also you would want to set up your fingerprint because smart key is awesome!
This phone is fast and has very good battery life. I forget to close apps all the time and this thing just performs well. I never regret not closing an app. Also it has great connectivity, better than my iPhone SE.
$350 is the best price you can get right now for a new one first hand.

Thanks for the great info guys. Very much appreciated. I can't seem to put the phone down and I opened it at 1030 central time this morning. I'm officially addicted to this device. So much to offer but the best thing I've found is that it's different and unique. Its not the same as the zillion others I've tried. I deeply dig different which to me is innovation. Yeah, this just became my phone of choice. Now it's gotta handle work and personal which I suspect won't be a problem at all

My home page for now. I'm pretty sure I'm going to role with the stock launcher it came with. I still have quite a bit of app organizing but for now this is what my home page is looking like. It'll change some but not much. I may add or take some apps but I like a simple home page with my most used apps. The rest of my pages are organized by category of their intended use. Functional interface like adobe, word, google keep and so on gets a page. Then my purchasing page, Amazon, best buy, and you get the picture. Music and videos get a page too. I had it narrowed down to the Nexus 6p and this one. Tried the 6p last night and actually loved it. It was hard to make the exchange. Tipping point for the exchange, no expandable memory which my price range was the 32g. It ate at me. My other phone is a Sony Xperia X 5 inch so the Nexus was the perfect opposite at 5.7 inches. Then I read a few negative reviews on this interface and made it even harder to exchange. That and it being so close in size to my Sony. I use a lot of space so I did it. My eyes are tired bc this cool phone has been a blast today. Only thing I'd change would be to have that 6p's resolution but 1080p is plenty anyways. Glad I made the swap. Anyone have any suggestions on a solid reliable all in one email app? This year is my first go around with Android. I was blackberry fanatic until I was forced to swap to the iPhone 5 original then apple exclusively up until February of this year. Gave Samsung several tries. The worst interface I've ever messed with. Sticky and choppy. Motorola is awesome, then Sony is overpriced but underrated and now the honor 8 a secret treasure among Android. Tech is fun but it's gotten expensive lol

replies.text:

Also, EMUI (the UI) has themes. If you care for the stock Android look, you can search emui themes in the play store and get the stockify theme. https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...theme.stockify
Then you can apply it in the Themes app. I have used other launchers, but I keep finding myself going back to the default launcher. I love being able to hide apps I don't use, which you can do by pushing two fingers apart.
I'm lazy and I just use the email app, so hopefully someone can help you there with that.

I've stayed with it the longest because of it's security features and customization options.
Bluemail and Cloudmagic are other clients I've used in the past.
Good luck on the search.
The choices are many.

title: It's too hard and it took too long...

thread.text:
...for me to finally decide which phone to buy after 2 months of countless hours reading reviews and opinions on various forums. All my phones are hand me downs- the iphone 3G and samsung galaxy S3- so when the latter started sputtering, it was time to look for a replacement. 
-First, the Nexus 6P- camera is great, still runs good but too big for this kitty's own comfort and price is still prohibitive for me 
-Nexus 5x-no expandable storage and I think the specs are underwhelming for the price 
-The Moto G4 plus and Alcatel idol 4s, affordable but for $100 more I could have gotten the Axon 7 which houses the latest and greatest, I actually pre-ordered it but got tired of waiting due to supply issues and so-so low light camera reviews,
- so, on to the HTC 10-even better camera but price is too damn high (looking at you Pixel, iPhone and V20) 
-For some reason I wasn't feeling the OnePlus 3 even though they say it's a great phone but customer service issues turned me off..
-So it's down to the LG G5 and Honor 8.
-LG G5 was perfect! Camera is great (wide angle) and replaceable batteries! I didn't care much about the plasticky build quality or gaps. It was for sale on B&H at $479 but the reported boot loop issues and various software problems got me disappointed 
Sorry for the long post. TL;DR bottom line, so many good phones out there and it's good for us. I got the Honor 8 yesterday for $350 no tax/no shipping with free goodies and I feel relieved of this burden. Let's hope it doesn't disappoint. It came down to the price, specs, camera performance (better than other mid-range gadgets) and it fits my old phone holster. It's shiny! Kitty cats lurvs shiny thingies! Meow!
You could have waited for the Axon to go on sale... I bought one for$277. If I were to buy the honor 8 now I would buy at Amazon for$350 plus$50 gift card

title: TL;DR - Best Buy is a terrible place to shop.

thread.text:
Warning: Rant ahead.
I consistently have a poor shopping experience at Best Buy. Yesterday continued the trend.
I wanted to see the Honor 8 in person, so I went to my "local" Best Buy (40 minutes away). I asked if they had an Honor 8 demo. The clerk pointed to a phone at an endcap by itself. The display label stated Nexus 6P. The phone had a huge security lock on the back (bigger than that on other phones), so it was difficult to get a good feel of it. There was no power to it, and they didn't have another working unit. Even though blue is currently a Best Buy exclusive color, the one on display was white. The sales guy was like, "I think it's also available in black and maybe blue." Slightly passive-aggressively, I told him blue was a Best Buy exclusive. I don't expect employees to be as knowledgeable as someone who has spent a lot of time researching a tech item, but Best Buy employees frequently aren't aware of the store's own promotions.
I decided to drive 20 minutes to the Best Buy Mobile store in a nearby mall. None of the phones had powered displays except for an iPhone SE and a cheap BLU phone. I asked if they had the Honor 8. They didn't have it on display, yet, but they had a demo unit. She went to the back and came back with a silver phone. I quickly realized it wasn't an Honor 8 (maybe an Honor 7?) and when I told her I didn't think it was the 8, she said, "Yes, it is. I can even check the settings to make sure." She took the phone, checked the settings, then said, "Oh. Yeah. This isn't the Honor 8."
Fortunately, they did have a working unit, so I eventually was able to test it out. I was impressed with the camera but I didn't test a few other aspects b/c I don't think it had internet access and the sales clerk was looking over my shoulder most of the time.
For Best Buy to be one of the few exclusive US sellers, they're doing a poor job of it...In other news, I think I'm going to buy the Honor 8! But not from Best Buy!
Fortunately, the best buy exclusive period on blue is about to be over, of it isn't already

I stay away from Best Buy.
No real reason to go there with all the other choices around here.

I genuinely believe Best Buy intentionally hires the dumbest people they interview. I think they think it's funny. 
Mine told me if I wanted to see the Honor 8 I had to purchase it. He said "you wont even have to leave the store, just take it out of the box. If you don't like it we will do a quick return." Neglecting to mention the restocking fee. I said no thanks and ordered from Amazon. 1 month return policy and no fees. 
Last time I was in there, I was picking up a micro SD card in the camera section. Suddenly, a woman appeared and a man with a blue shirt said "here you go" and walked away from the nice lady. She looked confused for a moment, and said to me, "do you know anything about tripods?" I smiled and said, "sure, what do you need it for?" Her response, "I just need something small to hold my phone up." We walked over to the phone accessories area (where she had already been) and I grabbed a small bendy tripod with a universal clamp off the shelf. She was very happy. The same man from before then reappeared and asked, as if he had never seen us before, "do you guys need help with anything?" 
Best buy is the worst

This the exact reason I got my Sony Xperia X that the time retailed for $549, I ended up paying $199. You get the head manager involved over absolute terrible service and get loud about in the store best buy will throw out huge discounts bc they can. The rep in the mobile department wouldn't give me the time of day. Helped me for a minute and literally just walked off while I was asking questions. So I started boiling. She came back and I gave her one more chance. She did the same exact thing. So I didn't just ask for a manger I demanded the man that runs this entire damn store and I want him NOW! So I ask him first why or how does this person in mobile have a job here and in customer service. He said she's their most knowledgeable mobile rep. Then I told him I could give a **** about what she knows. I'm the damn customer and I expect to be served and treated with polite respect. So I will go above your head if you personally don't come to mobile with me right now and help me. I forced him to. He took 50 off and said I'm upgrading you to the Xperia X as I was only grabbing the Xperia XA $249 phone. I didn't ask directly for him to pop out that type of deal but my intent was to explain to him her pathetic attitude towards me right in front of her face. He then had to do something huge. I typically shop at best buy bc they price match. Plus I like to get my phones immediately rather than wait on shipping. Sad thing is she still works there. There is no customer service left these days. Everyone is lazy and don't care. They don't fear their job loss evident by this. When I'm pushed, I can raise some pretty loud and harsh Caine. I took his deal then I later went back and they priced match my honor 8 to 349. I wanted the Blue and they priced matched a store that's not on their list for me. They now all recognize me are over my back trying to help me now. My next phone will probably be the Nexus 6p but I'll have to order the 64g. I wanted every customer around me go flat off. He calmed me when he gave me such a discount. I agree, the only reason best buy exists is bc they generally keep a good level of stock. Terrible service no doubt.

As with any retail store, service will depend greatly on the rep and, IMO, it is management... If they clamp down on the we employees and force them to care then they will. If not... Then many are just there for the paycheck .
I have stories too but I am not going to rehash them here. Main point is it isn't only best Buy but mwny Stores in general... Even the Apple store...

replies.text: Agreed. I technically wanted the Blue Color and Best Buy had two left. They priced matched for me so I got it for $349. That's the best deal I could find anyway so since BB had in stock I went ahead and got it. Fun phone. I sat in my car for over an hour in the BB parking lot figuring out all the settings and layout of this tweaked software interface. I like it.

title: Finally got mine, initial impressions

thread.text:
My black Honor 8 is now in hand. Been getting apps downloaded, settings configured. Initial impressions:
1. For the size, it feels very solid. I'm coming from a Nexus 5x (was starting to have major heating issues and some problems), and the Honor 8 is a bit heavier with a great in-hand feel. 
2. Setup was quick and easy, as should be expected. 
3. The look... What can I say that hasn't already been said. This phone is visually a work of art. 
4. Everything runs smoothly on it. 
I'm going to enjoy the honeymoon period with this phone, but I think it's going to be a great daily driver.

thread.text:
I picked up the Blue Sapphire Honor 8 from Best Buy last night, since I needed a new phone quick. And I gotta say, it's pretty awesome, from the smoothness, to the cool features baked into the fingerprint sensor. I've been a fan of Huawei since the original Ascend came to Cricket back when I was in like high school. I'm glad Verizon was being shady and not allowing me to purchase the Z Play outright so I could run it on AT&T, because I would have missed out on this gem. I'm not a camera guy or a specs/benchmark junkie, but I ran through the camera and the DoF app where I can black and white an area of the photo is awesome, and the benchmarks I ran showed it performing better than most flagships minus the Exynos variant Samsungs. Really speaks to benefits of in house production of external and internal components, to me at least.
Now, my only gripes with this phone are minor and can be fixed through an update or accessory makers realizing this device is worth the R&D for accessories.
1. No Tap to Wake or Active Display; I installed Glance Plus to remedy it for the time being (I just wave my hand over the proximity sensor to check time, notifications, etc)
2. No Third Party accessories; I found maybe 2 cases I'm interested in on Amazon, but haven't pulled the trigger yet (I liked the clear AMZER one I used on my LG G5, because it didn't yellow after a while)
3. Would've liked to see maybe a frosted back panel, much like the XPERIA Z5 family, but I'm not broken up over it.
4. When I play music over my Bluetooth system in my Accord, it doesn't display the song info on the either of my head unit screens (I may just have to close and reopen the Apple Music app next time I'm in the car)
But overall I love this phone and what Huawei/Honor is doing to break even more into the US Market. I'm hoping for more of their devices to make it over here, like the Nova and Nova Plus.
In reference to number 4, I haven't had that happen. It lists the song, artist, and album over Bluetooth for me. But I'm using google play music.

replies.text: I'm wondering if this is app dependent. I have no issues with SoundCloud but I do have issues with another music app I use. It works just fine with Spotify too.
Yeah, I'll probably test Google Play Music and other apps. I probably shouldn't have put it as a gripe, but more of a occurrence I came across

Just wanted to follow up on the previous comments I made regarding BT issues with streaming music; I've only been using Spotify on my Honor 8 and it's worked fine at streaming music, including displaying the song info, on my car stereo.
Last night, I decided I'd give Apple Music another try (I check it every now and then to see if it's gotten any better from the horrible mess it started out as). I tried it with my car stereo this morning and -- guess what -- no song info was displayed. lol
So in this particular instance, I'm thinking this issue may well be with the Apple Music app for Android. It's still in a pretty sketchy state, IMO, so _maybe_ this issue will get fixed with a future update. But that's just me guessing, so who knows for sure? :P

thread.text:
Not seeing your song info displayed while streaming music over BT is, unfortunately, a pretty common problem. BT is just too finicky in terms of how well it works for this function, so it's a real luck of the draw situation that's totally dependent on the 2 BT devices you're using and how well they can talk to each other. :/
EDIT: just wanted to add that you MIGHT be able to get the song info displayed by using a different music app, but if this issue is indeed caused by an issue at the BT protocol level, you prolly won't have much luck getting it to work regardless of the app.
I've only tried Pandora, but song info and album art are showing up fine in my Subaru.
Interesting . glad to hear that it is an app issue,not a phone issue

Ok, been using the Honor 8 for 2 days now. One thing I've noticed with the autobrightness is it tries to hit the lowest visible for the lighting. In my bedroom, it drops to the lowest setting. In my office, it's at about 35-40%. The times I've had it be lower than was really visible was usually due to the light sensor facing away from any light source.

replies.text: The light source issue is pretty normal for most smartphones...you can buy a phone with a rear ambient light sensor but it would cost you double what the honor 8 costs

thread.text: Found another trick in the manual. From shortcuts, you can press and hold WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS etc to jump to those settings.

replies.text: Ooh very cool, thanks for sharing!
That's pretty awesome! I love that feature.

thread.text: So far so good with the Honor 8. Let's see how the battery life holds up once I fire up all the installed apps one by one :-)

A week and a half of using the Honor 8, and I have to say I love it. It's fast, stable, the screen is sharp, battery life is great except for a couple of games I've tried. The smart key, both with gestures and presses, is an implementation that should definitely see more use. The bluetooth on mine has been much more stable than the Nexus 5X I was using previously. WiFi and cell signal has been improved over the Nexus as well. Also, as most of you with it know, you get some curiosity when people see the back glass. 
As for improvements, I'd like to see more themes officially available, and charger availablity, both wall and car. We all are excited to see the improvements in EMUI 5.0.

title: Smartkey / Fingerprint Wake-screen - disable?

thread.text:
Hello, 
I've got an Honor 8 here, and have a quick question. I enjoy unlocking the device with my fingerprint, it's very fast. But, sometimes I am unlocking my phone on accident. Is there a way to set it so I can unlock with my finger print but only after manually waking the screen with a press of a physical button such as the power key or smart key?

I don't see a way to do this after taking a quick look at settings.
I'll dig in and see if there's a setting that enables this.

I don't see a setting either. What about changing the finger you have set up. Maybe use your middle finger or something, it might keep it from accidently hitting the ridiculously fast fingerprint sensor on accident.

replies.text: This is the best (and only) way around this. Touching the fingerprint sensor will make it unlock unless Honor adds a feature to make it work like iOS 10 does by default.

thread.text:
It sounds like you may have the touch or swipe gesture turned "on". This means you can touch or swipe the sensor with any finger to perform common tasks. To disable, follow these steps:
Open [click to enlarge] Settings.
Touch Fingerprint ID.
In the Touch and hold gesture section, turn "off" switches to avoid accidentally opening apps and your phone.
In the Slide gesture section, turn "off" switches for features you don't want to enable.
Show notification panel: Swipe down on the fingerprint sensor using any finger to open the notification panel. Tap the sensor twice to clear all notifications, and swipe up on the sensor to close the notification panel. (NS)

title: Honor 8 SD card portable what to do?

thread.text: Trying to use my SD card as internal storage I have a Honor 8 32g and a 64g SD card Cannot figure out how to put Android apps on SD card. Only music and pics so far.

Did you follow this? Enabling storage adoption in Marshmallow on the Honor 8 - Honor 8 - MoDaCo
Adoptive storage isn't a cure for installing apps on external SD cards. Unless the apps are compiled in such a way, they will always be installed to internal memory, so there is no real saving.

replies.text: Yes, many people fail to understand that. Since the honor 8 is available in 64gb, I would strongly recommend that option for those who think they will even come close to 32gb internal.

thread.text:
Thank you for your question. Unfortunately, if you are looking to format your microSD card and transfer applications, the EMUI on the device will not allow it.
The Honor 8 smartphone is currently running EMUI 4.1. To guarantee your phone's security and system performance, installing or moving applications from the internal storage to a microSD card is not supported. (NS)

title: Booted my device, it started to update, stuck at 5% - error

thread.text:
I have a Honor 8 and when i try to boot it, it starts to update the emui and freezes at 5% with a error message "Please insert otg/sd card or check APP files in 2mins."
No matter what I do it boots back to that error message. I have tried booting in safe mode, held power and volume up/down for 20seconds, I even pushed into the small hole on top of the device with a pin.
Had this phone for 2 weeks and now im stuck here. Any suggestions?
Ahh that doesn't sound good. What happens when you try to plug it to power?
Ok I got it to work. I had to remove the SD card and then just wait, it said that it can not find the update files and then let me reboot normally. Really scared me.
Good, I'm glad to hear this!
And it means that your SD card may be corrupt.
Did you have some other install files on that SD card that the phone may have tried to run?

replies.text: It was fairly new with nothing on it really.

thread.text: Glad to hear it was a simple fix! If it was a cheap card,I would discard it just to be safe

title: Yet another area to tweak app/power settings

thread.text:
Just in case anyone else, like me, totally overlooked this area within Settings, there is a somewhat hidden (IMHO) area where you can go and make apps exempt from this phone's battery optimization. And this is NOT the same thing as going in and "protecting" an app from being cleared from the background.
Here's the path to the Settings area I'm referring to:
Settings-Apps-Advanced-Exempt From Battery Optimization-switch to "all apps" view
Once you go here and switch to the "all apps" view, you'll see you can go through your apps and allow/disallow an app to be exempt from battery optimization.
I totally overlooked this feature because I had never switched to the "all apps" view here. It defaults to showing you just the "allowed" apps and so I thought it was just showing me a list of the apps I had protected from being cleared in the background. (Stupid me). :P
I only just realized this after browsing through the XDA Honor 8 forums and seeing someone complain about certain apps not showing notifications on the Honor 8, even after protecting the apps and making sure their notifications were enabled. This setting was the thing that finally fixed the issue for the user, so it's definitely good to know these settings exist on the phone.
Just wanted to share the info.
Ooh going to check it out, thanks for sharing

Good tip. This is definitely more hidden, but something that people should definitely take a look at.
Thanks for sharing!!!!
That's a great tip!

Excellent!
Thank you ranphi!

Additionally, if you're waiting for an important call but your phone has low battery, enable the Ultra power plan in Phone Manager. This disables everything except essential calling, SMS and contact functions, prolonging battery life.
Open [click to enlarge] Phone Manager. Touch Battery manager > Power plan > Ultra and then select [click to enlarge] > Enable.
Touch Exit to disable the Ultra power plan and restore the original settings. (NS)
Looks like a good tip, though it must have changed since the firmware upgrade. I'm now on FRD-LC9C 432B120 and doesn't have the option beyond Apps>Advanced.

title: How fast / reliable is the fingerprint sensor on the Honor 8?

thread.text: I've had my eye on the Honor 8 but curious, how fast and reliable is the fingerprint sensor on it?

It's pretty darn good. It's fast.
At the moment I have only 'trained' it to read my index finger, it's really the only one I'll need to do so (it falls perfectly on the reader when holding the phone).
You can pick the phone out of your pocket and often already have the phone unlocked before you're even looking at it. The tactile feedback and location of the sensor makes it very easy.
And yeah... it's fast. Love it.
I would assume it would be equal to or better than my 5x, meaning very very good.I liked it better than my note 7 fps, in terms of accuracy

It is almost shockingly fast and reactive. If I am not mistaken the phone has a low power chip dedicated to things like the fingerprint sensor. My previous experience with the Galaxy S6 is night and day comparison, it would often fail. This phone has never failed.

It's blazing fast. Seems faster than the 5X.
I really like it!

replies.text: That's amazing! The 5x was super fast already
It is just as fast and reliable as the 6P.

thread.text: It is very fast and accurate. I only have one finger trained on it and so far no errors.

I have both pointer fingers registered because I like to be able to unlock the phone regardless of how I pick it up. This is definitely one of the most accurate fingerprint sensors I have used. The fact that it is more of a button (think iPhone home button) than just a static sensor makes it easier for me.
I have never had an issue unlocking the phone, it pretty much opens it first try everytime.
I prefer the static sensor in the HTC 10 myself. To each his own of course.

replies.text:
Just in case you don't know... the fingerprint-reading on the Honor 8 doesn't require you to click/press-in the button. You can just rest your fingertip against the sensor and it reads it and unlocks your phone. You only have to click/press-in the sensor button when you want to activate one of the custom "smart key" functions.
So as far as just reading your fingertip/unlocking the phone, it operates the same as the fingerprint sensor on the HTC 10.
Oh okay,that's good to know!

thread.text: Yeah it is actually more accurate for instance compared to the S6 which does not always recognise your thumb.

Crazy fast... Almost makes you wonder if it is working! I've been using an S7 the last few days and its night vs day! I'm going with the S7 but I really hate the FP sensor compared to the Honor! I'm going to sell my honor 8 but the fingerprint sensor is not the reason!

We appreciate the feedback on the Honor 8 device! The Honor 8 has a rapid, smart file-processing system for a smooth user experience. Thanks to the latest fingerprint technology, you can unlock your Honor 8 in only 0.4 seconds. The auto-learning skills of the fingerprint sensor improve the recognition of your fingerprint over time. Enjoy your new phone! (NS)

title: Battery issues

thread.text:
Okay, my wife has had her honor for a few days and she works in the medical field. Service in buildings are great and she came home from work with a little over 20% battery left on her Honor 8. She used it for maybe 35 minutes today at lunch and right after work but what in the world is causing this? 
Are there any tips you recommend to help with the battery life? The phone was on the lower screen resolution when this happened so im not sure what to do now. Thanks guys!
Check her power plan. What is it set to? Does she have any apps whitelisted?
she has it set to the performance, but still....80% from sitting in her pocket for 8 hours? She disabled apps running in the background because facebook and google maps was running in the background.

That's strange. Oh! I just thought of something. 
Go to settings->smart assistance and check if touch-disable mode is on. If it's off, that can be the issue.

This is waaaaay off from what I'm experiencing. Just checking my stats from today, I've been off the charger for 11 hours, with 2 hrs 4 minutes SOT, at 65% left. Yesterday I had much more SOT (4-5) but about 12 hours off the charger with 25% left.
The battery monitor should tell you what's using most of your power. You can also try GSam battery monitor, I've used it for years to find bad apps.
I would try to use wakelock Detector to see if someone app is keeping the phone awake

My battery life has been amazing. Getting average of 5.5 Hours SOT and lasting early morning to nearly bed time. using Smart battery settings and no auto brightness. Set it at just under 50% brightness. Coming from Samsung where I always had to bend over backwards and turn everything off to get good battery life I'm impressed. I optimize a few times a day but that's it. Able to run actual apps like Facebook etc that are power hungry where I always used through browser on my Note 5 because they sucked battery.

replies.text: On the note 5, Samsung sometimes won't kick apps that have used too much resources out of memory.on the note 7, Samsung does do this...so your experience might be better if you had a note 7 vs a note 5

thread.text: If its a brand new device maybe it was still syncing everything, being in poor reception would cause it to drain pretty awfully. I usually don't use a device until I have fully updated and synced all my apps/contacts/etc, if I also transfer my sms this can take hours.

replies.text: Op said service was great.

thread.text:
Thanks guys. We did s little tweaking on the phone and turned off a few things. When she got off today she had 80% left which is much better than 20-25% the day before. 
We turned off Bluetooth, wifi, and turned off the searching for printer.

replies.text: It could be the printer, but check that touch-disable mode. I have WiFi on all the time without any issues. Hopefully you will find something that works for her.

thread.text:
@Jcblack - glad you were able to get things fixed up. I haven't experienced any issues like what you were having... so strange.
@libra89 - such great support from you in this thread! Thanks for sharing your time and knowledge!!
+1 to what James said . Libra89 has been very helpful,not only in this thread but in the honor 8 forum!
There is a advanced settings->battery manager->protected apps. Here if you enable the apps they will continue to run even if you jump to another app.

replies.text: Or you can enable the minimum needed,so as to optimize battery life

thread.text: I'm at 84% right now and 42 minutes SOT. Mostly Tapatalk and Chrome usage. A bit of Instagram, Flipboard, Camera and Play Newsstand.

After a few more days with the honor 8, SOT is great with videos or web browsing. But battery drops quite quickly when using Bluetooth (maybe this is normal, but I've never really noticed) 
Currently, I've been unplugged for 6 hours, 1 hour 45 minutes SOT (almost exclusively web browsing) and 1 hour with Pandora playing over Bluetooth, with 75% battery remaining. Most of that drained while Pandora was on. 
I'd like to test how many hours of SOT I can manage with just web browsing... But I don't have enough time to do that

replies.text: Fitbit app has been causing some drain, there is some issues syncing my alta to my device. I suspect this is an issue with the fitbit and the app continually retrying connect to the device though, I do not think it is a fault of the phone.

Probably the device, or just the nature of the Bluetooth system. I never really noticed quick drain like this on my other phones, but I always had them plugged in in my car. Who knows. 
Random update on today's battery life: with 1 hr of Bluetooth streaming, 20 minutes of YouTube streaming, and 5 hours 15 minutes SOT. I'm at 32% battery, with 11 hours 48 minutes off the charger. 
Gsam says my highest SOT was 7 hours 14 minutes. That may be true, but that wasnt over the course of a whole day. Rather a 4-5 hour set-up-binge followed by some web browsing. No calling or video or camera. 
So that's what I'm seeing with this battery. My max SOT from my moto x was just over 3 hours. And avg over the course of two years was under 2 hours. Needless to say, I'm pretty happy with the Honor 8's battery (even if it could have been even bigger) .

thread.text:

Close to twenty hours (11 hours of constant use i.e. changing settings, camera, web, video, downloads, mobile data, a few phone calls, display at 50%)
39 protected apps and 6 e-mail accounts updating all day also
There's a few more apps I haven't run yet that I know gobble power.

title: Honor 8 Bug/Dislikes reports

thread.text:
Alright, now that I have my phone for a week and the shiny new toy syndrome has faded away let's address current bugs. This is not to bash Honor but hopefully they read these and can begin to address our issues...
Bugs:
1. This week I have the dishonor of having my video playback halted. ESPN videos were black but the audio played, YouTube videos would not play, but the sound would play when turn off the screen, and video from other sites would not open.
Apparently I'm not the only one with this issue. I have read one reviews comments that states he ran into the issue as well. 
The fix is a reboot....no bueno.
Fortunately...the only Bug for me.
Dislikes, or really things I would like to see implemented differently:
1. Option for app drawer (I like it surprisingly as it is, but an option would be nice)
2. Camera speed can be a little slow snap and the shutter speed can cause some slight blur.
3. Official accessories are minimal. (aupport us Honor, we will support you. We did buy the phone, show us love)
4. Make more colors available to the US market. Luv to have had the black Option.
5. Better GPU and processor... Dine with it as is, but I'm tired of people pointing at scores when real life performance is what matters.
Really that's it. I honestly fins this phone to be near perfect "for me". Size is good, weight and density are great, camera is pretty good, software to me is right where I would want save for the app drawer option. This things scrolls about as smooth as 6p and better than it when it comes to Chrome.
Posted from my Honor 8, stock UI, Google Keyboard.
In reference to #5, I'm curious how the Honor 8 does on Geekbench 4 since it's supposed to be more accurate.

replies.text: Judging by what I've seen comma I would not expect the score to be amazingly better. It still boils down to this phone performing admirably. I have yet to experience any Slowdown outside of what would occur on any phone to include the iPhone.
Currently on an iPhone 7 Plus...it definitely has it's flaws.

Every OS, mobile or otherwise, has its flaws. As does every mobile device. I've used both Android and iOS throughout the years and neither of them are anywhere near perfect. 
But perfect is an unrealistic expectation, really. You need to go with whatever device or OS fits you best (which is sometimes not an easy choice).
That's so true. Many people think that the iPhone is infallible

thread.text:
In regard to number 1. This is becoming freaking annoying😠. I love this phone but if they don't find a fix for this soon....I'm bailing.
A YouTube savage....kinda disturbed that I have to keep rebooting. 😠😠😤😤😭😭

Im wondering if the Honor follows USB Power Delivery 2.0 standards like the 6p is reported to do? If so it should be pretty flexible on amps vs volts as long as the charger is compliant (USB Power Delivery 2.0) you could use anything under 100w. The phone and charger should "shake hands" and agree upon the correct current to send and accept. title: Glass replacement only covers damage for Honor 8

thread.text:
In case you were curious to know how it goes for the 3 month glass replacement on the front and back of the phone, it only covers actual damage. 
I asked a rep about this and here's how it went. The bolded parts are really the important parts.
So scratches are considered wear and tear, but cracks are covered is how it sounds.

replies.text: Yeah, I'm sure that you are correct here.

thread.text: Which makes sense. They don't want to be replacing so much glass just for scratches.

replies.text: In that way, it does make a lot of sense. I kind of wish I knew that it would be this way beforehand. thread.text: That is correct. Unfortunately, our Limited Warranty (limited-warranty) doesn't cover physical damage. The warranty protects the 8 from material defects, including improper or inferior workmanship, materials, and design, during the designated warranty period (12 months from the date of purchase). (ED)

This is one of multiple reasons that I actually don't prefer glass for the backside of a phone. While it may look snazzy, it's very prone to scratching and cracking, not to mention how incredibly slippery it tends to be. Don't get me wrong, I fully admit that I love the looks of my Honor 8 (though that's primarily because of the Sapphire Blue color they used). But all that glass covering it? Just a bad accident waiting to happen, IMHO. :P

title: Honor 8 vs Galaxy S7 – Which did I Choose?

thread.text:
This is a quick opinion piece on what phone I came from and which one I’m going to. This is my OPINION not a spec shoot out or a scientific test. I came from a Nexus 6p and tried real hard to love the size of the phone but it was just too big for me. I like a pocket-able phone that can be used one handed quickly. So I ended up buying an Honor 8…. It seemed to be kismet given the timing of my decision to buy a new phone and the Honor 8’s release. 
The Honor 8 wins’ hands down on everything from fingerprint sensor to looks. I will say the stock launcher is a little worse than the Galaxy IF you are already used to using android. If you are coming from iOS, I think it’s a great UI to start with. I personally use google now launcher for all of my phones. Did I mention this phone is beautiful? It really is, there is something about it. The day to day is nice, fast fingerprint recognition which is akin to my 6p, “smart button” features are awesome, and I have no problem getting through a day on a single charge. 
Then came the S7. It quite literally fell in my lap and after a few days of use I came to realize the S7 is the phone for me. Mainly due to the ridiculously fast camera focus, IS, and just a touch smaller which works for my hobbit hands. The fingerprint reader feels clunky and only works about 60% of the time on the first try… I will really miss USB-C as well. For me it was all about the camera. I have a 5-year-old and it’s hard enough to get a shot in time without having to worry about good technique and focus prediction. 
Anyways, I’ll be selling my Honor and keeping the S7… Which tbh kind of hurts just thinking about it. But I know someone will really enjoy the phone and I don’t want it to sit in a drawer for the foreseeable future.

replies.text: S7 is really a great choice. I too love clicking on my smartphone and if you ask me I would also choose the galaxy S7 not for it's comfort in holding but only for its camera. title: iPhone 7+ vs Honor 8: Battle of Bokeh (from iMore)

thread.text:
Check this out from Android Central's sister site, iMore:iPhone 7 Plus vs Honor 8: Battle of the (fake) Bokeh! | iMore
It's pretty cool. Daniel Bader was the one that shot this by the way. Thoughts?
I'm really impressed with the iPhone 7 Plus on this feature, honestly didn't know the Honor 8 had it

The shootout was about even. When the iPhone stumbled on a picture, the Honor did well, and vice versa.
Take the first shot of the street sign. While the lighting may be more accurate on the iPhone, the picture on the Honor looks more sharp.

This stood out:You can see how differently the iPhone frames the photo, since you as a shooter need to be much further back than with the Honor 8 to account for the longer lens. Taking a photo from further back feels much more natural, since your phone physically isn't in the face of the person being photographed — I didn't realize how much of a difference this made until I started taking portraits with the 7 Plus.

I don't have an honor 8,but on my iPhone 7 Plus, the issue I have is no ois on the telephoto lens.if you have a fixed object,or an object that can sit still then it is fine.but 2x optical combined with no ois on a young fidgety child will cause the child to blur quite often especially in indoor situations with less than ideal lighting. Also,even at the right distance,you need to get a good focus or the iPhone will just take a regular picture with the telephoto lens.again,can be tricky with a fidgety young child 
I also noticed that images tended to be a little grainy on the iPhone 7 Plus indoors, no doubt due to f2.8. I am OK with the grain, and am personally more concerned with the blur of the object as discussed above

replies.text: I will do a comparo when my iPhone 7+ shows up. If I can pry the i7 from my wife for a few hours, I will try and do a comparo with it as well.

title: Thinking of making the switch, worth it?

thread.text: So I have been a long time lurker, and recently using an iPhone (used many androids in the past), and was wondering how the honor 8 is holding up? Looks like a great phone, but being that I just recently will be switching from verizon, I do not have much experience with Huawei outside of the 6P. For those who have it, how does it seem to be holding up in day to day use?

replies.text: Honor 8 is a great phone indeed. Huawei was the one who made the Nexus 6P and if you like it then definitely your gonna love the honor 8. Great phone with good looks and a great camera. All that at a reasonable price too. Go for it.

thread.text: It's a star. Cameras are good, battery life is great, day to day performance I never have any issues. The fingerprint scanner is great and fast. For some reason, I keep having a lot of apps open and no issues switching between them.

I would also add that I think that honor made this phone with the Apple user in mind... Many things look very similar to ios. Imo, if you were switching from ios to Android then the honor 8 would be a good place to start
Great phone is all I have to say. Take it back if you don't like it, but I suspect you will.

This is the best phone I have owned. Better than HTC one m7, 9 and A9. I have found nothing negative about it. The software is excellent. I am running Google's launcher which has an APP drawer and pure Android function.
Great phone. I highly recommend it to anyone. My lonely issues is no wifi calling. I even really like the stock UI.

replies.text:
Try the Google hangouts dialer.
I have it on my honor 5X and it is working very well for me.

Thanks for the tip. I will give it a try. I just got my HTC 10 and I still have a couple of days before I have to send my beloved Honor 8 back. I the hangouts dialer work for me I will keep the Honor and send the HTC back.

thread.text: I switched from a Nexus 5x, and actually enjoy the Honor 8 more.

I'm in the same boat as the OP. Been looking at this thing for awhile now. I'd really like to pick one up. But I can't find any skins or anything for it. Anyone got any leads on skins and minimal cases? Don't want to damage this baby.

replies.text: Might be some helpful info here:http://forums.androidcentral.com/hon...es-covers.html

thread.text: I am so tempted to try one based on what you guys are saying hopefully honor will make one compatible with Verizon

replies.text:
This was a problem for me as well. I ditched t-mobile for page plus (verizon mvno) two years ago and never wanted to go back. Luckily t-mobile has improved quite a bit in my area and I haven't had so many problems. Unfortunately this isn't true for everybody. 
As far as the phone goes, it's hard not to love it. I'm so glad I gave it a shot. Even if the pixels come in at $400 (they're more likely starting at $650) I'd stay with Honor. I love the features, and Honor has already rolled out a security patch, just for the hell of it. No other oem does that. Worst case scenario you can return it, but I don't think you will!
Samsung has actually been really good at releasing security patches. I had the s7 edge and the note 7 and both were either up to date or at most a month behind.if course they also cost a lot more

thread.text:
This is probably one of the best Chinese phones I have owned and I have owned pretty much everything from Huawei, Xiaomi, Meizu and some other brands people wouldn't have heard of.
The Honor 8 is even better than the Huawei Mate S - which I used as a daily driver for a couple of months earlier this year. The size is right, the screen is great, battery life is good, you can run all the apps you want without the phone slowing down (sorry I don't play any games on the phone). Fingerprint scanner is probably the best in business and audio isn't too shabby either. Oh and the camera is pretty good regardless of price, especially in manual mode.

replies.text: Just curious as to where you live? I haven't seen those marketed for the usa audience.
California, LA Metro area.
So were the ones you got usa spec?

Not really, max speed you get is H+ on TMO on Xiaomi and Meizu devices. Huawei is a bit different. All the other devices like Elephone etc also get H/H+ and no LTE. Some have Play store installed and others require a bit of monkey business before you can get Google services working without any glitches.

You're a trooper to go down that road. I see a lot of cool phones, but no Band 12 is no deal for me. In my area, especially where I work, it makes the difference between Edge and LTE for me, just better coverage.
Thanks, I love tinkering with devices especially if the price is right!
Same here. Planning on picking up a Moto z droid for around $115 after promotions to play with. My choices are more limited since I have Verizon
Took me a little bit of digging around but on Friday night I fixed a bricked Umi Super phone :-) Working fine now...
Awesome! I love the feeling of fixing something broken!
Yeah no lte would be a deal breaker for me.

title: Best android phones under $400.00

thread.text:
Nice to see the Honor get some praise, but this I think is pretty inaccurate.
"If you're looking for last year's flagship performance at an affordable price point, the Honor 8 is an impressive little package."
From what I have researched the Kirin 950 outperforms the snapdragon 820 on cpu tasks and the snapdragon outperforms in the gpu area. In the real world I find the phone buttery smooth especially compared to SD808 and 810 devices from last year.
Where was that from?

replies.text: The blog: Best Android Phone Under $400 | Android Central

Was that article rewritten to include the honor?
"Ooops" I'm thinking of the one about "the best 5.2 inch phones"

It's okay, I wonder how they came up with some of these lists, even though I agree with their lists to an extent.
Glad to see the Honor 8 there (I mean the linked list) too.
Ah didn't see that one yet. Glad to see that the honor 8 was included

thread.text:
I disagree with "last years performance". The Honor 8 benchmarks higher than SD820 phones in processing speeds.
I'm a little annoyed with the whole "$400 phones are are trying so hard to be good, it's so cute!" crap from phone sites lately. Phones in this price range have been sporting flagship specs at least since the Nexus 4, four years ago.
It isn't "as good as last years phones", it's as good as this years phones. Just because they aren't charging an arm and a leg doesn't mean it's not as good.
Theres no doubt that the Honor 8 is giving you incredible value for money. It seems this $399 price going is becoming a really competitive market and challenging the high end $600+ devices

replies.text: The market has gotten a lot more competitive for sure.I just picked up a Verizon Moto z play for $208 with coupon,and it is pretty hard for me to say that the note 7 is worth 3-4x as much.

title: What security patch is the Honor 8 on?

thread.text: Are they on the most recent update or a few behind?

replies.text: September 1st security patch. I received the update earlier today.

thread.text:
Hopefully one of the guys with the Honor 8 can help,but you should also know that honor committed to quarterly security updates 
Honor 8 to receive quarterly security patches
This is great news! According to a Huawei employee, the Honor 8 will be receiving security patches, and general improvements at least quarterly for the first year. Updating the phone "in a timely manner" through at least the second year... And "as needed" moving beyond 2 years. I'm very glad to see an OEM make a commitment to ongoing software support. It isn't full on Nexus level support, but it's a heck of a lot better than the other guys' support plan. 
What do you think, does this make the phone more appealing? I'm sure the next Nexus will be great, but I don't know if the price difference will be worth it with such similar hardware- may just order one of these!
Really excited to share this #honor8 news! Our customers asked for enhanced software support and we are going to deliver. 
Honor is committed to providing the best possible experience for our customers.
From this year we are making a commitment to provide customers with access to new features (at least once every three months during the first 12 months) for up to 24 months following each product launch. We will keep providing access to security and software updates to fix bugs and enhance user experience in a timely manner. Beyond this period we will continue to provide updates in response to any threats to user safety and security. Our goal is to ensure customers have the best and safest possible experience on their Honor device.﻿
[url=https://plus.google.com/+TaylorWimberly/posts/FwiB7hZsGj9]https://plus.google.com/+TaylorWimberly/posts/FwiB7hZsGj9https://r.tapatalk.com/shareLink?url...re_pid=5347536
It's on the July security update, which is what it comes with out of the box. There haven't yet been any updates pushed to this phone.

replies.text: Hopefully we will see something in the next month or two

thread.text:
I'd be very happy to see a security patch soon or emui 5 before the end of the year... But I don't really think we should expect anything until December or January. It only shipped this month, and we've been told to expect updates quarterly- that would put us at the very end of the year or early 2017.
It does take time to rebuild the OS and get it stable, so don't expect the latest and greatest patch level whenever the next update comes, either.

replies.text: While just released here, the device was released in China in July. I would expect an update for the device to start rolling out sometime October-November

thread.text: Awesome!

title: Honor 8 camera is the same as P9?

thread.text:
I thing it is BUT in some reviews I saw, shots in p9 looks a little better...
any comments?

replies.text: Similar setup, but P9 has Leica branded stuff. They both have the 12MP Sony IMX 286 sensor. Also the same pixel size of 1.25 microns for either camera.

thread.text:
There is some debate regarding this. Some people say that due to the lack of Leica branding the honor 8 uses different firmware. One thing people say is that if you cover the monochrome sensor on the 8 it doesn't seem to do anything, but on my device it tells me to take me finger off the lens. 
The camera app on the honor 8 is missing some of the same options, if it doesn't have the exact same camera options it could change the outcome of photos. 
The processor on the 8 is slightly slower, that could mean the image capture is slightly slower which would impact photos too.
Overall though at worst the images are only a little worse than the P9, and the Honor 8 does have some pretty decent photos. It especially does well with balancing the light and dark areas of a photo.
On the function the only difference is P9 have monochrome mode. Honor 8 you need to use the filter.

replies.text: Thanks for clarifying that. Most reviewers have seemed to miss that point.
That's great to hear!

title: Anyone using the Smart Key feature?

thread.text:
I only have the Press and hold for Google set up, and still never remember to use it.
I use the swipe for notification shade regularly, but can't get in the habit of using the Smart Key features.
Anyone else have it set up and use it regularly? If so, which apps are you using it for?
I have the flashlight on press, and Google app on double press.
When you say smart key features,are you referring to gestures using the home button?
In the software you can set up actions for "Smart Key". It is essentially different tasks that the fingerprint sensor can do. Like if you press and hold, or double press, etc.

replies.text: OK,just wanted to make sure..I knew about the functionality but didn't know the exact name

thread.text:
I use it and think it's a very handy little feature. On mine:
One press activates the camera. 
Press and hold takes a screenshot. 
Two presses activates the flashlight.
I've got single click for flashlight, double for camera, and hold for chrome. Already getting used to it, such a great feature IMO.

Single click for camera (as the double click volume only works with display is off) and double click for flash light. I think I'll do press and hold for google search but not 100% sure if I like that idea yet or not. I use a TON of reminders through google now but I dont know if it will trigger too much by accident.

This thread is making me want to set it up now. This is so cool.
For now, single press for flashlight, double for camera and hold for voice search. Might change that around.

title: Does anyone use the battery saving features?

thread.text:
The first thing I did do is whitelist all the apps because I do not want to miss notifications etc. But I am doing a few things depending on what part of my day it is.
At Work, checking notifications and listening to music/podcasts
Power Plan: Smart
ROG: Enabled
At a concert with poor reception but still taking pictures
Power Plan: Smart
ROG: Disabled
Home, playing games, watching videos, surfing the social media seas
Power Plan: Performance
ROG: Disabled
I find that the ROG being enabled just makes the screen a little darker and less sharp to my eyes but perfectly fine for text messages and selecting playlists etc. The smart mode doesn't have a huge drag on my performance unless I am doing it a lot, it also doesn't seem to noticeably slow down the finger print sensor.

I also have all of my apps "protected" from being put to sleep. The default setup of this phone is much too aggressive about "killing" apps to try and save battery power, IMO.
In fact, I had a bout of bad battery life because of the way this phone wants to make apps go to sleep. It was apparently putting some Google app to sleep (I'm not sure which one it was because I installed a number of apps at the same time) and when it put one of these Google apps to sleep, the "AndroidSystem" battery use went through the roof. It was at the top of the list for battery usage and was hitting my battery hard.
I then switched to protecting all of my apps from being put to sleep and the problem went away.
And I still get great battery life this way, so for me there's really no need to have this phone try to be so aggressive with conserving the battery from app usage.
I set all my phones to full performance unless I will be far from a charger for an extended period of time

I keep it on Smart all the time, haven't had any issues. I only set ROG if I'm out and my battery is between 20-28%. As you said, there really isn't a big difference with it on. It seems like ROG adds an hour to your battery life. I always get over a day without doing any additional work. 
As for notifications, I get them anyway, I just whitelist the apps that I want them from since it is just a few that I need them for (like 12).

I've had mine off the charger since maybe 11 pm last night and haven't charged it since. Using Smart saving settings. With mixed usage at the office I've gotten over five hours of SoT with like 20% left with 5 minutes left in my day before going home.
That's pretty decent battery life!

It appears that the Honor 8 supports 256GB of expandable storage. Just a heads up! The 32GB is enough for me, I also use expandable storage for media only

replies.text: I would advise against adoptable storage, unless you are really in a bind. The draw backs are significant, and $50 more isn't going to break the bank, if you really need 64gb internal
You do have a great point. I'm personally not a fan of it. It's nice but such a hassle.

To me it makes sense on 4gb or 8gb phones, maybe 16gb. AND only if you can't afford more internal storage. I mean... If you only have $50 to spend then your choices are limited. If you are paying $400 AND there's a 64gb option for $50 more... Then get the 64gb. Or downgrade to the Moto g4 plus 64gb model... Personally I would take a slightly lower specd phone but not have to deal with adoptable storage.

I used adaptable storage on my moto x pure. I twice lost all my apps when the phone refused to recognize them on the card. I also had some app incompatibilities. If google continues to support the feature we may see improved performance over time.
Right... It can cause problems plus it is keyed only to your phone... Lose the phone and you won't be able to retrieve the data

title: Android launcher for Honor 8

thread.text: For those folks out there that would like their Honor 8 to have a regular Android look and function. make sure you have Google now launcher and then in settings go to Apps, then at the bottom left select advanced. Next go to default app settings, next select App launcher then select Google App. When you go back to your home page you will have an App drawer and the normal Android look and function. Give it a try. If you don't like it go back to the launcher page in settings and select Huawei home which is the only other selection. I have not tried using other launcher but they may work the same way.

Emui launcher is the worst. Nova will be the first thing I do when I get my phone tomorrow. There's really nothing you can do at the moment about the settings menu look or the notification menu.
If you've never tried any other launchers, give Nova (free) a shot. The customizability is a huge bonus. You can increase/decrease the grid to size you can add more icons, use a scrolling bottom dock, and many other cool things. Action launcher is pretty good too. The launchers wont interfere with Huawei's features, just the look of the desktop.

replies.text: Nova is simply the best

thread.text: I always use the google now launcher and keyboard on my devices. They generally seem to work the best and have the most features I care about and both receive fairly frequent updates.

Thanks for sharing this, that is pretty cool.
There's also the Stockify emui theme in the play store, but in this case, I'm not sure which one is better.

replies.text: I didn't know EMUI themes were a thing. I looked into it, and I stand corrected. You *can* change the settings/notification design via themes. Just found this on xda, it isn't 100% stock looking, but it's closer. I like it, looks much less like iOS. Nova on top of this will be a winner. Can't wait to try it.[THEME][EMUI] MATERIAL VUi (UPATED 14/09/16) | Honor 8
Let us know how that is for you. I just changed the font only and I am liking that so much. I can only imagine how this works.

Yup, I've been running both the VUI theme from XDA and Nova Launcher (though I just switched to Action Launcher the other day) since I got the phone on release day. I gave EMUI about half a day of usage and just couldn't stand it. haha

thread.text:
Axon 7 is best if you want good audio without a portable amp (most people wont care, or even notice a difference besides, maybe volume).
1+3 is best if you want the best hardware specs, best quick charge tech out there.
Honor 8 is best for photos and one-handed use.
Other things to consider... 1+ has the worst software developers in the business (2 months in and the phone still isn't stable, really?). But if you prefer roms put together by 15 year olds you found on the internet, you're golden, they have a lot of those.
ZTE has bad radios and weird implementation of capacitive buttons.
Honor has the ugliest display, EMUI is kind of ugly, and it really should have wireless charging.
Personally I think Honor is the best. I use my phone almost exclusively for web browsing and photos. It has the quickest processor and best camera. I wish it were 5.5 inch, but it is what it is. I'm a fan of all the extra features included with EMUI, even if the notification bar isn't really ideal. Honestly, stock android look + EMUI features would be a pretty big win for the next OS. If this phone had wireless charging it would be a no-brainer in my book... But I still think it has the edge otherwise.

I went with the Honor 8 Best Buy I had gift cards got 100 off. OP3 they didn't carry I have no regrets with Honor 8 A few minor issues cannot move Apps to SD Card they said their aware of it in a upcoming fix It's a good solid phone LTE good connection on At&t. title: Is Honor 8 a better value than iPhone 7?

thread.text: I saw the Honor 8 at Best Buy and really liked it. However, it seems like it is priced to high. If I bought an Honor 8, in a couple years I probably would get like $35 trade in value for it. Compared to an iPhone 7 32 Gb, which cost $650, I would get at least $200 for. So the money I save up front for the Honor 8, I would lose in a couple of years when I trade it in. Also, if the iPhone 7 breaks, I can go to a Apple store and get a replacement under warranty. If the Honor 8 breaks, I'm out of a phone. I really like the Honor 8, I am hoping they drop the price by $100 like they did with their watch. I own the Huawei watch and got it because it was such a good deal. The Honor 8 not so much...yet. Does anyone think the Honor 8 is a better value than a iPhone 7, S7, G5, etc.? If the value is the same, isn't the iPhone 7 the automatic winner because of specs and software updates?

replies.text:
My wife just switched over from an iPhone 6 to the Honor 8. She loves her honor more than the iPhone for a few reasons. Battery life, Android wear capabilities with the gear s2, call quality is better, and the camera on the Honor is better. 
It's a big transition for her since she's been on iOS for about 5-6 years now, but overall she is happy.
I really think that they are trying to pull in ios users, especially with the way their UI is.
I agree with that statement. It looks just like an iPhone, which is fine by me.
Personally, I wished that they put the fps on the front like the iPhone.

There is a ton of promotions right now, at newegg you can get a free pair of JBL headphones and everywhere is offering a case. The headphones you could probably sell for at least 50-60 bucks helping with the sting of purchase. At the end of the day this phone doesnt change the difference between apple and android, its more or less going to be the same. If you can stomach the cost of entry for ios and thats the os you prefer go for it. If not, the 8 seems to be a solid and fairly well reviewed device. Black Friday is around the corner and I am sure you can get this phone for a significant discount if you choose to wait too.

I wonder if it could hit $300 on Black Friday. Considering that there are deals $350 now... I would say it is possible. 
Of course you can get an iPhone 7 for $350 with a bit of work and commitment too...
If you can finagle an iPhone 7 at that price you could easily sell it for profit and buy the Honor 7 at a steep discount.

Well , you would need to be in finance contract, and many won't buy a used device on a finance contract because they would have a brick if the original purchaser decided to stop paying off the device. Certain places also don't allow you to sell devices on finance contract.

Don't forget Uncle Sam...That $650 figure you're using (depending on ur state) could easily be another 40+ bucks in taxes... And ya won't recoup that when you resell....
And where is it selling for $650.00? i thought the 32 GB version was starting @ $749.00...Maybe you meant iphone 6s? or did i read wrong (which happens all the time- i'm a skimmer : )
BTC

Iphone 7 32gb is $649.
128gb is $749.

Oh my bad... i didn't know he was comparing a 4.7 inch to a 5.2...Thought he was thinking of getting the 7+... The jump in screen size alone is reason to get the Honor 8 ....Its hard these days to use a 4.7 as a daily driver for EVERYTHING imho....
BTC
I think you have a great point about taxes though. Ugh.
Or just buy it in a state without sales tax.
That's hard to do. B&H does that for me.

Most ppl do the EIP so buying it a state (when the phone is BRAND NEW no less) that won't charge you tax is rarely an option....
Personally, if i purchased phones solely based on resale value i'd still be rockin' a Motorola Razr flip phone...lol
I just calculate the approx loss, split that up into the weeks (yes i said WEEKS...lol) i own it and just rationalize, ,"well it cost me approx 25 to 30 a week to rent this GREAT 'state of the art' piece of tech", then i sell it and its ON TO THE NEXT : )
BTC

Since you mentioned eip (finance contract), Buy a iPhone 6 used for around $300 for trade in, finance contract on the iPhone 7 for free, sell the iPhone 7 for $300 in 2 years... The iphone would essentially be free.

It comes down to personal preference. My wife went from the 5s to the 6 to the SE because she wanted the small size 
But with regards to the 7 plus... It starts at $769

thread.text: I personally will go for honor 8, iOS is quite complex (music transfer, no file manager...etc)

That's understandable, but what if it were a S7 or HTC 10 I was asking about? If there is no difference in value, shouldn't I just get a phone that has better support, specs, and trade-in value? There are alot of really nice mid-range phones out now, but when I think about getting one, I can't justify the cost yet. They cost less, but it doesn't make them a better deal.

Looking at it the way you are looking at it, you should just go with the iPhone. The iPhone is one of the few phones that hold their value very well. There are few Androids that hold their value in the same way.
The Honor 8 is a nice phone, but the way it seems like you are looking at this, there might not be a point of trying the Honor 8.
I guess that is why I am asking. I want an excuse to buy the Honor 8, but can't justify it yet.

650-200 = Loss of $450
400-35= Loss of $365.. or if you don't sell it... loss of $400
So if you're buying a phone based on final cost after you sell it... You're better off buying an Honor 8 and keeping it in a drawer (or donating it) once you're done with it. It drives me nuts when people say, "you will get that money back when you sell it" because you wont.
It sounds like you want an iPhone. IMO the Honor 8 (or, frankly, any of the $400 Android phones) is a better value, because I wont be tortured with iOS and everything else Apple. The hardware you're getting is comparable. It comes down to preference. Not used sale price.

I'm using the iPhone 7 as an example because it just went on sale. Given your numbers, is $85-$100 in savings worth it? My apprehension has to do with the unknown. I have never owned a Honor, OnePlus 3, Axon 7, Moto X type phone. If it were to break I would probably be better off just buying a new one. That would erase any savings in buying one of those brands. Also, over time some phones slow down and need bugs fixed. Will an Honor 8 get software patches and updates like a major brand will? If the Honor 8 were just alittle cheaper it would be a no brainer for me as I like the style, size, and Android OS.

If you are basing it all on resale value, then iPhone is always the way to go. Very few phones hold value like they do. 
There is way more that goes into a purchase though. You'd be better off comparing the Honor 8 to the iPhone SE though as they are around the same price, etc.
With all that said, yes, the Honor 8 is an incredible value. If you are looking for something that will be updated for the full length of two years, and quickly, the iPhone may be the way to go. If you want a cool dual-camera set up and more customization options, the Honor 8 is what I would pick.

The Honor 8 is a better phone than the iPhone SE. I was also comparing it to the iPhone 7 because of the screen size being about the same. Where the SE is smaller. I think I might just get the Honor 8 and chalk it up as a learning experience if I don't like it, but it does seem like a really nice phone to me style wise, camera wise, and with the Nova Launcher attached.

replies.text:
What do you use the phone for? I have an Honor 8 and am currently selling my Samsung s7 Edge and also had a Note 7 which I returned due to battery-gate. I use my phone for both business and personal use. Performance and battery life is important to me and the Honor 8 is better at both, at least in my experience. I also use a lot of google services and staying on the android platform is key for me as those integrate so much better than on iOS. I like that I have more control over what is and isn't on my phone, unfortunately that is not the case on iOS. 
Ultimately I would not buy a phone based on what the resale value would be, I would see what device would better support what I want to use it for.

title: Possible death to carrier flagships

thread.text:
Just picked up my Honor 8 this past Saturday. I must say that I am.more than impressed.
5 pros...5 cons....trust, I have more pros than 5...Just wanted to cap it. 
Pros
1. Perfect size
2. Amazingly smooth even with the its non.traditional take on Android....No lagging
3. The photo editing software is actually really good.
4. Front facing camera is excellent as is the rear shooter (stills not video)
5. Display, display, display...if someone tells you 1080 is not high resolution enough... slow clap their ignorance and whip out the Honor 8.
Cons....
1. Some incompatibilities with apps... I've only run into one but I would suppose their May be others. 
2. Video. It looks fine but optical video stabilization and videos seem to jump.
3. Accessories are scarce...especially in.the good screen protector department.
4.ahhh
